loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom C. lives in the Srey Praseur Village of Kampong Speu Province, where she works as a farmer. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is studying at state school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband (pictured on the left) is a farmer and laborer who can generate a small amount of income to support their family.

Although her family members are engaged in different business activities, they still do not generate enough money to allow them to live in good conditions. In particular, the family would like to build a new house to replace their old house. Thus, Mrs. Mom C. is requesting a loan to supplement her income in order to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To improve her family's standard of living by building a new house for her family.

loans.name: Gloria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Gloria is married and her husband is a bus driver. They have a 4 year old daughter. She started her business because she has always liked working and having her own business. She also wanted to help her husband financially, especially now that they are paying for their house, while still tending to her home and taking care of her daughter. She used to work at a store where she gained a lot of experience. Then over a year ago she started buying merchandise, effectively launching her grocery store.

Gloria is requesting a loan in the amount of $250, that she will pay in 3 months, to purchase merchandise. With your help she can make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Gloria es casada y su esposo es chofer de autobus. Tienen una pequeña de 4 años. Ella inició el negocio porque siempre le ha gustado trabajar y tener su propio negocio y atender su hogar, ademas de ayudarle economicamente a su esposo sin descuidar a su hija , sobre todo por que actualemnte estan pagando su casa. Ella trabajaba como empleada en una tienda, trabajo del cual adquirio experiencia hasta hace mas de un año compro mercancia iniciando su negocio de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia. Con tu ayuda Gloria podra hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Mr. Sun V. is a villager in Dambouk Kokaos Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He uses electricity to charge batteries for the local village. His wife, Mrs. Phally V., is a farmer. They have four children, two of whom are attending school while the others are too young to work or study.

Recently, Mr. Sun V.'s mother died and he does not have enough money to do a funeral, so he decided to ask for a loan to this purpose. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: Do a funeral for his mother.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
For the past seven years, Malohat M. has operated a clothing store in the central market of Shahrituz town. Determined, hard working and enterprising, Malohat has successfully grown her business to provide a stable and consistent income. Currently, she earns over US$ 180 per month in profit.

Malohat is divorced and her business is a valuable source of income for her and her two adorable children. This has been her only income to support and educate her children, and it has not been easy for her to have the entire responsibility for her family. But her love for her children is what drives her forward from day to day.

Malohat wants to continue investing in her business. She is a long-term client at IMON and has successfully used the support of micro-loans to expand her business and generate additional income. Currently, Malohat is seeking a loan of 1000 Somoni (300 USD) with a term of 12 months to increase her inventory. With additional profits, Malohat plans to continue developing her business and become a more successful entrepreneur. Malohat promises to manage the current loan with accuracy as she did all the previous ones and thanks everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Increasing working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 41 years old. In 2004, she joined TYM Fund and borrowed loans to invest in her restaurant. Every day her husband buys raw food from agents and she uses these raw food to make dishes for customers. With high quality dishes, reasonable prices and enthusiastic service, her restaurant always attract a great number of customers and brings about an income of VND 3 million. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 12 million to buy more raw food and kitchen ware for her restaurant.
texts.en:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her restaurant

loans.name: Rosa Imelda

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Imelda, socia del Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Es profesora y complementa su trabajo con la venta de  productos de belleza, trabaja con pedidos. Su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en FONAVI Mz. H – Lt 19 y sus clientes son sus amigos, vecinos de su barrio y familiares. 
 
Con este crédito de S/.1,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos de belleza en oferta como perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños, desodorantes, joyas, esmaltes, lociones, etc. para poder surtir su vitrina y tener en stock sus productos que luego ellas los venderá a precio de catalogo, generándole una mayor ganancia.

Tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con uno de sus hijos que cursa estudios superiores. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer trabajadora y sobre todo decidida. Su meta es la de tener un local donde pueda exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Rosa Imelda is a member of the "Manos Unidas" Community Bank. She lives in San Martin state and province, in Tarapoto district. She is a teacher and complements her work by selling special-order beauty products. Her business is located in her home at Fonavi Manzana, Lot 19. Her clients include her friends, neighbors and relatives. With this loan of 1,000 soles [about US $350] -- which will be paid back in six months -- Rosa plans to purchase sale-priced beauty products such as women's, men's and children's perfume and cologne; deoderants; jewelry; nail polish; lotions, etc. These purchases will ensure her window is well-supplied and her business well-stocked with products that she will sell at catalogue prices, resulting in a greater profit. Rosa is 48 years old and lives with her husband and one of their children, who is currently in high school. Her goal is to have a place where she can display her products.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products (perfume, nail polish, lotion, etc.)

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Maria habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Sabana Grande desde su infancia, tiene 63 años de edad, en su matrimonio procreo once hijos cinco mujeres y seis varones lo cuales son independiente y trabajan, su esposo es comerciante, la Sra. Maria vende ropa, cosmético en su casa desde hace veintiocho años trabaja en las venta que vende al contado y al crédito, ella inicio con dinero propio que su esposo le dio y ahora trabaja con préstamo que Afodenic le atorgado para hacer mejoras a su negocio para seguir invirtiendo, con esta solicitud es la séptima y desea invertir en comprar ropa para niños y adultos para ofertar a sus clientes ya que para estos meses la demanda es bastante buena debido al periodo de la navidad que la personas alistan sus estreno que es la tradición de cada año, lo cual le genera buenos ingresos. A futuro es poder tener un local grande donde pueda tener bastante inventario.
texts.en:
Maria has lived in a neighborhood of the capital city called Sabana Grande since she was an child. She is 63 years old, married with 11 children, five daughter and six sons, all of whom are independent and working. Her husband is a merchant. Maria has been selling clothing and cosmetics in her house for 28 years, to customers paying in full with cash and on credit. She started out with money given to her by her husband and now is working with loans provided to her by AFODENIC to make improvements in her business. With this loan, which is the seventh, she would like to purchase adult and children's clothing to offer to her clients, since during the Christmas season her demand is quite high, during which she earns good income. In the future she would like to open a large location where she will be able to maintain a larger inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's and adult clothing

loans.name: Siv

texts.en:
Mrs. Siv S., 41, is married with two children and lives with her husband in Tboung Khmom district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a housewife, cooking food for her family members, while her husband works as a motor-taxi driver, earning typically US$ 7/day for his household. Her two children are currently employed by a factory and can collectively make around US$ 200 per month.

After hearing about CREDIT MFI from one of her neighbors who is a longtime CREDIT client, Siv S. would like to request a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 to replace her husband’s motor-bike, With any remainder of the loan she hopes to start up a grocery business at home.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to replace his old one

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Zelmira

texts.es: Zelmira tiene 28 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y sus dos hijos  menores de edad. Hace 2 años se dedica a la crianza de animales, ganado que le ayuda a tener grandes ganancias, ya que es más rentable por el consumo de carne de cordero en los mercados. Así también tiene algunas vaquitas, las cuales producen leche y puede venderla en los mercados de la ciudad y en los alrededores donde las ventas son muy buenas, pero para ello tiene que ordeñarlas desde muy temprano para ofrecer leche fresca a los vecinos para sus desayunos. Zelmira está en su 13avo préstamo con MFP, y hasta la fecha no tuvo problemas de pago y sigue siendo una socia estrella en su banco comunal. El dinero solicitado se invertirá en la compra de ganado, los cuales tienen un costo aproximado de 300 soles cada cordero.
texts.en:
Zelmira, 28, is a single mother. She lives with her parents and her two young children. Two years ago, she started a business raising sheep, a business that has helped her increase her earnings because the market pays a premium for lamb. She also has a few cows that produce milk, another product that sells well in the markets in and around the city, but a business that requires her to start very early in the morning because she has to collect the milk and sell it to her customers while it's fresh for their morning breakfasts. This is Zelmira's 13th MFP loan and she's repaid all of her past loans. She's a star among the members of her community bank. The loan will be used to buy sheep which cost around 300 soles per head.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow livestock business.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La  señora Olga Ramona , domiciliada en la compañía Itá 
Potrero   de la  Ciudad  de  Itá, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, Francisco de 38 años quien es electricista y Fabio de 22 años de edad quien está cursando el tercer año de la carrera de derecho.

La misma se desempeña como costurera desde los 12 años de edad, dicho oficio aprendió de su familia, ya que la abuela y la madre eran costureras, pero no contenta decidió estudiar y terminando la Educación Básica estudió tres años Corte y Confección, 2 años manualidades y 1 año para el título de Profesora en Corte y Confección. 
Comenta que a los 16 años ya era muy conocida por sus trabajos, llegando a confeccionar a su corta edad vestidos de novia,  y tuvo que trabajar mucho ya que era la hermana mayor de 10 hermanos a quienes tuvo que mantener porque la madre fue internada en un hospital psiquiátrico.
Mediante un sacerdote Italiano pudo contactar con un comandante de las Fuerzas Aéreas de Italia, quien le ayudó a montar su fábrica de costura firmando un contrato con las Hermanas Redentoristas de Carapeguá quien tiene a su cargo vestir a niños de escasos recursos, trabajando así ya por más de 10 años.
La demanda de la confección de uniformes ha ido aumentando    es por ello que la misma ha puesto su confianza en la Fundación Paraguaya solicitando su apoyo para la adquisición de una máquina de coser nueva y telas, pudiendo así seguir realizando esta labor que con tanto empeño y dedicación lo hace a diario.
texts.en:
Olga Ramona lives in the city of Itá and is a single mother of two children. Francisco is a 38-year-old electrician and Fabio is 22 years old and in his third year of law school. Olga has been a seamstress since she was 12 years old and learned the craft from her grandmother and mother, who were also seamstresses, but she was not content. She decided to go to school and studied three years of sewing and cutting, two years of crafts and one more year to earn the title of professor of sewing and cutting. She says after 16 years she is well known for her work and has made bridal gowns.

She had to work very hard because she was the eldest of 10 siblings, whom she had to provide for because their mother was admitted to a psychiatric hospital. Through an Italian priest, she was able to come in contact with a commander of the Italian Air Force, who helped her set up her sewing shop and sign a contract with a group clothing children of scarce resources. She did this for more than 10 years.

The demand to make uniforms has increased and it's for this reason she has placed her confidence in Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya in supporting her to acquire a new sewing machine and fabrics, which will help her continue carrying out her daily work that she does with such effort and dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong K. is 18 years old and lives with his brother and his mother in the Battambang province. He is not married yet, and works as a construction worker building houses. He makes about US$5 per day. He has requested a loan of US$300 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This will reduce the transportation costs that he pays for every day.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Veuve et mère de cinq (05) enfants, Mme Akou A. s’est lancée dans la production et la vente de l’huile de palme depuis plus de quatre (04) ans. Elle n’opère que dans cette activité très répandue dans sa localité. 
Vaillante et aimant son métier, elle ne dispose pas d’assez de moyens financiers pour la production suffisante de l’huile de palme pour couvrir la demande du marché. Elle sollicite donc pour cela un financement afin d’augmenter sa capacité de production et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akou A. is a widow and the mother of five children. Four years ago, she started producing and selling palm oil, a popular business in her village. This is her only money-making business. Courageous and loving her job, she lacks financial means to produce sufficient amount of palm oil to meet customer demand. She's therefore seeking a loan in order to bolster her production capacity and her profits.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To produce and sell palm oil

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en: Mrs. Jhona M. is 58-years old, married and lives at Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occiedental. She has two children and her husband is a farmer. She helps the family's income by buying and selling various items like root crops, vegetables, or anything she can. She opened up a “sari-sari” store adjacent to their house, and is hoping to raise pigs for sell to increase her income. She became a micro entrepreneur because of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. This coop teaches women to have their own livelihood project to support their husband’s income. She has received several loans. She is requesting a loan to buy feed for her new pig-raising business and to buy goods for her sari-sari store. Her husband is very supportive of her.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and basic commodities/goods for sale

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Mrs. Ruby P., forty-one years old, is a resident of Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro City. She is married and blessed with three children. She runs her mini-grocery store where she sells biscuits, dairy products, soft drinks, a variety of candies, soap and shampoo. Her husband is also contributing an income to their family with his peddling business. Ruby wants to save more for her children's future. She is thanking HSPFI and KIVA lenders for extending assistance to her business. Ruby is now requesting an additional loan of $250 to purchase more stock and to add more merchandise to her store such as rice, beverages and spices.

loans.use: Additional working capital

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Adyabaatar

texts.en: AdyaB. B. is 32, married and the father of two daughters. His eldest daughter goes to a local elementary school. His family lives in a "ger" (traditional nomadic tent) district in UlaanB., the capital city of Mongolia. In 2002 he began to transport food products for stall owners at "Bars", the biggest vegetable wholesale market in UlaanB.. His average monthly income is 700,000 tugrugs ($1 USD=1,400 MNT), average profit is 300,000 tugrugs. His wife, Bolortuya, works at a local grocery store as a saleswoman. With their savings, they bought a plot of land last fall and built a little house by themselves. AdyaB. has also bought a better second hand car. He requests a loan to buy tires and other spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy tires and other spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Noreen Muhammad Zulfiqar Group

texts.en:
Noreen Baji is a wife of M. Z., living in the historical site of Yadgar, in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband runs a laundry business in the community. He has been in this profession for the past four years. Noreen Baji also helps him by washing clothes. She is applying for a loan to buy washing supplies such as washing powder and bleach for her husband's laundry.
Jamila Baji and Sana Baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. 
Rahmat Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a laundry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing sweet potatoes

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 32 years old and a married mother of four children. Currently, three of her children are in school while her firstborn recently completed senior high school.

Gladys is a petty trader and sells foodstuffs for her livelihood. To support her family, she has been selling items such as vegetables, spices, smoked fishes, tubers of yam, maize and gari etc., for five years now. She takes delivery of goods from Kumasi central market and trades them at the community market of Sefwi, where she lives. Gladys is requesting a loan to buy more stock to minimize her frequent travel to Kumasi to buy foodstuffs.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs such as yam, peanuts, beans etc.

loans.name: Fritzie

texts.en:
Fritzie E. raises and sells pigs. She is married and has two children. Before, she handled a tutorial class. She stopped teaching and decided to venture into this kind of business so many years ago now. She shared her dreams: she said that she wants to have her own butcher shop in the town. Now, she uses her house as her own stall where she sells meat to her neighbors.

She would like to apply for a loan of Php 18,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) and will use the loan to buy pig feed. Part of the loan will also be used to buy meat for sale.

Up to now, she has been connected to CEVI’s credit program. She receives loans, training and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs and more meat to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita or "Mercy," as she was fondly called in her village, has a principle in life which is "to be patient in everything you do so that you will reap a fruit of success someday". Despite of the economic crisis, she is still determined to improve her family's standard of living and to give her children a better future.

She is married to Maximo Sr. who works as a carpenter. Mercy manages a little store and sells street foods and snacks in front of their house. She also manages a hog-raising business for additional income. 

She hopes to further develop her small businesses so she wants to borrow PHP 20,000.00 from Kiva. Because sending her children to school is very costly, she aims to increase her income for their education. She and her husband are doing their best for the welfare of their family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian B. is from the village of Zone 1, Luyong Bonbon Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old, and is a widow with three adult children. To make a living, Vivian owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling pork and chicken meat in the local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Vivian joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of her relatives and family members.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Allen

texts.en: Mrs. Allen M., a promising 29-year-old business lady, owns a shop selling used clothes. The shop is located in Kabwohe Trading Centre, where she has been running her business for five years, so far. She is a married woman blessed with two children. Although her husband is an accountant in the sub-county Bushenyi district, he helps her to run the business in his free time. She works hand in hand with him running the shop. She is using this loan to purchase more clothes to enable her to improve upon her business. Her hope is to expand her shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 24 years old she is single and seriously searching for her better half. She lives with her family a small village in the western region of Ghana. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. She is very skillful and a talented hair dresser and has been in business for three years now. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, for the reason she has four apprentices who are learning skills for the future dependency. She wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators etc. to serve her customers. She always saves parts of her savings to cater for any future eventualities.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo, activators etc.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Chhay K., 28, lives with her two young children in the Takeo province. She runs a business from home selling CDs VCDs to earn a living and is able to make about US$1 of profit every day, while her husband is a motor-taxi driver who is able to around US$4 per day. Chhay K. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband so that he can operate a moto-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una diligente ama de casa, casada con un responsable padre de familia. Ellos tienen 2 hijos y viven en una casa alquilada, desde hace 15 años, en un distrito al sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Hace 5 años, junto a su esposo, decidieron implementar una pequeña bodega, para ello alquilaron otro ambiente de la casa donde residen. Ella se hizo cargo de este negocio, con el cual ha podido pagar los estudios de su hijo mayor en la universidad, lo que la llena de motivación para seguir trabajando. Sin embargo a veces no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder hacer crecer aun más su negocio, pues los gastos en casa se han incrementado a medida que sus hijos van creciendo.
María considera que puede progresar con el apoyo de sus hijos, y mediante un préstamo incrementar sus productos para la campaña navideña, ya que su bodega es muy conocida en su localidad por su gentileza con los clientes.

Este es su noveno crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y está segura que la responsabilidad y compromiso en sus pagos garantizarán su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria is a diligent housewife, married to a responsible family man. They have 2 children and have lived in a rented house for 15 years, in a southern district of the city of Lima. Five years ago, together with her husband, they decided to set up a small grocery store, for which they rented another part of the house where they reside. She put herself in charge of this business, with which she has been able to pay for the studies of her older son in college, which fills her with motivation to keep working. However, sometimes she does not have the necessary capital to be able to make her business grow even more, because the expenses at home have increased while her children have grown up. Maria believes she can make progress with the support of her children, and through this loan increase her products for the Christmas season, since her grocery store is very well known in her town for its kindness with the clients. This is her ninth credit with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is sure that responsibility and commitment in her payments will warrant her work.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es: El banco comuna "Las Rosas" esta representado por la señora Carla Daniela y conformada por 12 miembros entusiastas y con ganas D. trabajar los cuales cuentan con sus puestos D. venta D. productos como comida al paso, cosméticos por catalogo y abarrotes en general y a la venta D. ropa. La competencia en la venta D. abarrotes es alta y como son productos perecederos deben disponer D. capital para adquirir insumos y mercadería para ofrecerlos a un precio mas bajo y si se pasa la fecha tope D. sus productos tener capital para poder cambiar D. mercadería a tiempo; esta es la razón D. la obtención del préstamo para una gran mayoría D. las socias el obtener un capital D. apoyo para situaciones imprevista y para incrementar sus ventas abaratando costos al por mayo. En cuanto a al experiencia en grupos solidarios una gran mayoría D. los socios ya cuenta con experiencia en instituciones similares pero ninguna le brindo el apoyo y la confianza que le otorga la fundación para progresar y salir adelante en sus proyectos D. crecimiento y así darles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Las Rosas Communal Bank, represented by Ms. Carla Daniela, is comprised of 12 enthusiastic group members who have the desire to work and who have their own sales stands, selling street food, cosmetics by catalog, provisions, and apparel. There is fierce competition in selling provisions, and because of all their perishable items, sellers must have capital readily available so that they can obtain more goods at a lower price to replace the expired goods in a timely manner. For this reason, most of the members really need this loan so that they can have capital for any exigencies that may arise and so that they can increase their sales by offering wholesale prices. In terms of experience with solidarity groups, most of the members have previously worked with institutes similar to this one, but none has ever given them the support and trust that Fundación gives them so that they can make progress with their plans to grow, thus giving their family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
50-year-old Melanie T. lives in Hda. Panaogao Marland, Brgy IV, Silay City, Negros Occidental. Her husband Anselmo works as a laborer in Hacienda on a sugar-cane plantation.  He earns a minimum salary that depends on the time of year:  during sugar milling season, he works six days a week, but during the off-season he works only three to four days a week. The couple is blessed with four children, ages 21 to 27. They work and contribute to help support the household. Melanie dreams of improving their living, fixing their house, buying productive assets and saving enough to support herself and her husband when they grow old.

She knew that all these dreams would be for naught if she stayed at home and just waited for her husband to hand her his meager salary. She saved enough from her husband's salary to start a small general store selling only the most in-demand household commodities. When she realized that she needed additional capital to sustain her growing business, it was timely that she heard about the microcredit services of NWTF-Project Dungganon. She became a member in 2004 and from that point on, she never looked back but continued to expand and diversify her business activities. Today, in addition to her general store, she has a rice retailing business where most of her customers are the laborers who work on the sugar-cane plantation where they live. They get the rice on credit for their daily needs and pay back at the end of the week when they receive their salary. She has also put up a barbecue stand. She earns a cumulative net profit of PHP 4,400 per month.

Her previous loan of PHP 9,500 was used as additional working capital for her businesses. The loan was fully repaid without delay. Now she is borrowing PHP 19,500 to be used in her general store and for her rice retailing business. She needs this higher capital because sugar milling season has already started and she anticipates a higher demand for all her goods. She will use the income to repair her house and to buy productive assets to be used in her businesses.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store and rice retailling business

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora B. is from the town of Payas, Sta. Barbara, Pangasinan. She is 37 years old and is single. Nora owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Nora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Nora is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn owns and manages a 3-hectare rice field in South Cotabato. She sought financial help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to improve her farm. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs. 

Evelyn is already 54 years old with seven children. She wants to improve her way of living and sustain her family. The loan will be very helpful to maximize the needs of her farm for a better harvest in the future.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Josefa De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Josefa tiene el negocio de verduras en el Mercado la estación en el departamento de León donde vente los diferentes perecederos tales como tomate, lechugas, ajo entre otros. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de más verduras para ofrecerles a sus clientes que a diario la visitan en el mercado.
Es importante destacar que es madre soltera de 4 hijos a los cuales mantiene y están en edad escolar, el crédito le servirá para mejorar su nivel de vida y el de sus hijos a los que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Miss Josefa has a vegetable stand in the market in the station of the department of Leon where she sells different perishables such as tomato, lettuce, and garlic among others. She is requesting a credit to purchase more vegetables so that she can offer them to her clients who visit her daily in the market. It is important to point out that she is a single mother that takes care of her four children who are still in school. The loan will help her improve her quality of life and that of her children whom she loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of banana, potatoes, onions, etc.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge, de 48 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus padres y hermanos. Aunque aún no se ha casado tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.
Desde hace 20 años, en sociedad con su hermana, tiene una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda donde ofrece todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad. Durante el día es ella quien atiende la bodega, mientras él está en su trabajo como técnico en estadística en un centro médico de su localidad. Por ende, cuando llega a su casa, por la tarde, se dedica a la atención de su tienda, de esta forma ambos comparten el trabajo y las ganancias.
Ambas actividades le gustan mucho, ya que se entretiene y puede solventar sus gastos sin problemas, y como él es un hombre muy emprendedor para el futuro quiere tener su propio negocio e instalar un restaurante donde pueda ofrecer diversidad de platos típicos del Perú.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere fallarles a las integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mercadería para surtir mejor su tienda para obtener mayores ganancias y empezar a ahorrar para su futuro restaurante.
texts.en:
Jorge. 48 years old, lives in his own home, near his parents and siblings. Although he has never married he is looking forward to getting ahead in life. For the past 20 years, in a partnership with his sister, he has owned a grocery store in his home where he sells all sorts of basic items. During the day she is the one who attends to the store, while he is in his day job as a statistics technician in a local medical center. When he gets home in the afternoon he looks after the store. This way they both share the work and the earnings. He likes both activities very much, because they keep him entertained and he can meet his expenses without trouble. As he is a very enterprising man, in the future he wants to own his own business, setting up a restaurant where he can serve a variety of Peruvian local dishes. This is his second loan with MFP and he is committed to paying back the loan in a timely manner, because he doesn't want to let the other members of his Communal Bank down. With the money he asks for he will purchase merchandise to stock up his store, obtain better earnings and start saving for his future restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Annmarie Dagpin Group

texts.en:
Annmarie D. is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years-old. Annmarie is the group leader of a two member group loan offered by Kiva partner PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Annmarie is married and has two school-aged children. Annmarie raises pigs for sale and has been engaged in her business for over 10 years. She earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Annmarie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annmarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Annmarie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Annmarie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Bugema B Wabule Base Group

texts.en: W. Base is a hard-working businesswoman of thirty-six, married with six children of whom five are schooling. She deals with produce such as rice and she has been in this business for over fifteen years so far. She is using the loan to inject more capital into her business as well purchasing bags of rice to market. Her future hope is to continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To inject more capital into her business as well purchasing bags of rice for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking and selling cassava flour

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en: Bayarsaihan is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two young sons in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Presently, he operates a meat trading business and a taxi service in his town. He started his meat trading business  in 2004 with a working capital of 300,000 tugrugs (~ 212 USD). In this business, his wife, Ariuntungalag, sells the meat at a local market. They have steadily expanded their business and today, following a lot of hard work, their working capital exceeds 1,000,000 tugrugs (~ 705 USD). In addition to the meat business, he started operating a taxi service business in 2007. This business was started with a car which Bayarsaihan purchased with his meat business profits. He uses his business profit to provide money for the family's expenses. Bayarsaihan is requesting a 1,300,000 tugrug (~ 915 USD) loan to purchase a variety of meats in order to resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is from the village of Digkilaan, iligan City. She is 35 years old. Erlinda is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Balbino

texts.es:
Balbino tiene 56 años, vive en compañía de su esposa Adela (53) y de su hijo único, que aunque es mayor de edad aún los acompaña en casa.

Este simpático y trabajador hombre se dedica a la agricultura desde que era muy joven y vivía con sus padres. Cuando formó su propia familia continuó con su labor agrícola, de la que dice sentirse muy orgulloso, pues con su esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. 
En la actualidad siembra papa en gran cantidad y en menor cantidad alverja, trabaja junto a su hijo y juntos vigilan cada día, durante todas las mañanas, cada un de sus cultivos para evitar que se malogren o les caiga algún tipo de plaga.
Cuando la producción está lista, la vende a los comerciantes mayoristas que le ofrecen buenos precios dependiendo de la calidad de sus productos. Para más adelante tiene pensado sembrar en mayor cantidad papa y aumentar sus ganancias.

Este es el décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Además se muestra muy satisfecho con el trabajo de su banco comunal, ya que todos los integrantes son responsables y organizados, es por eso que son los mejores de su zona y desean seguir trabajando de esa manera. 

Balbino tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de papa y abono, preparándose para la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Balbino is 56 years old, he lives with his wife, Adela (53) and their only son who still lives at home even though he is an adult.

This nice and hard-working man has been a farmer since he was very young and lived with his parents. When he started his own family he continued as a farmer of which he is very proud as he has succeeded in improving his family´s status. Presently he is planting a lot of potato and a small amount o pea. He works with his son and together they check each and every crop in the mornings to avoid failure and plague.

When the production is ready they sell to wholesalers who offer good prices depending on the quality of their products. For the future he plans to plant even more potato and increase his income.

This is his tenth loan with MFP and he is grateful to all the people that have made the loan possible for him to continue working in search of progress. He is also very satisfied with the work of the community bank as all the members are responsible and organized, therefore they are the best in the area and they wish to go on working this way.

Balbino is planning to invest the requested money in buying potato seeds and fertilizer, preparing for the next crop.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en: Barbara is a single mother of two children and one of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She owns a stall at her home selling second hand clothes. She wants to use this loan to buy more second hand clothes.  She has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for two weeks, servicing her first loan.  Barbara doesn’t have any other side business. At times she moves door-to-door selling her clothes.  She sells to all categories of people but at retail only.  Barbara works six days week. She buys these clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, and uses public transport to and from shopping. Barbara goes shopping once a week. Her business challenge is the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching her and even makes it hard for her to walk around looking for customers.  She aspires to start buying a full bale of second hand clothes.  She joined MCDT because she wanted to raise capital for her business.  She resides in and owns a one-room house and the family has access to electricty and piped water .

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca, de 23 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijo alguno. Vive en la majestuosa selva cuzqueña, ubicada en la comunidad de Manitea Alta, donde tiene su propia casa a base de madera. Para Blanca lo único que primaba era salir adelante, por ello se abocó de lleno a la actividad agrícola, específicamente a la producción y comercializaron de café. Poco a poco fue avanzando de manera sostenible, a tal punto que le faltaba cumplir con los pedidos de otros compradores, debido a que su terreno no lo permitía producir en grandes cantidades, y se vio obligado a comprar de otros productores, con la necesidad de atender la demanda de sus clientes. Ella siente que le falta mucho por recorrer, es por ello que piensa ampliar su productividad y mejorar la calidad de sus cafetales, para que así pueda obtener mayores ingresos. Normalmente su producto los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad a un precio base. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago, además agradece a su grupo comunal, por las buenas decisiones que toman entre los socios. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos y abono para mejorar la calidad de sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Blanca, 23, is single and has no children. She lives in the majestic Cusco jungle, in the community of Manitea Alta, where she has her own wooden home. Blanca's only priority is getting ahead, and for this reason she has fully devoted herself to agriculture, specifically the production and sale of coffee. Bit by bit her sales have been progressing in a sustainable manner, to the point that, since her land wouldn't let her farm in large quantities, she had to buy from other producers to meet her customers' demand. She feels that she has a long way to go, and so she plans to increase her productivity and improve the quality of her coffee in order to earn a better income. She usually sells her produce in the stock centres in her community at a base price. This is her first loan with MFP, so we know she will faithfully repay it on time. Also, she is grateful to her community group for the sound decisions they make. With the requested loan she will invest in the purchase of supplies and fertilizer to improve the quality of her coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and supplies for improvement of coffee crop

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva A. is from the village of Tibanga, Iligan City. She is 46 years old. Eva is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Eva has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Eva's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Inti Group

texts.es:
La A.C. Inti tiene como presidente al señor Hernán Z., la mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Muy rara vez se escoge como presidente a un varón, en general se elige a alguna de las socias mujeres, en todo caso esto significa que las socias confían en el señor Hernán.
Don Hernán está casado, es  padre de 6 hijos, ingreso a la asociación comunal hace 3 años, actualmente se dedica a pintar locales de fiestas. Cuando se le pregunta en que invertirá el dinero de su crédito el comenta que comprará pinturas y rodillos de pintura.   
Las integrantes de la asociación comunal tienen negocios de comercio de detergentes, venta de utensilios de cocina. Para este ciclo han optado por pagos mensuales.
texts.en:
Hernán is the president of the Inti Community Group. This group belongs to the Santiago II Focal Center. Very rarely a man is chosen to be the president, normally a one of the women members are picked. That means the members trust Hernan. Hernan is married and the father of six children. He joined the Group three years ago and currently works as a painter of party venues. When asked about the destination of the money from his loan he says he will buy paint and paint rollers. The members of the Community Group have businesses selling detergent and kitchen utensils. For the current cycle they have opted for monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paint rollers, paint

loans.name: Abunzubumwe No 2 Group

texts.fr:
Kanyamahamga Simeon née a bugesera l’Est du pays, marié,il a 3 enfants,il a 36 ans, son ainé a 10  ans et son 3.5 ans et  son niveau d’éducation est primaire. Il vit avec sa famille à sake Bugesera. 2 parmi ses enfants vont à l’école. Avec son mari ils travaillent pour faire vivre et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. il fait le commerce des habits dans le centre commercial de Sake qui est un centre rural mais qui commence à être développé.

Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé ABUNZUBUMWE NO 2,  qui est un groupe dont les membres sont  agri-éleveurs et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Simeon et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie et en amenant leurs enfants à l’école. En fait, le groupe a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les articles de leur commerce et les revendre, une partie du profit est  réinvesti pour maintenir la stabilité financière du groupe et épargner afin de préparer pour un bon futur.
texts.en:
Simeon Kanyamahamga was born in Bugesera in the eastern part of the country. He is married and has 3 children. He is 36 years old. His eldest child is 10 years old and his youngest is 3 and a half years old. He has a primary level of education. He lives with his family in Sake Bugesera. 2 of his children attend school. He works with his husband to provide for his family and improve its living conditions. He sells clothes at Sake’s commercial center. Although it is a rural center, it is starting to grow. He belongs to a solidarity group called ABUNZUBUMWE NO 2. The members of this group are farmers who mutually guarantee each other. Simeon and his group work to improve their families’ living conditions and send their children to school. The group has contracted a loan within the Amasezerano Community Banking association to purchase the goods necessary to their business and sell them. Part of the profit is reinvested in order to maintain the financial stability of the group and save money in order to prepare for a good future.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothes for retail

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 34 years old and married with one child who is 13 years old and in school. Francoise and her family live with her mother and all are able to buy health insurance.

Francoise buys cassava locally and sells it in two different marketplaces. With the loan she hopes to expand her sales to more marketplaces, including Kigali, the capital city.

Francoise’s goal is to pay off her loans and qualify for larger loans. This way she can afford to sell in more places.

loans.use: To buy more cassava to sell

loans.name: Agath

texts.fr:
Agath S. est une femme de 42 ans. Elle est célibataire et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE dont elle est la secrétaire depuis son adhésion en novembre 2004. Elle a 11 fois de suite reçu de crédit.

Elle fais de l'embouche porcine depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois en novembre 2004.

Avec son nouveau crédit de 500.000 francs CFA elle va acheter 20 porcs adultes à raison de 10.000 francs l'unité (destinés à l'abattage)et 10 pourceaux destinés à l'embouche. Elle va aussi acheter du son de mil pour l'alimentation des porcs.

Son objectif est de prendre en charge son enfant, et de renforcer son épargne
texts.en:
Agath S. is a 42-year-old woman. She is a single mother of one child. She is a member of the Village Bank of Walidane and has been the secretary of the group since her membership began in November of 2004. She has received eleven loans. She has run a pig farm since her membership to the Village Bank began in November 2004. With her new loan of 500,000 francs CFA, she will buy twenty adult pigs at 10,000 francs each (which will be slaughtered) and ten swine that she will raise. She will also buy grain to feed the pigs. Her goal is to take care of her son and to build upon her savings.

Translated from French by Katherine Evans, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Julius Komen

texts.en:
Julius K. C. is 33 years old. He is married to Edna Komen, and they are blessed with five children: Maximilien is 11 years old, Sharon is 9 years old, Faith is 7 years old, Denis is 4 years old, and Consolata is 3 years old.

To earn a living, Julius is a farmer, though he also runs a welding business. He explains that he has been operating the two businesses for the last 10 years and that the businesses generate for him an average profit of 10,000 KES per month. By doing so, Julius supports his family of 7 people.

Julius is seeking a loan in the amount of 42,000 KES ($525) from KADET LTD. This would be the second loan he has received from KADET LTD. Notably, he successfully repaid the first loan. He intends to use 10,000 KES of the requested loan to purchase fertilizers, 7,000 KES to purchase maize seeds, 15,000 KES for tilling, and the remaining 10,000 KES to purchase metals for his welding business. Julius hopes to use the profits generated from his businesses as a result of this loan to build rental houses in the town of Kabarnet. Ultimately, he dreams of expanding his business and of being able to educate his children to the highest level of education possible.

loans.use: To expand his businesses by purchasing farming and welding products

loans.name: Marianela

texts.en:
Marianela is part of the communal bank “Las Magnolias y los dos Claveles” and resides in the city of Concepción.  Marianela sells perishable, non-perishable, vegetables from her house. She attends to customers by herself, although on occasions she asks her 19 year old son to help.  She has a total of four children, but only two live with her: a 19 and 11 year old. Marianela has been managing this store for approximately 4 years now.

Marianela plans to use this loan to purchase more merchandise for her business, but also hopes to use part of the funds to make repairs to her home caused by the earthquake (February 27, 2010), when a whole wall and the windows of a hallway fell down.

Marianela goal is to offer a variety of products from her storefront, as she recently received a business license to expand her business.  She also wants to include a bakery, for which she would learn this trade.  If possible, in the longer term, Marianela would like to hire a helper.

Marianela appreciates the patience showed by Fondo Esperanza loan officer during the weekly group meetings to explain every little thing the members do not understand.  Marianela has also enjoyed the entrepreneurial training and is pleased with the low interest rate charged by Fondo Esperanza.

Concepción is the second largest city in Chile, located in the southern region of Bíobío. Concepción is situated at the mouth of the Bíobío River, one of the largest in the country. This is an exceptionally beautiful region. Its attractions come from the combination of rivers, ocean, fertile plains, lowlands and mountains, and beautiful vegetation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and help with reconstruction after the earthquake.

loans.name: Catherine Kipsilgich

texts.en:
Catherine Kipsilgich C., 53, is married to James Kiptoo. They have five children aged 32, 30, 28, 26, and 22 respectively. They live in Kipkaren Eldoret, Kenya. Catherine has been in the kitchenware business for the past six years, and earns her monthly income of KES 12,000 primarily from selling utensils. 

Catherine was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She paid off her first loan successfully, and is now applying for a second loan of KES 20,000. She plans to expand her stock by purchasing dozens of sufurias (cooking pots) to sell. She hopes to operate a large shop and open other branches in the future.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of sufurias to sell

loans.name: El Bosque Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Victoria,  tiene 50 años D. edad, es  casada y tiene 2 hijos menores D. edad, es integrante del  Alcom ”El Bosque" desD. hace cuatro meses junto con 8 personas más que al igual que ella son muy trabajadores y responsables, todos ellos residentes D. la zona denominada “El Bosque” en el Distrito D. Carabayllo.

Hace unos años, la Sra. Maria Victoria decidió generar más ingresos para poder sentirse un poco aliviada D. los gastos D. la casa y apoyar a su esposo en el pago D. los estudios D. sus hijos, así que en ese momento tuvo la oportunidad por contacto D. una amistad D. traer y vender ropa del interior del país, es así como se inicia en este negocio desD. hace tres meses. Como su negocio es nuevo solo ha podido aumentar su capital D. trabajo para seguir invirtiendo y nos cuenta que los préstamos le han servido D. mucho, para salir adelante con su familia.

El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra D. casacas para enviar al interior del país y venderlos.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Victoria, age 50, is married with 2 young children. She is a member of ALCOM "The Forest" for the past 4 months with 8 other people, who like her are hard working and responsible. All of them are residents of the area called "The Forest" in the district of Carabayllo. 

 A few years ago, Ms. Maria Victoria decided to generate more revenue in order to help with household expenses and support her husband with the school payments for their children. At that time, she had the opportunity to contact a friend to import and sell clothes insiD. the country. She started the business 3 months ago. Since their business is new , the only way to increase working capital is to continue investing in the business.  These loans have done a lot to help the family move forward.

 The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of jackets to send to the interior of the country for resale.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of jackets to send to the interior of the country for resale.

loans.name: Martha Guadalupe

texts.es: Martha Guadalupe F. P. ya tiene mas de diez años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada, accesorios de oro y plata ya tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad. El negocio lo instala enfrente de su vivienda a partir desde las 10 de la mañana y por las tardes sale a trabajar en una estética para poder cubrir los gastos de su familia.
texts.en: For more than ten years, Martha Guadalupe F. P. has been selling used clothing as well as gold and silver accessories.  She has plenty of experience in this activity.  Her business is located in the front of her house.  Martha begins working at 10am.  In the afternoons, she leaves for her job at an aesthetician’s office so that she can cover her family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: German Santiago

texts.es:
Germán, de 34 años de edad, reside en San Carlos, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la albañilería, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos: Wilber de 13 años, Iván de 9 años, y Wilfredo de 2 años de edad, don Germán trabaja de albañil construyendo casas cuando le solicitan y también atiende la agricultura.
Él esta es proceso de mejorar su vivienda pero no tienen  los fondos necesarios por lo que solicita un préstamo para poder comprar los materiales y realizar el trabajo, él compraría arena, láminas y cemento, con esta ayuda podrá llevar a cabo la reparación de la vivienda y ofrecer a su familia un hogar más seguro y confortable.
El sueño de él es ayudar a sus hijos para que estos se preparen con una carrera universitaria y tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Germán is 34 years old and lives in San Carlos in the Morazán department. He works in construction and lives with his wife and 3 children: Wilber-13 years old, Iván-9 years old, and Wilfredo- 2 years old. Mr. Germán works building houses when requested and also helps in agriculture.

He is in the process of improving his home but lacks the necessary funds, so he is requesting a loan to buy materials and get the job done. He would buy sand, cement sheets and with this aid may carry out the repair of the house and give his family a safer and more comfortable home.

His dream is to help their children so that they can earn a college degree and have a better future.

loans.use: Purchase of sand, cement and laminates.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María de 26 años, hace un año atrás su esposo se quedo sin trabajar y ella tuvo que comenzar a conseguir dinero para poder mantener a sus hijos inicio con las  ventas productos Yanbal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes por catalogo). 

Por la buena administración que le ha dado a su capital de trabajo ahora hace por semana dos veces pedidos para que les lleguen los productos que les piden sus clientes. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm visitando a sus conocidos y clientes fieles para que compren los productos. Ella quiere seguir trabajando surtiendo su mercadería comprando con el préstamo perfumes, cremas, tratamientos. En el futuro quiere tener un local para ofrecer sus productos y surtir su mercadería vendiendo ropa.
texts.en:
María is 26 years old.  A year ago her husband lost his job and she had to start making money to support her children.  She started selling Yanbal brand products (a company that offers enterprising women the opportunity to start out in independent catalogue sales)

Thanks to the good way she’s run her business she now places two orders per week so that she’ll get the products her customers order.  She works from 8am until 7pm visiting her acquaintances and regular customers so that they will buy her products.

She wants to stay in business stocking more merchandise.  She’ll use the loan to buy perfumes, creams and beauty treatments.
In the future she’d like to have a locale to sell her items and add clothes to her stock inventory.

loans.use: For perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Mrs. Pheng Srey Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Pump Edth Village, Takeo Province fifteen people have come together to form a village bank. Mrs. Pheng S. has been selected by the other members to be the village bank president. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose, but all hope to improve their family's living standards.

Mrs. Pheng S. is a farmer who owns small piece of land. She grows and sells rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sey Duch, is a fisherman and construction worker who earns some money to support his family. 

It is time to grow rice in her rice field, but Mrs. Pheng S. did not have enough money, so, to improve production, she is asking for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide. She has two children, all of whom are students.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Anizia

texts.en:
Anizia is 28 years old and married with one child who is three years old. Anizia has her own store which contains different goods and food, such as bread, sugar, rice, cooking oil, soap, etc.  Anizia  has been in her business for one year. She employs two people.  She is open from 6am until 8pm every day.  

This loan will help her purchase a variety of goods to resell.  She would like to reinvest any profits she will make back into the business.

loans.use: Purchasing a variety of goods to resell.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael A. is is 25 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. He is from the village of Samonte. To make a living, Rafael raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rafael has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rafael joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rafael is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This loan is Rafael first loan  from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline E. is from the village of Panay Diot Tudela Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old and single. Jacqueline runs a transportation service. She has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Jacqueline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units of offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Maria Jocelyn

texts.en:
Maria Jocelyn E. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Maria Jocelyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Jocelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk food & toothpaste in the local community. Maria Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maria Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Maria Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snacks. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snacks

loans.name: Nashuluni Enole

texts.en:
Nashuluni Enole N. is 22 years old. She is married and has two children. For the past three years she has been farming in Narok town on her own piece of land.

She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her second loan. She plans to buy fertilizer and maize seeds and to prepare the land for the next planting season. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity.

Nashuluni's dream is to be a successful farmer. She is an assiduous woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy fertilize and maize seeds, and prepare land

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas K., a 46-year-old widow who sells a variety of cakes and sweets for a living, earns a daily profit of around $2 USD. Meas lives with her three single children, two all of whom are foremen in local construction earning a daily revenue of approximately $4.80, while her third child is a garment worker. Meas  is requesting a loan of $600 to assist her sons in purchasing more construction equipment. The net benefit of this loan will be additional family income.

loans.use: to purchase additional construction equipment for her sons

loans.name: Kisukuru Group

texts.en:
Safia Y. is in her mid-forties.  She has four children who are still in school.  She has operated a general store business for one year.  She works from 6.30am to 9.30pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Safia's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She hopes to increase on the shop inventory. Her dream is to one day build another house, as she has one already.

Safia will share this loan with her loan group "Kisukuru", which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Safia is in the middle of the front row.

loans.use: to increase on the shop inventory.

loans.name: Cheneta

texts.en:
This is Cheneta G., 50, a resident of Domingo Street, Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo G., a trash collector, and is the mother of five children.  Three of the children are already married, one is working while the other one is not yet of school age.  Cheneta is an elementary school graduate, yet decided to manage a micro-enterprise to help her husband earn a living.

Cheneta has operated a hardware store for almost two years now. She also has been managing and running their junk shop for 28 years and has been selling used clothing for 12 years. Having her husband as business partner, Cheneta earns an estimated net income of around 12,000 PHP monthly.

To help her continue the operation of her businesses, she is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan.  She plans to use this loan to buy more items for her hardware store and part of this loan will be used as revolving capital for her junk shop. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
 
Cheneta dreams of being able to give all of her children a good and high-quality education through all of her hard work in her business. She also prays for having her own commercial space for her junk shop. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives
 
*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional hardware items for her store

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. Maricel is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Maricel requested a 16,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to buy a fishing boat and materials for drying fish.

Maricel has been in this business for four years now, and also earns additional income from dried fish vending.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and materials for the drying of fish.

loans.name: Obidjon

texts.en:
Obidjon, age 51, sells TV sets, DVDs, parabolic antennas, audio-video cassettes, and CDs. He buys most of his goods from wholesale suppliers from China, and CDs are purchased from a local wholesale store called Garbushke. He has been in his business for 20 years and has a great deal of experience.  Obidjon would like to obtain a loan of 7,500 Somoni to purchase additional goods and expand his business further.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road as well as the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous, leaving only 7 percent arable land. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to expand his inventory

loans.name: Volodymyr

texts.en:
Volodymyr is married with two children. He is a private businessman from Ganoosivka, Ivano-Frankivsk region. Volodymyr sells household items and construction supplies in small towns in his region. He has a car that facilitates his business endeavors. Every day he travels to a different town to sell his merchandise at reasonable prices. Presently, his monthly income amounts to 10,000 Grivnyas.
Volodymyr is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase 100 tins of assorted paint, as well as a ton of cement and assorted workwear for further retail sale in the markets of his region. Volodymyr has been in the trade for over six years. He has no competitors, which helps his business grow and develop even more rapidly. The business is the main source of income for his family. One of Volodymyr’s personal goals is to finish construction of his private house, which has been his long-nurtured dream.

loans.use: to purchase 100 tins of assorted paint, a ton of cement and assorted workwear.

loans.name: Mma

texts.en: Mma sells banku at Abura, near nyame bekyere.  She serves this banku with okra stew. She is divorced and has three children. The income she makes from her sales is used to take care of her children. Her loan will be used to buy maize to prepare corn dough and cassava dough for banku. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy maize to prepare corn dough and cassava dough for banku.

loans.name: María Eulalia
