texts.es: María Eulalia D. 54 años D. edad, vive con su esposo David D. 61 años en su casa. Los hijos D. ambos residen en Estados Unidos  los cuales ayudan un poco en el sostenimiento del hogar. María posee una pequeña tienda en su hogar D. residencia en la cual venD. productos D. primera necesidad como bebidas, granos básicos,  golosinas, y D. más artículos que los clientes solicitan. Es una mujer emprendedora y creativa ya que a pesar D. que existen más tiendas cerca D. su negocio ha logrado ganarse la confianza D. muchos clientes y cada día la prefieren más gracias a su carisma. Es una mujer luchadora y le gusta trabajar por el pan D. cada día. Por lo que ha tomado la decisión D. incrementar su negocio y para esto necesita D. la ayuda D. un crédito el cual solicita a Integral para poder comprar variedad D. productos D. tienda como: bebidas, detergente, arroz, azúcar, pan dulce, frijoles, golosinas, aceite, etc. Con la fe puesta en Dios que logrará obtener resultados favorables y logrará mejorar su condición D. vida y la D. su querido esposo.
texts.en: Maria Eulalia is 54 years old and she lives at home with her husband David, who is 61 years old. Both of their children live in the United States and they help somewhat with the support of the household. Maria has a small store in her house and she sells essential goods such as drinks, basic grains, sweets, and other products that her clients request. She is an enterprising and creative woman. Despite the fact that there are other stores near her business she has managed to earn many clients and every day she sees more clients thanks to her charisma. She is a fighter and she likes to work to earn the daily bread. She has taken the decision to increase her business and for this she needs the help of a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner). She will purchase a variety of products for her store, such as: drinks, detergent, rice, sugar, pastries, beans, sweets, cooking oil, etc. With her faith set on God she will be able to obtain favorable results and she will improve her living conditions and those of her beloved husband.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products for her store, such as: drinks, detergent, rice, sugar, pastries, beans, sweets, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 35 years old and a single mother of a 20-year-old child.  For three years, she has been operating a green grocery to earn a living.  Besides this, she is employed as a casual laborer for extra income and she also sells charcoal.  Mary works hard in her business so as to provide for her child. She hopes to expand her business in five years for more income generation.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy charcoal and second-hand clothes.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and second-hand clothes

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: L’emprunteuse est une femme d’âgée mure qui est très entreprenante. Au bout de quelques années de travail, elle a réussi à trouver un bon local, bien positionné au centre du village pour y implanter un restaurant. Elle y sert le petit déjeuner, le déjeuner et le diner a une clientèle devenu de plus en pus exigent.Son activité lui rapporte un revenu mensuel  assez important  pour la prise en charge de sa famille sur le plan scolaire, alimentaire, sanitaire mais aussi pour le paiement de la location et des factures d’eau et électricité. Elle est sociétaire de l’IMCEC ou elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000F pour augmenter son stock et acheter des sacs de légumes, de riz brisé, de légumes et des condiments. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un nouvel fast food pour faire des hamburger, des chawarma et des fatayas local.
texts.en: The borrower [Fatou] is a mature woman who is very enterprising. After several years of work, she was successful in finding a good location, well positioned in the town center, to open a restaurant. In it, she serves breakfast, lunch and dinner to a group of customers whose demand continues to increase. Her business brings in a monthly revenue large enough to take care of her family's academic, dietary and medical expenses and also the payment of her rent, water and electricity bills. She is a member of [U]IMCEC, where she is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs in order to increase her stock and buy sacks of vegetables, cracked rice and condiments. Her ambition is to open a new fast food restaurant to make hamburgers, as well as local shawarma [a type of sandwich/wrap] and fataya [a traditional Chicken dish].

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of cabbages, 10 cases of olive oil, 8 bottles of butane gas, 10 cases of carbonated soft drinks.

loans.name: Kotognontala 4 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 33 ans et 5 enfants, les six femmes du groupe Kotognontala 4 habitent toutes dans le village de Sirakorobougou dans la commune rurale de Sanando dans la 4ème région administrative du Mali (Ségou). 
Pour pouvoir augmenter leurs parcelles de culture, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du niébé.
Madame Nagnini (2ème femme debout à droite sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 25 kg de grains de semences d’arachide, un sac de complexe céréales, se faire aider dans les activités de labour et de sarclage par l’utilisation de la main d’œuvre masculine du village. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Tissala. Avec une superficie de 2 hectares, elle espère produire  10 sacs d’arachide, 8 sacs de mil, 3 sacs de niébé et des fanes. Une partie de sa production est auto-consommée et le reste stocké est vendu pendant la période de soudure pour assurer les besoins du foyer au quotidien. Madame Nagnini a pour objectif  d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans son foyer.
texts.en:
The six members of group Kotognontala 4 are in their majority married in large traditional families. They are on average 33 years old with five children, and they all live in the village of Sirakerobougou in the rural township of Sanando, part of Mali's fourth administrative region (Segou).
In order to increase the size of the plots they cultivate, they requested help from Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first agricultural loan cycle. The group members grow groundnuts, millet, and black-eyed peas.
Mrs. Nagnini (the second woman standing from the right in the picture) is planning on using her loan to purchase 25 kilos groundnut seeds and one bag of complex fertilizer as well as to get help with plowing and weeding from the male workforce of the village. She gets her agricultural intrants from the fair in Tissala. With a five-acre plot size, she is hoping to produce ten bags of groundnuts, eight bags of millet, three bags of black-eyed peas and some pea greens. Part of her production is consumed at home and the rest is stored and sold during the tide-over period to provide for the household daily needs. Mrs. Nagnini’s objective is to insure that her household is self-sufficient food-wise.

loans.use: to buy groundnut seeds and complex fertilizer as well as recruit workers.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
This is a 36-year-old Musa. He is married to a petty trader and has two children aged 13 and 16. In 2005, Musa established a business that sells soft drinks, beer, stout, and provisions such as milk, sugar, butter, cheese, and mayonnaise. He began his business because he realized that he would make huge profits taking advantage of the fact that there was no such a business in his community. 

Musa started by selling items in a small wooden box, moved to a kiosk and now a container which he has converted to a shop and bar. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 1,050,000 Leones (SLL) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. 

Musa now requires a new loan in order to buy cartons of beer, stout and provisions. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Musa plans to buy a piece of land and educate his children to the level they wish to attain. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, beer, stout, and provisions such as milk, sugar, butter, cheese, and mayonnaise

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 39 years old and works as a female motorcycle operator. She says, “If others can do it, I can do it also because I am determined to do it.” She is quietly different because of her strong determination. Being a female motorcycle operator is difficult but through her dedication and affection for her two children, she can work as a man.

She wants her children to finish their desired courses and attain their dreams. Therefore, she needs to work hard to earn a higher income daily. Through working every day, her motorcycle also deteriorates so Janet is asking for a loan in the amount of P5,000 to buy oil, paint and steel parts for maintenance of her motorcycle to continue her operations.

She hopes it will strengthen her income daily to bring success to their poor lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy oil, paint and steel parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Mujeres Encantadoras Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son D. la ciudad D. Caacupé, ellas se unieron con el propósito D. poder ayudar en sus casas con los gastos que diariamente surgen. Se definen como luchadoras, emprendedoras y muy creativas. Ellas son muy conocidas en el barrio por la unión que tienen y demuestran. Actualmente esta integrado por 10 mujeres, quienes se encuentran trabajando dentro del tercer ciclo del programa.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Lucia, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. tortas, comenta que le va muy bien y que tiene mucho trabajo, pues sus vecinos del barrio siempre le hacen pedidos cuando hay fiestas y todo tipo D. eventos. Comenta que quiere poder seguir creciendo con su micro emprendimiento, por lo que le gustaría poder seguir invirtiendo en el.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. harina, levaduras, azúcar, colorantes y otros insumos necesarios para la elaboración D. las tortas que prepara.
texts.en:
The women of the group in question are from the city of Caacupé.  They got together with the goal of being able to help in their homes with the expenses that come up on a daily basis.  They characterize themselves as fighters, enterprising, and very creative.  They are very well known in the neighborhood for the unity that they have and demonstrate.  Currently there are 10 women in the group working in the third cycle of the program.

One of the members is Lucía, who makes and sells cakes.  She comments that it's going very well for her and that she has a lot of work, since her neighbors always order from her when there are parties and all types of events.  She wants to continue growing with her micro-enterprise, for which reason she would like to continue investing in it.

Lucía is requesting the loan to buy flour, yeast, sugar, food coloring, and other ingredients necessary for the cakes she makes.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, food coloring, and other ingredients to make cakes.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es: Los integrantes del grupo invertiran el prestamos en materia prima para sus negocios. La coordinadora la señora Adriana comprara ziper, btelas, hilos, botones y manta, María en maiz, elotes, papa, cerdo, hojas...etc. y José en cosechas y leña.
texts.en: The members of this group will invest their loans in basic materials for their businesses. The coordinator, Adriana, will buy zippers, fabric, thread, buttons, and cotton cloth. María will buy two types of corn, potatoes, pork, leaves, etc. José will invest in the harvest and firewood.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, thread, and buttons.

loans.name: Sadio

texts.fr: Sadio est une commerçante qui vie dans une localité proche de la capitale du Sénégal. Son activité principale est le commerce. Elle évolue dans ce domaine depuis plus de 7 ans. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour l'achats de marchandises comme (des tissus, des basins, des teintures) et de l’encenses qu'elle va revendre. Le but de ce crédit est aussi destiné a l'achat d'autres produits comme (des parfums, de gammes). Avec ce prêt elle envisage de voir son bénéfice augmenter afin d'aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la maison.
texts.en: Sadio is a merchant living in a town near the capital of Senegal. Her main activity is retail commerce. She has been active in this area for over 7 years. She requested the credit to buy goods such as cloth fabrics, basins, dyes and incense, which she then resells. The purpose of this credit is also to purchase other products such as perfumes and gemstones  With this loan she hopes to see her profits increase to help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin is a single man who has operated his own timber felling and firewood business for the past 3 years. His primary customers are neighbors and local residents. He owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. He describes his greatest business challenge to be transportation and his highest monthly expense is food.

Franklin will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy saws and screws. Franklin aspires to open his own firewood stall in the future. He joined Yehu because they are accommodating and understand their clients.

loans.use: To buy saws and screws.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en: Bernardita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and four children. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by raising pigs. She is applying for a loan for PHP 29,000 to buy feed for her livestock. She joined HSPFI earlier this year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her livestock.

loans.name: Donyor

texts.ru: Донёр занимается выращиванием пшеницы более 10 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребенка. Он имеет 0, 83 гектар земли и там выращивает пшеницу и зерно. Кроме этого он занимается строительством. Принимает заказы на свободное время и зарабатывает денег на содержании семьи. На полученные доходы хочет ремонтировать свой дом и улучшить условия жизни. Донёр запрашивает займ расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Donyor has been involved in growing wheat for over ten years.  He is married and has one child.  He owns 0.83 hectares of land, where he grows wheat and grains.  Besides this business, he is also involved in construction work.  He fills his free time with construction orders and earns money to support the family.  He wants to use planned profits to repair his house and improve living conditions.  Donyor is requesting this loan for business expansion.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Houenoussou Group

texts.fr: Le groupement HOUENOUSSOU est formé de treize personnes qui résident dans le même village et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Brigitte est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Brigitte est âgée de 37 ans, et est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Florent. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés dont trois à leur charge. Brigitte n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis une quinzaine d’année, Brigitte vend des charbon de bois et de l'huile de palme qu'elle produit dans sa région. Cette activité lui génère des revenus lui permettant d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Brigitte achète ses produits dans un village du Bénin et les revend dans sa région. C’est la troisième fois que Brigitte et les autres membres du groupement HOUENOUSSOU sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité et d'accroître leur fonds de roulement, afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The Houenoussou group consists of thirteen persons residing in the same village and belonging to the same tontine (revolving savings and loan group). The representative of the group, named Brigitte, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo.

Brigitte is 37 years old and is married to a teacher named Florent. The couple has five children, of whom three are dependents. All attend (or have attended) school. Brigitte has not attended school herself.

For the past fifteen years, Brigitte has been selling throughout her region the charcoal and palm oil she produces. This activity generates sufficient revenue to manage together with her husband all the various family expenses. Brigitte resupplies from a village in Benin and sells her products in the surrounding area.

This is the third time that Brigitte and other members of the Houenoussou group have sought a credit loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to strengthen their business and increase their working capital, in order to better meet the needs of their customers.

loans.use: Buy palm nuts.

loans.name: Gloria Yaneth

texts.es: La señora Gloria a sus 34 años de edad es madre de tres hijos de 18, 14, y 7 años de edad. La señora Gloria tiene su propio negocio de venta de mercancía desde hace siete años, el cual le brinda los recursos necesarios para los gastos de su hogar.  La mercancía es vendida a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos. La señora Gloria requiere de la compra de surtido para su negocio tal como tennis con el fin de poder aumentar sus ingresos en la temporada de fin de año y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y cumplir su sueño tener su propio almacén de venta de zapatos y ropa para toda la familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria is 34 years old and the mother of three children (ages 18, 14, and 7). She has her own business in which she has sold merchandise for the past seven years. This business provides the necessary income to pay for the household expenses. Gloria sells merchandise to her friends, relatives, and neighbors.

She is requesting a loan in order to restock her business with merchandise, such as tennis shoes, so that she can increase her sales during the year-end season and improve her family’s quality of life. Gloria will also be able to fulfill her dream of having her own store where she can sell shoes and clothes for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es: La señora Gloria Patricia a sus 42 años de edad es madre de dos hijos de 14 y 11 años, desde hace 13 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de platos típicos de la región tales como tamales y morcilla, estos productos los distribuye en su barrio y sectores aledaños. Esta actividad, la señora Gloria Patricia la aprendió de su madre a quien le ayudaba años atrás, actualmente su esposo le ayuda con la distribución de los productos. La señora Gloria requiere de la compra de equipos para la cocina tal como ollas, una mesa de acero y un fogón que le permitan mayor comodidad y agilidad para preparar sus productos y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y con estos la calidad de vida de su familia en especial a de uno de sus hijos quien esta muy enfermo. El sueño de la señora Gloria Patricia es tener un local comercial y en este generar empleos directos.
texts.en:
Gloria Patricia, 42, is the mother of two children, ages 14 and 11.  For 13 years she has worked making and selling traditional regional dishes such as tamales and blood sausage.  She distributes these products in her neighborhood and nearby areas.  Gloria Patricia learned this work from her mother, whom she used to help years ago.  Currently her husband helps her distribute the products.

Gloria needs to buy equipment for the kitchen, such as pots, a steel table, and a stove, which will give her greater comfort and agility to prepare her products and so improve her income and, with this, the quality of life of her family, especially for one of her children who is very sick.

Gloria Patricia's dream is to have a commercial space in which to generate direct jobs.

loans.use: to buy kitchen equipment.

loans.name: Pal

texts.en:
Mr. Pal, a 41-year-old father of a single child who is attending school, lives in Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh where he works as a civil servant in the Ministry of National defense.

Presently Pal owns a motorcycle that he has used for many years, but because it is old, it breaks frequently. Pal now realizes that it is no longer safe to operate and so is requesting his first loan from HKL and Kiva to buy another motorcycle for his commute to work. He is very thankful to our lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Darling Nohemi

texts.es:
Darling, es una joven emprendedora de 22 años de edad, originaria de Estelí, es casada, de oficio comerciante es dueña de una pulpería la cual tiene 3 años de tenerla. Empezó con este  negocio vendiendo solo pollo pero sus clientes le preguntaban a ella por otro tipo de productos comestibles fue que introdujo granos básicos, productos de limpieza poco a poco su esposo la apoyo desde el principio ya que el le dio un pequeño capital para que comprara productos, su esposo trabajo en la municipalidad como técnico del ministerio de educación es, este ha sido su primer negocio el cual ha surgido poco a poco.   
Ella realizo el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar frijoles, jugos, galletas, enlatados, sopas, producto de limpieza para el hogar, cosméticos. Esto le ayudara a mantener surtida su pulpería para que sus clientes encuentren de todo y así ir mejorando sus ventas.  Pues desea establecer otros puntos de ventas para dar a conocer su negocio.
texts.en:
Darling, is a young entrepreneur, 22 years old, a native of Estelí, and married. For the last three years she has owned a grocery store. She started this business by selling chicken, but her clients asked her to sell other groceries as well, so little by little she introduced basic grains and cleaning products. Her husband, who works  as a teacher in the town's Ministry of Education, supported her at the beginning by giving her a small amount of money to buy goods. This is the first business that Darling has had, and it is growing little by little.

She is taking out a loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, juice, cookies, canned goods,  soups, household cleaning products and cosmetics. This will help her to maintain a varied stock in her grocery store so that her customers find everything they need, thus improving her sales. Darling would like to set up other sales locations to make her business better known.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, juice, cookies, canned goods,  soups, household cleaning products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg is 57 years old, and lives with her husband in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She has been running a small meat retailing business since 2000 with help from her husband. She purchases fresh and qualified meats from her trusted suppliers and delivers them to her regular customers. Now that Mongolia's biggest festival is approaching, she plans to purchase large quantities of fresh meats and sell them to the customers. She says that if it works well, she could afford a van for the business to ride and deliver the meats, which decreases her transport costs. She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase meat from herders.

loans.use: to purchase meat from herders

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance aged 36 years. She is not married. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 15 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers for growing rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for growing rice.

loans.name: Kamathatha Mworoto Women Group

texts.en:
The Lady raising her hand in the photo is Grace. She is fifty five years old married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.
She does beans, goats and sheep farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds. This will improve her beans production hence increase her income which she will use to pay school fees for her children.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds and improve on beans production hence more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Faustino O. is a member of Life in Africa and a family man too. He has lived through thick and thin to support his family. He left the stone Quarrying business to his wife and started working with the invisible bracelet project as a bracelet producer and because of his articulate and concise approach to issues, Faustino was entrusted with quality control in the invisible children Bracelet campaign that is in partnership with Life in Africa. With his visionary acumen, he seeks to expand his house by constructing two more rooms for rent, which will help him to save more money to square his family bills.

Faustino has already saved 250,000 and to to meet his expectations of expansion he needs a loan of 800,000 UGX and he comfortably believes he will service the loan over a period of 10 months in premium sums of 80,000 from his monthly IC salary and the stone business itself.

His budget is as follows:

Bricks 4000 @ Ushs.60 = 240,000 Iron Sheets 24pcs @Ushs. 11,000 = 264,000 Bags of Cement 10Pkts @Ushs.18500 = 185,000 Timber @Ushs. 60,000 Transport @Ushs. 40,000 Water @ Ushs.11, 000 Labour 250,000 Total Ushs. 1,050,000

WE Team to benefit:Member Services

loans.use: Expanding Family House

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with two children. She runs a small business selling clothing and accessories at a local market. Tatyana has been in this business for 10 years. She is a very industrious and hard-worker. Her integrity, determination and perseverance have ensured the sustainability and growth of her business. Tatyana has gradually been able to save some money and reinvest it in her business. Together with loans from “Nadiya Ukraine”, she has been able to increase her inventory and sales volume. Presently, she has about $1,500 of working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to around $200. Tatyana is requesting a loan for $500 that will allow her to increase her assortment of inventory for the spring season. She is planning to buy sweaters, caps and purses in bulk for further retail sales. She would also like to purchase small items such as electric light bulbs, matches, plastic bags and a variety of other little necessities that always sell so well and will supplement her clothing sales. This loan will help Tatyana increase her inventory and cater to an ever increasing number of customers further promoting stable expansion for her business.

Тетяна – одружена, в неї двоє дітей. Вона – власниця бізнесу з продажу одягу та аксесуарів на місцевому ринку. Тетяна займається цим бізнесом вже 10 років. Вона дуже заповзята та працьовита. Її чесність, наполегливість та цілеспрямованість забезпечили стабільність та зростання її бізнесу. Тетяна змогла заощадити гроші та вкласти їх у власну справу. Завдяки позикам від „Надії України” вона змогла збільшити асортимент товарів та обсяги продажів. Зараз в товар в Тетяни вкладено 1500 доларів. Її чистий прибуток складає 200 доларів. Тетяна просить про позику в 500 доларів тому, що ці гроші допоможуть їй збільшити асортимент товарів напередодні весни. Вона планує оптом закупити светри, шапки та сумочки для подальшої роздрібної торгівлі. Тетяна також хотіла б придбати різні дрібні товари, наприклад, електричні лампочки, запальнички, сірники, пакети та різноманітні товари, які знадобляться в побуті. До того ж вона планує урізноманітнити асортимент одиниць одягу. Позика допоможе Тетяні збільшити обсяги товару, задовольнити зростаючий попит з боку покупців, а також сприятиме стабільному розвитку її бізнесу.

loans.use: To purchase wider assortment of inventory

loans.name: Taua

texts.en: Taua is fifty-eight years old.  She has three children, and they are all married with families of their own.  The family’s taro plantation is their main source of income.  Only one person in this extended family has a job outside the small family farm.  Taua believes that it is investment in growing the taro plantation that will help her raise the standard of living for her children and grandchildren.  Three times a week, the family sells their taro crop at the local market.  Taro is a staple of the Samoan diet, and there is always ample demand for their supply.  Taua is applying for a loan so that she can make some basic improvements to their plantation tools.  She wishes to purchase additional fencing, bush knives and gloves.

loans.use: :  Buy equipment:  fencing, knives, gloves

loans.name: Kurbonboi

texts.en: Kurbonboi R. is 29 years old, married, has two children and is expecting his third child. He has had his own small business for 6 years. He sells sunglasses during the summer, and bags, souvenirs and artificial flowers. All goods are brought from Bishkek.  His wife helps him with his business, but is not now as she is pregnant. He had US$150 when he started his business. He has US$1500 in turnover at the moment and is now asking for a loan in order to go to China to buy new quality goods. He plans to sell bags during the winter period and he wants to have his own shop in the future.

loans.use: Increase amount and quality of inventory

loans.name: Florbia

texts.es:
Business Description

Mrs. Florbia has a very well located business where she sells groceries and basic necessities. Recently she has opened another store in a more comercial area, where she sells propane gas for home use and jugs of water.

Use of the Loan

She needs this loan to buy merchandise and she needs to expand one of her business sites to install an area for stationery and paper that has been requested by her clients.

Personal Information

She is 39 years old and has three school age children. Her home is made of cement. She enjoys a stable home life. Her main goal is to develop her business for the future of her children and grandchildren.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Florbia tiene una despensa muy bien ubicada donde vende abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Actualmente han logrado poner otra tienda en un sector muy comercia, ellos vende también gas de uso domestico y botellones de agua

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería y además necesita ampliar uno de sus locales para poner una línea de producto de papelería que han sido solicitados por sus clientes.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 39 años y tres hijos que estudian su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es poder progresar en su negocio para así futuro a sus hijos y nietos

loans.use: To buy merchandise and expand her store.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
To any woman, having children going to college is a pride, especially in a remote province like Phuc Yen. Ms Le Thi V. puts a lot of efforts to raise all four children. When V. was 43 years old and her first child attended college, her family was in a great need. With the encouragement of her husband, a retired officer, Ms. V. applied for a 125USD loan from TYM Fund to open a shop selling tea, sundry goods and clothes. Her monthly income has increased constantly in the past 11 years. Although all her children are now grown up, and her family has become pretty stable, she has never thought of leaving TYM Fund. After more than 10 years, V. has considered TYM Fund her second family. Now she would like to borrow 1200USD to buy more clothes for her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Có 4 con đỗ đại học là một thành tích đáng tự hào của bất kỳ người phụ nữ nào, nhất là ở một địa phương không phải là trung tâm như Phúc Yên. Để nuôi được các con học hành, ra trường và có việc làm ổn định như ngày hôm nay là một sự nỗ lực của chị Lê Thị Vỵ, thành viên của Quỹ Tình thương. Năm 43 tuổi, khi người con đầu vào đại học, hoàn cảnh kinh tế gia đình lúc đó rất khó khăn. Được sự khích lệ của chồng, một cán bộ về hưu, chị Vỵ xin vay 125 USD để bán hàng nước. Các con nối nhau vào đại học, chị Vỵ đã chuyển qua nhiều loại hình kinh doanh: bán hàng nước, hàng tạp hóa, hàng vải. Mức thu nhập hàng tháng của chị tăng đều trong 11 năm qua. Đến nay tuy các con đã trưởng thành nhưng ra Quỹ là điều mà chị Vỵ không khi nào nghĩ đến. Sau hơn 10 năm gắn bó, Quỹ Tình thương đã trở thành mái nhà thứ 2 của chị. Hiện chị đang xin vay mức vốn 1200 USD cho công việc kinh doanh mặt hàng vải may quần áo.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is married and has two children. She owns a small business at the central market in Ordzhonikidze, where she sells quality footwear. Her assortment of merchandise is very versatile. Larisa has been in the shoe sales business for 12 years already. Throughout all these years her business has witnessed stable demand. Currently, she has about $3,600 in inventory. Her net profit per month is about $440.

Larisa realizes she needs financial support as her business continues to grow and develop. Today she is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase her inventory and thereby increase her profits. Larisa is planning to open a new vending facility, and to continue to grow and gain more loyal customers in the future. We believe her communication and managing skills will help Larisa achieve continued stability and success in business.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of inventory and open a new vending facility

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine M. is 38 years old with 1 son and 5 daughters, ranging in age from age 24 to 10. She has a restaurant and wishes to use the loan to purchase a public pay phone and phone cards for mobile phones. With the profits from her business she hopes to purchase a plot of land and build a house.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To purchase a pay phone

loans.name: Robi

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Robi K.. She is married with five children, aged 4, 7, 10, 12, and 15. Robi runs a grain business, and requires a loan of $525 in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, maize, and beans in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, maize, and beans in bulk.

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru:
Jurabek S. lives in the region of Abdurahmon Jomi. He is 52 years old, married and has five children. He has secondary education and no profession. He is in the animal husbandry business. He buys young calves, feeds them for about 40-45 days and then resells them at a higher price because grown and fed calves cost more and are used for meat. He then buys new batch of calves, feeds them and resells and that is the scheme by which runs his business. It allows to support his family because Jurabek is the sole provider. Besides, the development of animal husbandry provides markets with fresh mean at reasonable prices. Jurabek has been in this business for the past five years. He plans to use the loan to buy more calves. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сидмухиддинов Джурабек житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 52 года,женат, имеет 5 детей.Образование среднее. Специальности не имеет.Занимается животноводством. Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает около 40-45 ддней а затем продает по более высокой цене, так как откормленные и подросшие бычки стоят дороже и их используют на мясо.Затем он покупает новый молодняк , откармливает и продает. Так по этой схеме действует его бизнес.Этот бизнес помогает обеспечивать его семью так как клиент является единственным кормильцем семьи. Кроме того развитие животноводческого сектора позволяет обеспечить рынки полноценным мясом и по доступным ценам.Занимается животноводством клиент уже около 5 лет.Поэтому клиент планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить бычков. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria lives with her husband and children in her own home on Adolfo Gonzales Street, in the Sopocachi area of La Paz. In the morning she works as a salewoman in a store in the city of El Alto, and in the afternoon she sells jerseys for men and women. The loan she has requested will be used to increase her capital and to buy more jerseys, since her business is doing quite well.

María has good credit history, and has been approved for a new loan. She has been our client since 2007.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria vive en casa propia en la calle Adolfo Gonzáles de la zona de Sopocachi de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo e hijos. Ella trabaja como vendedora en una tienda de la ciudad de El Alto por las mañanas y por las tardes su actividad es la venta de chompas para damas y caballeros; el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar más chompas ya que en este negocio le esta yendo bien.

El antecedente es bueno y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente nuestro desde el año 2007.

loans.use: To purchase jerseys to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Alesi

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Alesi N., who is married and has four children between the ages of 6 and 14. In 2000, Alesi established her farming business. She now requires a loan in order to purchase inputs and equipment to grow more crops. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase inputs and equipment for her maize farm.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim T. is a farmer in the Kraing Metrey Village of Kampong Speu Province. She is married with five children: one child works as a laborer, two children work in a garment factory, and the other two children study at state school and help their parents on the rice field. Last year, two of their children got in a traffic accident, so Mrs. Lim T. incurred $1,500 of expenses in order to cure them. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Mrs. Lim T. would like to start a cow breeding business, but she does not have enough money to buy cows. Thus, Mrs. Lim T. is seeking a loan for this purpose. Previously, Mrs. Lim T. obtained a loan to buy fertilizers and pigs for breeding purposes.

loans.use: To embark upon a cow breeding business by purchasing cows.

loans.name: Santos Esther

texts.es:
Mrs. Santos Esther is requesting this loan to invest in improving her home by adding a bedroom. She has worked as a teacher in the "Rafaela Herrera" school for the last eight years. She has two children. The older is 17, and is in his third year of secondary education. Her younger child is 8, and he is in his second year of primary education at the Fonseca camp in Nueva Guinea. She is a very sociable and responsible person. Santos has to travel three hours on horseback to a region of the country so she can impart the bread of education to the country children in her area. Her dream is to have a stable job and a beautiful home.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Santos Esther está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, construcción de una habitación, labora como docente de la Escuela Rafaela Herrera desde hace 8 años, tiene dos hijos, la mayor de 17 años de edad estudia su tercer años de educación secundaria y su hijo menor de 8 años de edad estudia su segundo grado de educación primaria en colonia la Fonseca en Nueva Guinea, es una persona muy responsable y sociable, Santos tiene que viajar a tres horas montada a caballo a una comarca a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos de esa comarca, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral y una vivienda bonita.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build an additional room

loans.name: Bahorgul

texts.ru:
Bahorgul A. lives in the town of Nurek. She has 4 children. Since her children are still very young, she is the single provider for the family. She has been in the business of cattle farming for the last 25 years. She purchases skinny animals, feeds them for a number of days, and sells them later on. This process is continuous and it brings her profits, which are sufficient for food only. To develop her business, she needs additional capital. For this reason, she decided to obtain a loan for 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Эралиева Бахоргул проживает в городе Нурек. Вдова . Имеет четверых детей. Дети еще маленькие. Поэтому она одна обеспечивает свою семью. 25 лет как она занимается животноводством. Покупает худых животных , откармливает и продает. Так постоянно . Бизнес неплохой. Дает прибыль, которую хватает только на питание . Но для того чтобы развивать бизнес необходимо вложение денег. Поэтому она решила получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Faidha's Hatuna Matata Group

texts.en:
Faidha is 22 years and married with 1 child, aged 3 years. She has been a juice and snacks seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 6AM to 9PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Faidha now hopes for a loan to buy more juice for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Tatma, who owns nursery school.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Rous

texts.en:
Mrs. Rous C., 60, and her husband, Mr. Sok Ry, 63, live on an Island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1965 and have seven children; six sons and one daughter. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home. Two sons raise cows, farm, and do construction work.

Mrs. Rous has been a silk weaver since 1960, a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Sok does farming. He grows many types of vegetables on his farm near the village.

Rous is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Henry Norberto

texts.es: El Sr. Henry habita en un barrio que se llama Hialeah II etapa, su esposa es ama de casa, tiene dos hermosos hijos de 1 año y de 3 años de edad. Don Henry trabaja en una empresa privada desempeñándose como electricista industrial desde hace un año. Anteriormente el trabajaba como chofer de la empresa, y luego lo promovieron a electricista ya que el estudió esa carrera, pero al no hallar plaza en su profesión le toco aceptar de chofer ya que tenia que mantener una familia. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines y clavos para cambiar el techo que está en mal estado, y quiere que su familia goce de una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Henry lives in a neighborhood called Hialeah II, his wife is a stay at home mother, they have two beautiful children 1 and 3 years old. For the last year Henry has worked for a private company serving as an industrial electrician. He previously worked as a driver for the company, and then was promoted to electrician because he studied that field. However, he first accepted the driver position because he could not find a position in his field and needed to support his family. With the loan request he plans to buy construction materials such as zinc, rods and nails to change the roof in his home which is in poor condition, since he would like his family to enjoy a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the roof of his home.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Monsieur G. Koffi est né le 12 décembre 1980 à Adétikopé, dans la préfecture de Zio. Après sa formation en couture, il a ouvert son propre atelier. Marié, il est père de 02 enfants. Sa femme, grâce à son petit commerce contribue aux dépenses familiales. Excellent couturier, il est très estimé par les clients à cause de sa compétence. 
Dynamique dans ses activités, il sollicite un crédit pour acquérir d’autres machines afin de rendre le travail plus efficace et plus rapide. Par le présent crédit, il pense rentabiliser plus ses activités afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi G. was born on December 12, 1980 in Adétikopé, in the Zio prefecture. After leaning sewing, he opened his own workshop. Married, he's the father of 2 children. His wife helps him with the family expenses, thanks to her own little business. An excellent tailor, he's very well respected by his customers due to his competence. Energetic in his business, he's seeking a loan to purchase additional machines to render his work faster and more efficient. With this loan, he thinks he will increase his revenue to better contribute to improving the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing machines for his workshop

loans.name: Phebe

texts.en:
Born in 1955, Phebe is married and has seven children. She is proud that she and her husband were married in a traditional ceremony, to which she attributes their good luck that they were blessed with so many children. Unfortunately, her husband is dead.

With her previous loans from GHAPE, Phebe succeeded in growing and providing her community with cassava and ndjamadjama (huckleberry leaves -- a popular green vegetable). Given a loan, she plans to buy fresh manure, fertilizer, seedlings and chemicals to expand and improve her farm. She also intends to buy piglets to fatten and sell for their meat.  She plans to repay the entire loan in 24 months.

loans.use: To buy fresh manure, fertilizer, seedlings and chemicals to expand and improve her farm

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr: Henriette M. est une veuve de 59 ans, mère de 04 enfants dont 02 sont des handicapés (visuel et moteur). Elle veut ce prêt pour promouvoir son activité de vente de fruits divers. Son objectif est de bien prendre en charge sa famille et d’assurer la dépense quotidienne
texts.en:
Henriette M. is a 59-year-old widow and the mother of 4 children, out of which 2 are disabled (visually and physically). With this loan, she wants to promote her business, which consists in selling various kinds of fruits. Her goal is to adequately support her family and its day-to-day expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell fruits (bananas and papayas)

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Madame Bintou  S. est une femme mariée de trente quatre (34) ans, mère de deux (2) enfants qui vit dans une famille polygame dans la sous- préfecture de Selingué.
Dès le bas âge elle apprit la production de la pâte d’arachide auprès de sa mère très réputée et expérimentée en la matière.  
Afin d’améliorer ses activités, elle intégra le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso maintenant deux ans. Après trois prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous bien remboursés ; elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel avec lequel elle compte acheter,  600  kilogrammes d’arachide et 25 bassinets en plastique pour emballage.
Elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois auprès des producteurs des villages environnants de Sélingué. Les grains d’arachide une fois bien triés, sont asséchés, grillés et vannés. Après ils sont  amenés au moulin pour obtenir de la pâte (condiment très prisé dans la ration alimentaire malienne)  et emballée dans des bassinets pour être vendue sur le marché en gros. 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 55.000  F CFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer l’échéance du  prêt.
texts.en:
Ms. Bintou S. is a married woman, 34 years of age, and the mother two. She lives in a polygamous family in the sub-prefecture of Selingué. Since she was very young, she learned how to make peanut butter from her mother, who is highly regarded and experienced in it.

In order to improve her business, she joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program two years ago. After three solidarity loans (group loans), all repaid, she is on her second individual loan, which she plans to use for buying: 600 kg of peanuts and 25 plastic tubs for packaging. She gets supplies once a month from farmers in the surrounding villages of Sélingué. Once the peanuts are sorted, they are dried, roasted, and winnowed. Then they are taken to the mill for making the peanut butter (a very popular condiment among the staple foods of Mali) and for packing it into tubs to be sold wholesale.

She hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 55,000 francs CFA that will be used to help cover family expenses and to make loan payments.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of peanuts to make peanut butter

loans.name: Thuok's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuok T. is a group leader of three who all live in Khnong village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a buffalo breeder. Her husband, Mr. Phang Meth, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he grows rice. Unfortunately, he does not have enough money to hire laborers to work on the field. Additionally, he needs fertilizers to support the field to make his crop more productive. Thus, Mrs. Thuok T. has decided to ask for a loan for her husband’s plantation. She is 46 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a farmer while the others are enrolled in the local school. Mrs. Khut Yoeurn, who is a group guarantor, is also presented in the picture with the group members.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. Such loans allows borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina T. is forty years old. She is married and has two little kids who are currently in the basic school. Faustina lives with her husband and children in a community called Nkwaateng. Nkwaateng is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, a quite appreciable number of the women are involved in palm oil production. Faustina is one of the women who actively produce palm oil. She has been in business for five years. Her husband is a farmer.

She buys palm nuts from the local farmers in her community; processes them in her house to produce the oil and sells it at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from palm fruit which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (the oil) is skimmed off and reboiled to expel its water content. Faustina desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying palm fruit in bulk to be able to supply to more customers.

She believes the loan assistance will enable her to scale up production to serve a larger market and eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Temple Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm fruit in bulk

loans.name: Masmilian

texts.en:
Mismilian J., currently in the business of selling bread, is requesting a loan to buy more flour for the business.  Forty years old and widowed,  Mismilian  has four children, all attending school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she eventually hopes to build a hotel at the market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more flour for baking bread.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 29 years old and married with three children. She sells groceries and drinks for a living. Margaret is requesting the loan amount of N40 000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Hajra M. Rasheed Group

texts.en:
Hajra baji is a 55-year-old citizen of Lahore, Pakistan, where she has lived for the past 26 years. Her husband's name is M. R. and he works in a factory for a monthly wage. He has five years of experience in this business. She is the mother of three sons. Her elder son is 29 and runs a scrap business. The next to him is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver and her younger son runs a tea stall. Hajra baji runs a grocery shop in the community. She has two years of experience in this business. She saves her income to marry off her elder son. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand her grocery shop.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for hauling. Lubna baji and Farzana baji each want a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. Asia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Yemkala

texts.en:
Mrs. Yemkala D. is a grocery shopkeeper in the town of Balkhu. She opened her grocery store 2 years ago to strengthen the economic condition of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize, snacks, etc. in her shop. She has to expand her business and attract more customers. She is requesting for a Rs 25000 loan to expand her business.

Mrs. D. lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband is a teacher and regularly helps his wife Mrs. D. in her business. Her son is studying in pre-primary school and needs more attention.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie P. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro  City. She is 18 years old. Margie is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Margie owns & operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Margie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Margie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Margie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Margie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana Y., de 42 años de edad viuda desde hace 15 años, ella trabajo
Para una institución iniciando como ayudante de cocina y luego con el tiempo ocupa el puesto de cocinera. La experiencia que ella tuvo en su trabajo le ayudo a aumentar sus conocimientos porque aprendió a cocinar muy bien, ahora en su tiempo libre ella vende refaccionas en una maquila aprovecha la venta porque hace falta comida a los trabajadores, también siembra arveja china. El capital que tiene no le es suficiente para sus actividades y además desea diversificar sus ventas, ella tiene tres hijas una casada y dos que viven con ella, su sueño es apoyarlas en sus estudios para que logren tener una profesión, también quiere construir una habitación que sea solo para sus hijas para que puedan disfrutar una vida mejor y lo lograra con la ayuda de Dios y del crédito que necesita para salir adelante
texts.en:
Emiliana Y. is 42 years old and has been a widow for 15 years.
She worked for an establishment starting as a kitchen helper and later, with time, became a cook. The work experience she gained helped her increase her knowledge because she learned to cook very well. Now, in her free time, she sells snacks in a factory where she makes good sales because the workers need to eat. She also grows snow peas.
Her current capital does not support her business and she also wants to diversify her sales. She has 3 children, two live with her and one is married. Her dream is to support them in their studies so that they have careers. She also wishes to build a room just for her daughters so that they can enjoy a better life. With God’s help and this loan, she will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija M. is a member of the Majengo 12 borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is a 30-year-old single mother of two children. Her children are ages 10 and 7 years. 

Hadija started her own business selling bedsheets and mapazia (curtains) four years ago. She works all day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 50,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Hadija’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to add more bedsheets and curtains to her inventory. With the additional profit she will gain from the use of this loan, Hadija hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: To buy bedsheets and mapazia (curtains)

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a member of the Juhudi borrower group in Kola Morogoro. She is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of 2 children, ages 12 and 16. She also cares for another dependent.

Rehema started her own business selling cosmetics 3 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings (TZS).

This is Rehema's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requested 150,000 TZS to buy more cosmetics to sell. With the additional profit she gain from the use of this loan, Rehema hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sel

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
67-year-old Catalina's husband is a farmer while Catalina has her own hog-fattening (pig-raising) business, aside from helping her husband in the farm as a farmer as well. It has been five years now that Catalina and her husband have been able to have a rice-farming business. This has been a great source of income for the couple so they are able to send their only child to college until graduation.

Catalina's loan from ASHI when she joined in 2008 was used to finance this business instead of borrowing money from other people in their neighborhood which requires bigger interest rates per month. This was what they had been doing in the past when Catalina was not yet a member of ASHI and had no access to loans. Profit then was not really big and growing a business was very hard.

Now that Catalina has fully paid her first loan, she is requesting a much bigger loan to be able to accelerate the quality of rice they are producing for a better price and profit. Since Catalina is still using rice land which she doesn't own, every harvest they are required to give the owner of the land a share of the rice depending how many sacks they have agreed on for every acre. Someday, through her profit and helped by loans from ASHI, Catalina wished to purchase her own rice land.

loans.use: Will be used to finance her rice-farming business

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne  40 ans et  4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants, elles vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Balan, sous- préfecture de Fana Région de Koulikoro République du Mali.
Les femmes du groupe font le commerce d’articles divers tels, la cola, le pétrole, les biscuits, les pâtes alimentaires, les cigarettes, le thé, le sucre, le lipton,  des sachets de lait en poudre, de café, des boîtes de conserves etc. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens professionnel, de voisinage et parenté. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter des articles divers (thé, sucre, bonbon, pétrole, produits alimentaires)  au niveau de Fana pour les revendre dans le village de Balan à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser approximativement 9.000 FCFA de bénéfice mensuel et par personne qui sera réutilisés dans l’activité et une partie sera utilisée pour les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The members of the group Danaya are married women who average 40 years of age and four children. With their husband and children, they live in traditional extended families in the village of Balan, sub-prefecture of Fana, region of Koulikoro, in the Republic of Mali. The women of the group do commerce in various goods, such as: kola nuts, kerosene, cookies, pasta, cigarettes, tea, sugar, Lipton teabags, coffee, canned foods, etc. The women know one another by ties of profession, community, and kinship. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. They are now on their 11th solidarity loan. All the preceding ones have been properly repaid. They group members intend to buy various goods (tea, sugar, candy, kerosene, and foodstuff) in Fana, so as to resell them in the village of Balan to customers composed of women and men. The group members hope to realize about 9,000 francs CFA in profits each month and per person. The profits will be reused in the business, and a portion will be used for family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various store goods

loans.name: Luz Y Progreso 3 Group

texts.en:
Inocencia is the group coordinator of her group Luz Y Progreso (Light and Progress). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian (many of whom have recently emigrated from Haiti to the DR) and Dominican clients. Her group is based in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town in north of the capital Santo Domingo, an area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home with her husband and adult child in a simple structure of concrete walls and a tin roof, which she owns but does not have title to. 

Inocencia came to Esperanza with the goal of improving her business and she is excited to take her first loan. With this loan she plans to invest in acrylic nails, a nail making machine and tables to work on. With the profits from her increased business she intends to continue investing in her business and improving her quality of life. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Acrylic nails, a nail machine and tables

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren E. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives together with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her son currently attends a local secondary school and her daughter is in kindergarten. Her husband works as a driver in the city.

E. operates a sausage and egg trading business out of a rented stall at a local market. She started her business in 2006 after working for five years at a private company as a quality control officer. She enjoys her work, but says, "It is difficult to work in a place where you smell sausage all of the time.”

For the future, E. hopes to expand her business by offering a wider variety of products and by renting a second stall at the market. Her business is very important to her and her family, and she works very hard to improve their quality of life. She dreams of one day being able to build a house.

E. is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more consumer products in order to expand her product line.

loans.use: To purchase more products in order to expand her product line

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is 43 years old and married with seven children who are currently in school. Yaa is a very resourceful mother. She works with the motivation of supporting her children’s education, which will provide them with better life opportunities in the future.

Yaa sells a variety of soft drinks together with meat pies, which provides her customers with lunch in the afternoon. She sells through ‘hawking’. Her customers are usually passengers at bus stops.

With the loan, Yaa wants to take delivery of more soft drinks and also to make her meat pies in bulk. This would enable her to take advantage of the market. She hopes to use part of her profit to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and make meat pies in bulk.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
El Sr. Ernesto C. se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda en la cual vende zapatos, faldas, camisas, pantalones, blusas, ropa interior y varias cosas mas.  el cuenta con mas de 20 años de experiencia en este tipo de negocios. Su negocio esta ubicado en la calle del comercio, a la vez se dedica al cultivo de cafe lo que le genera otras fuentes de ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia, tiene 4 hijos y depende de su matrimonio solo uno, el cual cursa la carrera de Agronomia en la Universidad Agricola ubicada en Catacamas Departamento de Olancho
esta solicitando el credito para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Ernesto C. has a store where he sells shoes, skirts, shirts, pants, blouses, underwear, and various other items. He has more than 20 years of experience with this type of business. His business is located on the commercial street in his area. He also grows coffee, which generates another source of income for him to improve his family's living conditions. He has four children, but only one of them still is still his and his wife's dependent. This son is studying agriculture at Universidad Agrícola in Catacamas in the department of Olancho. He is requesting this credit to buy merchandise so he can supply his business and satisfy his clients' demand.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes, underwear, shirts, skirts, pants, and blouses

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: A. Jeanne est née en 1959 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à MEHINTO Thomas, Jeanne est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Jeanne a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de ses enfants. C’est depuis quatre ans que Jeanne vit au quartier Cadjèhoun, à Cotonou, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Jeanne n’a fait que le cours primaire. Depuis près de 11 ans, Jeanne vend des tissus de façon ambulante, et aussi par le système de distribution. Jeanne s’approvisionne à Cotonou. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Afin d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’accroître son activité pendant la période des fêtes de fin d’année, afin de satisfaire les demandes de la clientèle, Jeanne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Jeanne A. was born in 1959 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Thomas MEHINTO. Jeanne is the mother of three children, all in school. Jeanne supports another child besides her three children. For the last four years, she has been living, with her children and her husband, in the neighborhood of Cadjèhoun, in Cotonou. The couple together provides for the family’s expenses.

Jeanne only went to elementary school. For almost 11 years, she has been selling fabric from door-to-door, and also through the distribution system. Jeanne stocks up in Cotonou.

She is a previous customer of ALIDé who fully reimburses her loans. In order to increase her working capital and to increase her activity during the end of the year festivities, Jeanne is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to meet her customers’ demand.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cloth.

loans.name: Usima

texts.en: Usima R. is currently in the business of selling groundnut phaste (a paste made from ground peanuts) and tomatoes and is requesting a loan to purchase more groundnuts to make more phaste to sell. Usima is 22 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hardware store. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more groundnuts to make more phaste to sell

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita C. is 65 years old and a client of the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She is a farmer from Banga, South Cotabato in Mindanao. She manages a small parcel of land on which she grows corn, which she hopes will provide her family adequate supplies of food, clothing and other basic needs. 

She is hoping to receive a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy the needed farm supplies to increase the size of her harvest and her income.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Ninda

texts.es:
Ninda tiene 51 años, vive felizmente casada con su esposo Alejo, de 56 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos que ya no viven con ellos, pues se mudaron a la capital en busca de un futuro mejor y una buena educación. La vivienda en la que ella vive es propia.

El oficio que desempeña todos los días es el comercio de comestibles, productos de primera necesidad y perfumería. Paralelamente y desde hace 15 años cultiva plátanos, palta, cítricos oriundos de la selva peruana, actividades que realiza sola, porque según cuenta le gusta todo de sus labores y ya está acostumbrada a despertarse a tempranas horas de la madrugada para atender a su amado esposo y a los clientes madrugadores que van a su tienda principalmente en busca de pan, leche, chocolate para el desayuno.
Por las noches se va a descansar muy tarde pues en la zona donde vive no hay tiendas y pese a que su establecimiento esté cerrado los vecinos tocan la puerta para ser atendidos, “yo no me molesto, porque sino los atiendo a dónde irían a comprar los pobres”, refiere Ninda, a la vez que enfatiza que con las ganancias de su tienda educa a sus hijos y cubre la manutención de su casa, por lo que considera muy rentables sus actividades.
Como es una mujer emprendedora tiene planeado implementar otra tienda de abarrotes o ferretería al otro lado de su domicilio, además ya concluyó de construir el segundo piso de su casa y piensa convertirlo en un hospedaje turístico.

Esta es la quinta vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecida porque considera que desde que trabaja con su banco comunal su situación económica ha mejorado y ahora tiene aspiraciones porque sabe que la institución la ayudará, respondiendo con puntualidad y cumplimiento de sus pagos. Ninda tiene pensando invertir el dinero que solicita en comprar bastante mercadería aprovechando las festividades.
texts.en:
Ninda is 51 years old and lives happily with her husband Alejo, who is 56. They have four children who no longer live with them since they have moved to the capital in search of a better future and a good education. Ninda and her husband live in their own home.

She works every day selling food, basic necessities, and toiletries. At the same time, for the past 15 years, Ninda has been growing bananas, avocados, and citrus fruits native to the Peruvian jungle. She manages her businesses by herself and enjoys her work. Ninda is already accustomed to waking up early so that she can tend to her beloved husband and the early-rising customers who come to her general store to buy bread, milk, and chocolate for breakfast.

In the evenings, she takes a rest. Since there are no stores that are open late, she has neighbors who come by to her establishment when it is closed and knock on her door requesting to be served. “It does not bother me because the poor have no other place to shop,” says Ninda. She considers her business to be very profitable and emphasizes that her earnings have enabled her to educate her children and cover the household expenses.

As an entrepreneur, she has plans to open another grocery store or hardware store across from her home. In addition, she wants to finish construction of the second floor of her house and turn it into a tourist lodge.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Ninda is very grateful because she believes working with her Communal Bank has helped improve her economic situation. She now has aspirations because she knows the Institution will support her. In return, Ninda has been responsible in completing her payments on time. She plans to use the money she requested to buy enough merchandise in order to take advantage of the upcoming festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mirzokul

texts.ru: Сармисов Мирзокул проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 39 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Сармисов Мирзокул торгует более 13 лет. Он продает курут. Сармисов Мирзокул хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Mirzokul S. lives in the Vose region. He is 39 years old; married with 4 children. Mirzokul has been a vendor for over 13 years. He sells kurut. Mirzokul would like to diversify his wares. He is requesting the loan to increase his sales turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase sales turnover

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. is one of the newest members in her ASHI center. Her business is not yet as big as the others, however she together with her family spends wisely the small profit they get out of it for their basic needs. Certainly, Teresita wants her hog fattening business to grow more while her children are still young (they are two and four years old). 

Hog/pig fattening is a kind of business wherein after four months of fattening, the hog/pig can be sold alive or slaughtered. The more hogs one can sell, the more the profit, which is why Teresita is requesting a much larger loan to buy more piglets for fattening.
