Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment--a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts in bulk

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emiliano tiene 39 años, y una esposa muy colaboradora, que lo apoya en los trabajos del campo. Esta pareja ha tenido 5 hijos que en este momento están en la etapa de colegio.  Se dedica con su esposa. a la agricultura desde muchos años atrás, para ellos es su fuente de ingreso, le gusta que su tierra esté bien trabajada, siembra 50 sacos de semilla de papa y no descuida ninguna de sus chacras sembradas, asimismo sembró arvejas, y habas.   Su esposa y sus 5 hijos trabajan para sus ingresos diarios; de los cuales el mayor tiene 20 años, quien le ayuda fielmente al cuidado de los cultivos, y después tiene que ir a estudiar.  Como tiene ya sembradas sus tierras, necesita de un capital para que abone sus cultivos y así cosechar y cotizar un buen precio en el mercado. Lo que más le incomoda es el precio muy elevado del abono, que lo que tiene no le alcanza.  Emilio trabaja para  solventar los estudios de sus 3 menores hijos, de los 5 que tuvo.   Con el préstamo,  invertirá en la compra de abono para su chacra de papas.  Su anhelo, con el tiempo, es de sembrar en mayores cantidades, y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Emilio is 39 years old and has a very collaborative and supportive wife who joins him in tending to their crops. This couple has 5 children who are all in school. He and his wife have been working in agriculture for many years, it's their livelihood. Emilio likes the earth to be well worked; he plants 50 bags of potato seeds and takes care of all of his cultivated crops, like the arvejas and habas. His wife and 5 children work for the family's daily income; the eldest is 20 years old and helps take care of the crops, but then has to go and study. As Emilio has already planted his land, he needs a loan to fertilize his crops in order to fetch a good price at the market. Unfortunately, fertilizer is expensive and Emilio just can't afford it. Emilio works to pay for the educations of the 3 youngest of his 5 sons. With this loan, he'll buy fertilizer for his potato crop. His goal, with time, is to plant larger quantities and educate his children.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his potato crop.

loans.name: Maritza Irene

texts.es: La Sra. Maritza Zacarias es cliente nuestra desde el año 2007, se dedica a la producción de chompas de hilo las cuales vende por docena a las comerciantes de la calle Tumusla, un mercado de ropa muy conocido en la ciudad. Es cliente muy responsable en sus pagos y tiene un buen historial crediticio,los creditos que sacó anteriormente fueron para equipar su taller comprando mas maquinaria.La señora Maritza es madre soltera de un niño de 10 años de edad y además mantiene a sus padres quienes son mayores de edad, su actividad le brinda los recursos necesarios para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maritza Zacarias has been a client since 2007. She makes linen sweaters, which she sells by the dozen to vendors on the street Tumusla, where a well-known clothing market is located. She is a very responsible client in terms of her repayments and has a good credit history. Her previous loans were used to stock her workshop by purchasing more machinery. Mrs. Maritza is a single mother of a 10 year old boy. She also supports her parents, who are elderly. Her business allows her to bring in all the necessary resources to pull her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Rosario Cristina

texts.es: La Señorita Rosario Cristina de 24 años de edad, Soltera de oficios Estudiante “Compra y Venta de Ropa Típica para mujeres”, cuentan con un pequeño negocio, desde su niñez se dedicaba al Comercio gracias a los préstamos  a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Paraje Chichaclan, Cantón Poxlajuj del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra y venta de ropa típica, dicho Comercio para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosario Cristina is 24 years old and single. She has a small business buying and selling traditional women's clothing. She has worked in this field since she was young, thanks to loans that helped her family get ahead. Rosario lives in the Chichaclan neighborhood of the Poxlajuj district of Totonicapán, Guatemala, and is very well-known there.

She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner Asociación ASDIR in order to help her buy and sell traditional clothing. This investment will enable her to successfully meet her clients' demand, and thereby increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy traditonal clothing

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel Vasquez P. is 40 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the eastern jungle region of Peru. Pucallpa is the regional capital of the tropical Amazonian department of Ucayali, which is characterized by the meandering Ucayali River that flows north, meeting up with Amazon and, eventually, flowing into the Atlantic Ocean. Fifty years ago, Pucallpa was a tiny caserío or hamlet; but everything changed when the only paved highway leading into the Amazon region was built and Pucallpa became the gateway to the jungle at the roads’ end.  Since the mid-20th century, the city has sprung up and engulfed the surrounding caserios.  Today the city is a bustling, hot metropolis with immigrants from all over Peru.

Maribel is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Women Entrepreneurs) bank.  She has worked with them and the Manuela Ramos microfinance organization for over four years now.  Maribel first started with loans just under $100, but she has gradually upped her loan amounts to well over $700 now.

Maribel used to sell only shoes for a living, but now as her business has grown she has started to sell clothing and food too.  She is requesting 2,200 Nuevo Soles to be repaid over the course of six months. She will use the loan to purchase chicken, rice,  t-shirts, shoes, and other clothing.

loans.use: To buy chicken, rice,  t-shirts, shoes, and other clothing

loans.name: Martiza Mercedes Viii Group

texts.en:
The Bank of Hope "Maritza Mercedes" is located  in El Seybo. Group 8 has just gotten approval on their third loan. All members of this group will be investing their money directly in merchandise purchases. Sandra M. is the group representative. Her business consists of selling shoes. 

In the future, these micro-entrepreneurs state that they'd love to see better lives for their children, good health-care and education, they'd like to grow their business ventures further, and some would like to continue their own studies (at the secondary and university level). Sandra has set herself the goal of building her own house. 

The picture provided shows these group members gathered at the Esperanza office in El Seybo. 

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: purchase shoes and sandals

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Mrs. Soy L. is a villager in Prey Meas village in Takeo province. She is a grocer. Her husband, Mr. Kong Seng, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. He faces an obstacle because he usually needs to paya lot of money to plow the field. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Soy L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen to plow the field. She is 45 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed, another stays at home to do housework and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy two oxen to plow a rice field.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina A. is fifty-one years old. She is a widow and the mother of three little kids who are in basic school. Augustina lives with her children in a family house in a community called Nkwaateng. Nkwaateng is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, quite a large number of women are involved in palm oil production. Augustina is one of the women who actively produce palm oil. She has been in business for six years. 

She buys the palm nuts from the local farmers in her community; processes it in her house to produce the oil and sells at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from the food of the palm fruits. It has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (the oil) is skimmed off and boiled again to expel water content. Augustina wants to use the loan to expand her business by buying the palm fruits in bulk. She will then be able to increase the number of customers she serves.  She owns a refrigerator and uses it for the sale of sachet water to support her family with additional income.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to scale up production to serve a larger market and, eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Kingdom Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee loans for one another and support each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To procure palm fruits and sachet water in bulk.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata A. is twenty-six years old and the mother of three children, ages nine, six and three. She sells cereals in the Nyamasaria slum where she lives. She says her dream is to finance her children all the way through college and that she enjoys running her own business. She buys most of her goods from the Kibuye market in downtown Kisumu. Her husband also helps finance things as a tailor. Consolata is asking for $125 to expand her business.

loans.use: Cereals

loans.name: Askarjon

texts.ru: Аскарчон занимается продажей масла на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда. Он продает хлопковое масло, говяжий жир, растительное масло и сливочное масло. Разные масла он закупает в разных местах. Хлопковое масло он закупает хлопковом заводе, растительное и сливочное масло ему поставляет фирма. А говяжий жир он закупает у мясников. Еще он продает иранские масла "Мумин", которые поставляет та же фирма. Сейчас масла подешевело. И поэтому торговля пошла лучше. Аскарчон планирует расширить свой бизнес и открыть свой магазин.
texts.en:
Askarjon sells oil in Panchshanbe market in Khujand. He sells cottonseed oil, suet, vegetable oil, and butter. He buys different oils in different places. He buys cottonseed oil from a cotton factory; vegetable oil and butter is delivered by another company. And he buys the suet from butchers. Additionally, he sells an Iranian oil called "Mumin" which is delivered by the same company. Currently, the price of oil has fallen, and consequently his trade has gotten better. Askarjon plans to expand his business and to open up his own shop.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling oil

loans.name: Marie Joy

texts.en:
Marie Joy R. is 22 years old and striving hard to have a progressive life. She and her husband Edgar were gifted with two children. Edmar is 6 years old and Desyrie is 6 months old. Marie Joy's chosen business is vending snacks, such as peanuts, banana cue, and vegetables. She is also a hog raiser in their village.

According to her, all her efforts and sacrifices are for her children. She hopes to give them a progressive life in the future. For her to fulfill her plans, she is requesting a loan for PHP 4,000 for the improvement of her enterprise.

loans.use: To expand her hog raising business.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina S. is from the town of Tudela Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Felina is married and has five school-aged children. Felina earns a living by owning and operating a dress-making business. She provides women's tailoring services to local community members. Felina has been engaged in her business for some years now and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Felina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Felina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,500 PHP from GDMPC. Felina is now requesting a new loan of 3,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as sewing machines, needles and thread. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Felina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business and to support her family's basic needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment such as sewing machines, needles and thread

loans.name: Đỗ Thị

texts.en:
T. Đỗ Thị is 38 years old and lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from this work.

In 2003, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase machinery to expand the business.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese A., 53, is married with ten children. She has many years of experience in her taro and banana plantation business. She sells to the village community and to the general public three days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). She has three previous loans with SPBD. 

SPBD loans are Akenese’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy stuff for her business and also to pay school fees and for home improvement

loans.use: To buy weedkiller, chemicals, knives, a sharpenner, a wheelbarrow and to pay for school fees and home improvement

loans.name: Stinely

texts.en:
Stinely is happily married to Jimbo. They live in a rural place in Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. They have great ambitions for their three children and that is why they strive hard to earn and support their children’s studies.

Stinely manages a general store business while her husband cultivates their farm lot twice a year. She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan from Kiva to use as additional business capital to buy more stock that will definitely increase her daily income. She also plans to purchase ten sacks of rice to retail in her store. She hopes that through their livelihood, they will be able to finance the education of their children.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Саида

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Каримова 1958 года рождения, замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж и сын Каримовой  уехали на заработки в Россию.Она с детство помогала родителям за уходом скота. Теперь она сама занимается откормом скота. У Каримовы есть дойная корова которая приносит ей дополнительную прибыль от продажи молока и сметаны. Она планирует купить  еще корову с телёнком и благодарит кредиторов за финансовую поддержку.

loans.use: На покупку крупно рогатого скота

loans.name: Zayas

texts.en:
L. Zayas is from the village of Jasaan , Misamis, Oriental. She is forty-four years old and married with three grown children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a specialized retail store selling different herbal products and food supplements. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2009, L. joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her store's product offerings. L. is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in improving her store. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to further expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Aïssata

texts.fr: Aïssata S. est une jeune femme mariée de 34 ans, mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait de l’embauche bovine et aimerait renforcer son activité. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.

loans.use: Faire de l'embauche ovine

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Hamidou T. a 34 ans, marié et sans enfant, il réside avec son épouse au quartier Dioulasso de la ville de Kadiolo (dans la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  T.  fait la commercialisation de  maïs  (graines) il y a environ sept  ans. En plus il gère : une pharmacie vétérinaire, une discothèque et une unité de pondeuses. 
Son magasin  d’achat et de vente de céréales se trouve au marché de la ville de Kadiolo. 
Il sollicite un quatrième prêt individuel  auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, les trois premiers s’étant bien déroulés, pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante. 
Il compte acheter avec son prêt,  trois tonnes de maïs  à Kadiolo ville les jours de foire et souvent dans les villages environnants auprès des producteurs. Ils sont vendues dans la ville de Kadiolo en gros au comptant les jours de foire à une clientèle composée essentiellement de forains ( venant de Sikasso et d’autres grandes villes). 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 55.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, payer les intérêts de son prêt et contribuer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mr. Hamidou T. is 34 years old, he lives with his spouse in the neighborhood of Dioulasso in the city of Kadiolo (in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.)

Mr. T. has done business selling corn (seeds) for about 7 years. Additionally, he manages a veterinary pharamacy, a disco and a hen-laying business. His store is located in the market of the city of Kadiolo.

He is requesting a fourth individual loan from the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy his growing clientele; the first three were fully repaid.

He will use this loan to purchase three tons of corn from Kadiolo on the days of the fair and from the surrounding villages with corn farmers. He sells mostly in the city of Kadiolo for wholesale in cash during the days of the fairs, to a clientele composed largely of fair-goers, coming from Sikasso and other large cities.

He envisions that this loan will enable him to earn a monthly profit of 55,000 FCFA, which he will use mostly to increase the his business' funds, pay the interest on his loan and contribute to his family's expenses.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is again here to request a loan of PHP 7,000 from lenders. She would like to further improve and grow her business which involves retailing and cultivation of vegetables in her backyard. The loan will be used as her additional revolving capital in purchasing more vegetables and fruits to sell. She is also planning to buy more vegetables to plant in her vegetable garden.

Lilibeth and her husband are planning to purchase hogs to raise. They believe that it will help them in time of their need. She hopes that lenders will continuously support her business because it really provides most of their family needs.

Lilibeth is now 23 years old and has two children. Joanna, her eldest is now two years old and her youngest is just one month old. Lilibeth is hoping to give a good future to her children by striving hard to succeed in her business. Her husband who is a painter is very supportive with her business. He cultivates their farm and helps her in her business most of the time.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Eva Cayetana

texts.es: La Señorita Eva es originaria de la comunidad de Chuipache lugar muy hermoso por los bosque de San Miguel Totonicapán  su principal fuente de ingreso es la venta y compra y crianza de animales domésticos inicio su propio negocio hace cuatro años  sus principales lugares de ventas  son: Totonicapán, San Francisco el Alto y salcaja Quetzaltenango actualmente necesita de un crédito que le servirá para ampliar su capital y aprovechar la época de fin de año  donde las ventas incrementas y con las ganancias que obtiene le permitirá  mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Eva is from the community of Chuipache, a beautiful place near the forests of San Miguel Totonicapán. Her main source of income is the selling, purchasing and breeding of domestic animals. She started her business 4 years ago and she most of her transactions take place in Totonicapán, San Francisco el Alto and Quetzaltenango. She currently requires a loan, which will help her increase her working capital and take advantage of the end of the year, when sales increase. With the earnings from this she will be able to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita V. es madre responsable ya que ha llevado el sustento a sus dos pequeños hijos que estudian en el colegio. Sus pequeños requieren del apoyo de ella para superarse por lo que a diario ella vela por el bienestar de cada uno de ellos.

La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para el pago de los aranceles escolares ya que le urge hacer tales pagos para permitir que sus pequeños sigan estudiando en el colegio y así contribuir para que en el futuro lleguen a ser grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Señora Margarita V. is a responsible mother who has provided for her two small children who are studying in school. Her little ones require support in order to succeed in school, so she sees to the welfare of each one of them daily. The reason that she has approached Ceprodel is to request a loan to pay for school fees, since she must make these payments in order that her children can continue to study at school, so that they can become true professionals in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es: Wilber es casado, no tiene hijos, trabaja como asesor pedagogico del Ministerio de Educación, esta solicitando su primer crédito  con AFODENIC, para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es terminar de construir una habitación, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa la cual trabja como docente, a pesar que no tienen hijos ayudan a sus familia ya que son de escasos recursos económicos,  Wilber es un joven con muchos deseos de superación profesional y laboral, actualmente esta estudian su primer año en ciencias de Educación en la Universidad URACCAN , el ha ido poco a poco mejorando su vivienda  desde que la obtuvieron para tener un hogar digno para su familia que cumpla con las condiciones que la familia necesita y su sueño es ser un profesional con mucha experiencia, salud y trabajo
texts.en:
Wilber is married. He does not have children. He works as a pedagogical advisor in the Ministry of Education. He is asking for his first loan with Afodenic to improve his house by finishing the construction of a room. He has his wife’s help. She works as a teacher. In spite of not having children, they help their families because they have scarce economic resources. Wilber is a young man with a great desire for professional and work success. He is currently studying his first year in the science of education in the Uraccan University. He has been improving his house little by little since they got it. He does this to have a decent home with the necessary conditions for his family. His dream is to be a professional with much experience, health, and work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married with a grown daughter. She is a small entrepreneur from Zaporozhye where she sells jean clothing in Angolenko market. Nadezhda owns a vending kiosk in the central row of the marketplace. Her kiosk stands out as it offers a nice selection of jean clothing items of good quality at reasonable prices. Nadezhda has been n this business for eight years. Presently, she has about 15,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her monthly profit is 2,000 Grivnyas. 

Nadezhda is seeking a loan of 12,400 Grivnyas to re-stock the winter clothing assortment that she offers for sale in her vending kiosk. We believe her perseverance, managing skills and enthusiasm will help her achieve her goal and succeed in business.

loans.use: To restock winter clothing

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum C. is an older, widowed mother who has given birth to five children. One of her sons, who is shown in the picture, owns a small machine that he uses to mill rice and bran, which he then sells. He feeds any leftover rice to his pigs. 

Chum C. is 67 and lives in Kampong Chhnag Province where she owns a medium-sized farm. She earns a living from this land by growing a rice crop that she sells and eats. After Chum C. has harvested her rainy-season rice crop and collected the proceeds, she wants to replant a rice crop during the dry season. Due to the lack of capital, Chum C. would like to ask for a Kiva loan that she will buy use to buy fertilizer and seeds for her second crop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce en el departamento de León, la señora Reyna H. se ha dedicado con mucho esfuerzo a su actividad de crianza de ganado y trabajos agrícolas habiéndose dedicado a estas actividades desde hace mas de 20 años habiendo alcanzado gran experiencia en ello.
Ella es madre de tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar por lo que debe de brindarle las condiciones para su desarrollo. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de cuatro vaquillas para proceder con su crianza y luego extraerle la leche para comercializarla y es por esta razón que espera confiadamente que su crédito sea otorgado y así comprará dichas vaquillas para continuar en su actividad de ganadería y sacarles el máximo provecho.
texts.en:
Sra. Reyna H., who lives in the town of El Sauce in the Nicaraguan "departamento" of Leon, makes a living raising cattle and doing other farm-related jobs, work she has been doing for more than 20 years. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are still in school, and she owes it to them to create the conditions they need to thrive. She is applying for a loan to buy four heifers that she will raise for a milking business. She hopes to get the loan so that can buy the heifers, continue her livestock business and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy four heifers for livestock business.

loans.name: Latifa Lutale ‘S Group

texts.en:
Latifa is 40 years of age, widowed and has twelve children aged between 13 and 19 years. All of her children go to school. The family resides and rents a two roomed house where she stays with six people. She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity and no piped water at home.  The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees for children and medication and feeding the family. 

Latifa owns a restaurant in Katanga  selling all types of snacks like chips, chicken, fish, and sausages. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 50 customers a day. Latifa has done this business for over ten years. She incurs transport costs to and from buying food supplies from different markets. Her main challenges are seasonality and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place.  She sells on retail basis only.

Latifa has been with MCDT for four years, servicing her fifth loan with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more food supplies like sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking fish, and packets of sausages. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and start doing outside catering.
.

loans.use: To  buy sacks of Irish potatoes, cooking oil and packets of sausages

loans.name: Wellars

texts.en:
Wellars is 26 years old and is single. He lives with his parents in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Wellars has been a businessman for three years, selling onions, nuts, tomatoes and so on. He has chosen this kind of business because these products are needed by everyone who is going to cook, and they are more profitable than another foodstuffs.

Wellars is a hardworking man, his business is open from eight in the morning to eight in the evening every day. His business is located in the Kimironko market not far from Rwanda’s international airport. Actually, his business is very organized as well as employing one person as a helper so that his business runs well.

Now, Wellars is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more vegetables to attract more customers. With this added attraction, he will be able to obtain more profits which will allow him to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Charbel

texts.en: Charbel has worked as an electrician for the past 15 years. He works on a freelance basis serving homes and shops upon request of his clients. He is well known in his town and the neighboring villages. He is 30 years old, single, and his family's sole provider. Today, Charbel has found an opportunity to expand his business into other areas and take on more projects. To do so, he's asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy new tools instead of the used ones he has now.

loans.use: buy new tools

loans.name: Fanny Luz

texts.es:
Fanny pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sacsayhuaman” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 23 años, ella es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que se las ingenio para abrir su propio negocio de venta de artesanía, ella tiene un local alquilado cerca a la Plaza Armas del Cusco, donde expende sus productos de platería y ya son dos años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Los ingresos de la socia Fanny fueron afectados por la caída del turismo en la ciudad del Cusco. La poco afluencia de turistas se debe a las fuertes precipitaciones fluviales que cayeron durantes los meses de enero y febrero haciendo que muchos local cerraran por falta de ventas, pero Fanny es una joven impetuosa se sigue adelante a pesar de las adversidades. Fanny usará el préstamo para comprar más platería.  El sueño de la socia es tener su propia  tienda y así de esta manera vender más y tener más ingresos económicos y darse una mejor calidad de vida.    
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Fanny is a member of the Communal Bank "Sacsayhuaman", which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 23 years old. This hardworking and enterprising young woman managed to open her own business selling handicrafts. She has a rented location near the Plaza Armas in Cusco where she sells products made of silver. Fanny has already been in this business for two years and has done very well because of the effort she puts into her work. Her earnings were impacted by the slump in tourism in the city of Cusco. The lack of tourists that resulted from the heavy rains during the months of January and February caused many businesses to shut down due to a lack of sales. However, Fanny is a determined young woman who pressed forward despite these adversities. She will use this loan to buy more silver. Her dream is to have her own shop so that she can sell more and generate additional income that will provide her a better quality of life.

Fanny is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase silver

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en: N. Cissy is a resident of Kawempe Lugoba near St. Mark Clinic. She has a clothing business and she is a farmer in the village. She has been in business for over three years. She is using the loan to purchase clothes (sportswear) from Kampala shops for her shops in Kalerwe. She wants to expand her business of selling sportswear. She is a promising business lady whose dream is traveling to Nairobi to purchase her goods at a subsidized price.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Madiama

texts.fr: Monsieur Madiama D. habite a Yoff mais il est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC a Ouakam depuis l’année dernière. Il a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur au sein de l’institution.  Il est âgé de 51 ans, marie et père de 2 enfants. Il s’active dans le domaine de l’élevage et du commerce de moutons. Il a une expérience de 7 ans dans cette activité qu’il a choisie par passion  depuis son enfance. Il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs destine a l’achat de moutons qu’il va revendre. Son premier crédit lui a permis  d’avancer dans ses activités et d’atteindre une capacité de faire face à ses charges  de chef de  famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Madiama D. lives in Yoff, but he has been member of the UIMCEC credit union in Ouakam since last year. He has already benefitted from an earlier loan. He is 51 years old, married and the father of two children. He raises sheep for resale. He has had seven years of experience in this business, to which he has been attracted since childhood. He is seeking a loan of 400,000 West African francs in order to purchase sheep for resale. His previous loan allowed him to grow his business and to achieve a sales volume which is necessary in view of his family responsibilities.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering the business capital

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 26 years old and single. Celestin has a small shop where he sells drinks (beer and Fanta), cooking oil, sardines and so on. Celestin has run this business for three years and his shop is open from 6 in the morning to 5 in the evening every day. Celestin is well-known in the region where his business is located. Celestin employs one person from his community so that his business runs smoothly.

Celestin is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more drinks and other products. With this loan Celestin will be able to attract more customers which will allow him to earn more profits. With the extra money, Celestin expects to get married.

loans.use: Expanding his shop

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a youth, aged 30 years, married to a peasant wife and together they have two children aged 3 years and 1 year and 9 months. His family resides in a rented house in Kagadi, Uganda.

Ibrahim is the income earner for the family. He has a shoe business selling shoes on market days in different areas in his home district. He says his business has grown in size over the six years he has operated it having started as a food seller in the capital, Kampala. He faces a transport problem in his business, though, due to poor roads that are common in the upcountry areas of Uganda.

Ibrahim’s purpose in requesting the loan is to buy secondhand shoes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand shoes to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma G. is from the village of Bantug. She is 41 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Wilma owns and operates a beauty salon, providing haircutting, hair curling, hair straightening, manicure and pedicure services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Wilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her tenth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza D. is from the village of  Digkilaan, Iligan City. She is 32 years old. Annaliza is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Annaliza owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Annaliza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Annaliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annaliza is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Annaliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Djigui 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Djigui 2 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de34 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Gnabourouthila, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide et  le petit mil. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne et les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, NANA F. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,5 hectare  de céréales et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35 000FCFA en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djigui 2 Group are married women who are, on average, 34 years old with 4 children. They live for the most part in polygamous households in Gnabourouthila, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture in Koulikoro, the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) with the goal of better organizing their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate include, among others, peanuts and pearl millet. They are on their third rural loan, and the previous loans were repaid properly. With this new loan Nana F. (one of the women in the group) intends to buy farming inputs before the prices go up, to purchase small equipment, and to pay for labour costs to maintain about 1.5 hectares of cereal and peanut crops. The products are sold in the city of Dioïla after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. They intend to realize an average profit of 35,000 FCFA at the end of the term.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy faming inputs, purchase small equipment, and pay for manual labour

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 54 years old and is married. She struggles in selling a variety of foodstuffs, mainly cassava flour, corn flour, rice, sugar, etc. This is her fifth successful year in this business and the hours of her business are from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Despite five years of experience in the business, Constance's capital is still too low to expand meaningfully, with the result that her profits are still too low. To end this, she is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.

Once given this loan, Constance will expand her business through purchasing additional foodstuffs to sell. With these additional foodstuffs, her sales as well as her profits will increase. Thus, she will also be able to improve the living style of her family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials (tin roofing, cement, wood, bolts)

loans.name: Villa Universitaria Group

texts.es:
El Comité Villa Universitaria de la ciudad de San Ignacio Misiones se dedican al comercio, venta de ropas, comidas, empleadas domésticas, almaceneras y otros.
Se encuentran actualmente en el 12° ciclo, permaneciendo en el grupo se han beneficiado con el crédito, la consulta oftalmológica y las capacitaciones de la institución.  
Se encuentran motivadas y desean seguir trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya y gozar de los beneficios que ofrece el programa.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Ana que tiene un despensa donde ofrece productos de la uso domestico especialmente para la alimentación y para limpieza.
Comenta que tiene muchos clientes y que va muy bien con su negocio, además de su negocio ella también cuenta para la alimentación de la familia con cría de animales y producción de verduras y frutas.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como fideos, azúcar, aceite, enlatados, panificados, jabones y otros.
texts.en:
The “Villa Universitaria” (University Village) committee of the city of San Ignacio Misiones is dedicated to commerce: to the sale of clothing and food, to being domestic employees, storekeepers and others. They are currently in their 12th cycle. By staying in the group they have benefitted from credit, eye clinic consults and training workshops provided by the Institution. They are motivated and want to continue collaborating with Fundación Paraguaya enjoying all the benefits that the program offers. One of the members is Ana who has a grocery store where she stocks home use items, especially food and cleaning supplies.She comments that she has many customers and she does well with her business. In addition to her store she also raises small farm animals and grows fruits and vegetables for her family’s nutritional needs. She is asking for funding to buy stock items for her store like: pasta, sugar, cooking oil, canned goods, baked goods, soaps and others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pasta, sugar, cooking oil, rice, baked goods, dairy products and others.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La Sra. Leonarda S. es comerciante hace cinco años, tiene una despensa en su  domicilio en el Barrio Virgen de Fátima,  de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo.
 Esta casada con el Sr. Pedro Vázquez hace 21 años, tienen 5 hijos juntos: Nestor 21 , Pedro 17, Fátima 10, Rosio 9, Alexis 10 meses.
Su negocio es muy importante por que es la entrada principal de la familia para el sustento de la misma, además comenta que comenzó con un pequeño kiosko y de a poco fue creciendo y a la vez le ayudo a dar el beneficio a sus hijos. Conoció el programa de la Fundación de los créditos a emprendedores y gusto mucho de la oportunidad de que la institución pudo brindarle.
 Tiene buena clientela y asegura que utilizará bien su crédito en la compra de mercaderías como bebidas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leonarda S. has been a merchant for the last five years. She has a store in her home in Coronel Oviedo’s Virgen de Fátima neighborhood. She has been married to Mr. Pedro Vázquez for the last 21 years and they have five children: Nestor, 21, Pedro, 17, Fátima, 10, Rosio, 9, and Alexis, 10 months. Her business is very important because it’s the family’s main source of income. She comments that she started out with a small kiosk and gradually grew allowing her to benefit her children. She learned about the Fundación’s program of loans to entrepreneurs and liked the opportunity that the institution was able to offer her. She has a good customer base and assures us that she will use the loan well to buy more merchandise like beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages like: soft drinks, wines and beers.

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
María del Socorro es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío Pueblo Libre del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral, ella cría pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio, alimentándolos de granos y pastos naturales, cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona o de lo contrario vende su carne por kilos. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de carne de res, cerdo y pollo, comprando la carne de el pueblo de Tambogrande y vendiendola de manera ambulante en los diversos caseríos de la zona.

María desea adquirir alimento balanceado para lograr que su aves se desarrollen de mejor modo para así poder obtener mas ingresos por sus ventas, para lograr esta acción se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una persona bastante entregada a su familia y que siempre está dispuestas a ayudar a los que la necesitan. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Maria del Socorro is a mother, she is 32 years old, and she lives together with her husband and their children in the village of Pueblo Libre in the Tambogrande district. It is an agricultural region located in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name. It is more than three hours and a half from the city of Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque. She raises and sells poultry, including turkeys and chickens. She raises them in the rear section of her house, feeding them grains and natural grasses. When they have achieved a certain stage in their development she sells them to the businesses in the region of she sells the meat by the kilogram. Her husband sells beef meat, pork meat and chicken meat. He purchases the meat in the village of Tambogrande and resells in the various villages in the area. Maria wishes to purchase balanced feed to help her poultry grow better and ultimately see better profits. To reach her goal she has decided to request a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 500 nuevos soles. She is a very devoted mother and she is always ready to help anyone in need. Those that know her consider her to be a very calm and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchased balanced poultry feed.

loans.name: Kisajon Ene Kolila

texts.en:
Kisajon is married and has three children. She was introduced to KADET through a credit officer, and she is requesting her first loan. 

Kisajon's primary business is selling beads. She also buys animal fats to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for about ten years. With the loan, she will enlarge her business by purchasing more beads, clothes, decorations, and animal fats to supply to  her customers and to the people who run the shops near her.

Kisajon's business is located in a busy open-air market. Kisajon hopes to become a big trader and to supply tourist products.

loans.use: To purchase beads, clothes, decorations, and animal fats

loans.name: Lomas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
El grupo Lomas del Sur lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Alma A. de 37 años quien hecha tortilla, frijoles y leche agria desde hace cinco años. Ella inicio como todos inician dice entre risas con unas ganas de progresar y con pocos recursos pero que gracias a los créditos ha mejorado. Ella tiene tres hijos de 17,13 y 9 años los tres estudian y después de clases le ayudan a ver el negocio.
Los integrantes del grupo son Maritza García de 28 años quien tiene una munipulperia la cual inicio con las ventas de gaseosa y chiverías y Lidia Mesa se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace tres años. Ellas invertirán el crédito en el negocio con el fin de progresar.
texts.en:
The Loma del Sur group is composed of 3 hard-working women. One of them is Alma A.. She is 37 years old and she has made tortillas, beans and sour milk for five years. She started, “like everyone else”, she says in between laughs, “with a wish to make progress and little resources.” Thanks to the loans, things have improved. She has 3 children; they are 17, 13 and 9. The three of them are in school and after classes , they help look after the business.
One of the other members of the group is 28 year old Maritza García. She has a mini-mart which she started by just selling soft drinks and snacks. The other is Lidia Mesa. She has sold clothing for three years. They will use the loan to invest in their businesses with the goal of making progress.

loans.use: For corn, beans, wood and sour milk

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina  es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Nueva” ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 76 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y con seis hijos, con grado D. instrucción primaria incompleta.
La actividad a la que se dedica es el engorD. D. toros. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace tres años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual le sirvió para  incrementar el capital D. su negocio.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio.
Lo único que desea es que sus hijos sigan adelante y estén bien. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Agustina is a member of the “Ciudad Nueva” Communal Bank which is located in the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, department of Puno.  She is 76 years old, married, and has six children.  She did not complete primary school.

She is engaged in the business of raising bulls.  She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  Her first loan request was for S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, which helped her increase the working capital of her business. 

Now she is requesting a new loan for S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles which will allow her to increase her working capital once again.

All she desires is that her children keep well and continue getting ahead in life.  She is pleased with the punctual service that the Communal Bank provides.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Nuhum

texts.fr: Nuhum a 36 ans  et père d’un enfant. Il est enseignant de profession mais associe la photocopie et le traitement de textes pour mieux s’occuper de son enfant. IL cumule dans cette activité 3 ans déjà. En effet, il s’approvisionne à L’ETS KOUTOGLO & FILS à Lomé et revend à adidogomé. Il a employé une personne dans son Etablissement. Le crédit sollicité permettra d’acheter un copieur pour mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Nuhum is 36 years old and the father of one child. He is a teacher by profession but he also makes photocopies and does word processing in order to take better care of his child. He has been involved in these activities for 3 years already. 

He obtains his supplies at L’ETS KOUTOGLO & FILS in Lomé and he resells in Adidogomé. He employs one person in his business. The loan requested will allow him to buy a photocopier so that he can better satisfy his customers.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier

loans.name: Juntos Podemos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTOS PODEMOS; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Xiomara; la socia tiene 36; ella es casada y tiene 3 Hijos; la socia vive en San Sebastián;  La socia trabaja comprando y vendiendo frutas, ella se abastece de los proveedores que traen la fruta del valle y va hasta la parada de buses a comprar al por mayor y luego ella vende al por menor; la socia trabaja es este tipo de comercio desde hace 13 años. La socia desea poder tener un capital para esta temporada y ella está terminando su mercadería y también debe a un proveedor un saldo pendiente para que pueda adquirir nueva mercadería de frutas. La socia pagará un saldo pendiente y se abastecerá de un nuevo requerimiento de frutas de la estación. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar y saldar una deuda con su proveedor.

Los otros socios  se dedican la compra y venta de ropa, de juguetes, de frutas, venta de alimentos, venta de quesos y todos ellos solicitan el préstamo para hacer de este un capital para este mes de diciembre y poder tener mercadería nueva.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The 'Juntos Podemos' (Together We Can) community bank is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

One of the group's members is 36 year-old Xiomara.  She is married and has 3 children.  She lives in San Sebastián and works buying and selling fruit.  She stocks her business from the suppliers who bring fruit from the valley and goes to the bus stop to buy her produce wholesale.  She then sells her produce retail.  She has been in this business for 13 years.  Xiomara would like to have some capital for this season.  Her produce is running out and she also owes a supplier an outstanding balance if she is to acquire more fruit.  She will pay her outstanding balance and re-stock her business with seasonal fruit.  She is requesting this loan to buy fruit and pay her debt to her supplier.

The other members of the group buy and sell clothes, toys, fruit, food and cheese.  They are all requesting a loan to have capital for the month of December so that they can buy new merchandise.

The group's members are grateful to those who will take part in their dream by funding their loan and they pledge to make their repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy fruit and settle an outstanding debt with her supplier

loans.name: Julius  Olondanga

texts.en: Julius has been in the mining business in Naivasha town for the last six years. He is 38 years old and married to Roselyn Abiyo. They have three  school-age children. He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend who is also a member of KADET. This will be his first loan which he plans to use to buy working tools e.g. mallet and mattock. In the future, Julius hopes his business will grow and get more work from the Kenyan government.

loans.use: to buy working tools e.g. mallet and mattock.

loans.name: Nestor Cecilio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Nestor Cecilio; el tiene 48 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de radio, el tiene una emisora de radio en el distrito de Oropesa donde narra las diferentes noticias que pasa en el distrito de Oropesa y también en la ciudad de Cusco, el socio quiere mejorar y ampliar la emisora de radio. El  socio solicita el préstamo para implementar la cabina de radio como comprar mesas y radio.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nestor Cecilio is a member of the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Nestor Cecilio is 48 years old, married, and has 2 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his radio business.  He has a radio station in Oropesa district where he reads the news from Oropesa district and the city of Cusco.  He would like to improve and expand his radio station.  He is requesting this loan to set up a radio booth and to buy tables and radio.

Nestor is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To set up a radio booth and to buy tables and radio

loans.name: Ean

texts.en:
Ean S., 52, resides with her family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. sells beverages and food, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase more beverages and food to improve the current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her fourth loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more beverages and food to improve the current business

loans.name: C4704 Twiyarure Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 39 years old and married with two children. Emmanuel is the president of a group called 'Twiyarure'. He is pictured above in the black shirt on the left.  He owns a restaurant and he has been in this business for about ten years. The restaurant is open from 5AM until 9PM every day. He currently employs four people.  

Emmanuel will use the loan to purchase more equipment and food for the restaurant. He plans to use the profits to pay school fees and continue to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: Additional food and equipment for the restaurant.

loans.name: Hermelita

texts.en:
Hermelita L. is from the village of Kulasihan, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old, married and has 11 school-aged children. To make a living, Hermelita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods, biscuits, spices, detergents and toothpaste in the local community. Hermelita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Hermelita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as breads and beverages. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as breads and beverages

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is married and a mother of two. She operates a restaurant business to earn a living. She has been running her business for 5 years. She dreams of expanding her restaurant into hotel in the future.

Yehu Microfinance has been a blessing to her family. This is because she has been able to educate her children with her previous loans from Yehu Microfinance. She has requested 40,000 KES to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Burmakan

texts.en:
Burmakan M. is 56 and widowed. She lives with her son’s family in Kara – Balta town. She is engaged in selling vegetables at the local market. She started in 2001 and her husband helped a lot to develop this activity. Unfortunately , after his death in 2010, this business became unprofitable.

 In order to find an additional means of subsistence, Burmakan decided to start breed cattle. With the initial capital of 25,000 KGS she managed to earn 6,000 KGS a month from selling milk products. In order to develop her farm,  Burmakan has applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS, which will help her further broaden her business activities. In future, she plans to buy a flat in Kara-Balta town for her family. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Médiatrice

texts.fr:
Médiatrice est âgée de 22ans, divorcée, mère d’enfants dont l’âge varie de 16 à 19ans avec son niveau 3em.

Elle débute en 2001 avec un capital de30.000F et devient vendeuse  de poisson de mer  au marché tel que dorades, soles, bars, capitaine, carpes, barbillons.
Ses ventes journalières sont de 12.000F et  il y a des jours ou elle vend 25000F.
Avec le prêt, elle va renforcer son stock de vente en achetant : 2cartons de bars, 1carton de soles, 1carton carpes, 1carton de dorades, barbillons.
Avec ce stock pour un début, elle voudrait  renforcer ses économies pour atteindre ses objectifs :
 Construire une maison pour le bien être de sa famille et aider ses enfants  à avoir un emploi après leurs formations universitaires.
texts.en:
Médiatrice is 22 years old, divorced and mother to children aged between 16 and 19 years old. She left school in third grade (of the Congolese education system). She began in 2001, with a capital of 30,000 francs, to sell seawater fish, such as sea bream, sole, sea-bass, "Capitaine" fish and barbel at the market. Her daily turnover is 12,000 francs and there are days when she has sales of 25,000 francs.

With the loan she is going to build up her stock by buying: two boxes of sea-bass, one box of carp, one box of sea bream and barbel. With this stock she would like to start off by strengthening her savings in order to achieve her objectives: building a house for her family and helping her children to get jobs after their university studies.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of sea-bass, sole, carp, sea bream and barbel

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia K. is 38 years old.  She is currently in the business of selling alcohol.  She is a widow with two children both in school.  Her future goal is to open a shop.

loans.use: Stock more alcohol for sale.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan U. (pictured with her daughter) is a widow with one son and two daughters. Two are married and one lives outside the family home. Another one lives in the family home and he is a horse cart driver. Another one is a farmer. The family lives in a village across the Mekong River aboU. 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.   

Mrs. Phan U. sells fish. She buys fish from the fisherman in her village and sells them in a local market. She is asking for her first loan of $600 to purchase a horse for her son’s business driving a horse cart, because his horse was stolen.

loans.use: to purchase a horse for her son’s business driving a horse cart.

loans.name: Daniel Wanjii

texts.en:
Daniel has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last 15 years.  He is 48 years old, married to Esther Muthoni, and they have four school-aged children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres Entusiastas Group

texts.es:
Doña Elda Fabiola es casada, tiene 33 años D. edad, cursó los estudios D. educación secundaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica al comercio, a la venta D. ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, inició cuando contaba con un poco D. capital y al momento lleva 5 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien tanbién se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo, que le servirá para ampliar su negocio; va a comprar mercaderia para la reventa: sueteres, blusas playeras, cancetines, bufandas, gorras, ropas para bebé, ropa íntima, etc. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades productivas: a la producción D. D. prendas D. vestir, al comercio minorista y al servicio D. tienda en general.
texts.en:
Elda Fabiola is 33 years old and married.  She completed high school and has two children who are currently in school.  Elda's business is selling ladies', men's and children's clothes.  She started her business with just a little capital and now she has five years experience.  She has the support of her husband who also buys and sells products.

Elda got together a group so that she could request a loan with which to expand her business.  She will buy merchandise for resale: sweaters, blouses, t-shirts, socks, scarves, caps, baby clothes, underwear, etc.  The other members of the group work in different businesses including: making clothes, selling products retail and running a store.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Oscar Alberto

texts.es:
Oscar Alberto tiene 38  años de edad, el es casado y tiene  3 hijos menores de edad, Oscar Alberto cuenta con casa propia,la cual está ubicada en un zona urbano marginal del distrito de Mochumi, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque, cuenta con servicios de  luz y agua , el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.

Oscar Alberto se dedica a la venta de repuesto para bicicletas y motocicletas, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años, el a instalado su negocio en su misma localidad donde vive, por lo mismo que cuenta con  clientela fija y fidelizada a su negocio, gracias a que con el pasar del tiempo Oscar Alberto a adquirido experiencia en el rubro su negocio se viene desempeñando con éxito.

Oscar Alberto está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que el con este dinero pueda comprar una mayor cantidad de repuestos para surtir de la mejor manera su negocio 

Oscar Alberto es una persona muy trabajadora y honrada, bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores de la zona en donde reside. Las personas que le conocen la consideran tranquilo y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
Oscar Alberto is 38 years old, married and has three minor children. Oscar Alberto has his own home which is located in an outlying urban area in the district of Mochumi, fifteen minutes from the city of Lambayeque. His home has electricity and running water. The place is a small community of approximately 100 families. 

Oscar Alberto works selling spare parts for bicycles and motorcycles, a business he has had for two years. His business is set up in the same place where he lives. For that reason he has a stable and loyal customer base, thanks to which, over time Oscar Alberto has acquired experience in his line of work and his business is developing successfully. 

Oscar Alberto is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 Peruvian soles in order to be able to buy a large quantity of spare parts to better stock his business. 

Oscar Alberto is a very hardworking and honorable person, quite well known and respected by the inhabitants of the area. The people who know him consider him to be easygoing and quite responsible.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of spare parts to stock his business.

loans.name: Gerardo José Antonio

texts.es: Gerardo José Antonio de treinta años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos los cuales asisten a una escuela cerca de la localidad donde residen. El posee un negocio muy rentable de  venta de ropa para damas, caballeros, niñas y niños tiene diferentes estilos toda su mercadería es muy novedosa y de mucha calidad, además tiene los mejores precios la gente lo prefiere porque siempre encuentran lo que necesitan. Gerardo José está dispuesto a nunca desistir de su sueño, que es ver crecer su negocio; es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más ropa en variedad y por mayor; así siempre se mantendrá adelante de su competencia. Gerardo José Antonio tiene fe que con dedicación y esfuerzo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena y llevar al hogar una estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Gerardo José Antonio is 30 years old.   He lives with his life companion and their children that attend a school near the town where they live.  He owns a profitable business that sells different styles of clothing for women, men and children.  He sells high quality, new merchandise and he has the best prices .  People prefer to buy from him because they always find what they need.  Gerardo José will never give up on his dream to grow his business.  It is for this reason that he decided to request a loan from Integral that will allow him to buy a wider variety of wholesale clothing.  This is how he will always stay ahead of the competition.  Gerardo José has faith that with dedication and hard work he will be able to give his family a full life and provide financial stability for his household.

loans.use: purchase wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Alogo Group

texts.fr: ALOGO est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Antoinette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un militaire du nom de Pascal. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Antoinette et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Antoinette a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a près de quinze ans que Antoinette vend du maïs et du charbon de bois à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité qui lui permet d'assurer ses besoins et de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Antoinette vend également des condiments de sauce à son domicile. Antoinette s’approvisionne dans le Nord du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Antoinette sollicite un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe ALOGO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: The Alogo group comprises four people, all of whom live in the same area in Benin. The group representative, Antoinette (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 35 years old and married to a serviceman named Pascal. The couple have four children, all in school and in the care of their parents. Antoinette and her husband live together with their children. Antoinette ended her studies in secondary school. For close to fifteen years, she has sold maize and charcoal at her home. Alongside this activity, which allows her to provide for herself and for her children, Antoinette also sells sauce condiments at her home. She gets her supplies in North Benin. With the goal of satisfying her customers, Antoinette is seeking a loan along with the other Alogo group members. This loan will allow her to better respond to the demands of her clientele and generate more profits.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and maize.

loans.name: Ruperto Enrique

texts.es:
Ruperto es un hombre alegre y trabajador de 70 años de edad. Él vive con su esposa e hijo en una zona urbana del distrito La Victoria en Chiclayo. Ruperto es un señor que goza de muy buenas referencias personales, es una persona muy querida en su comunidad.

Ruperto se dedica, desde hace 18 años,  a la crianza y comercialización de aves de corral , pavos y patos. La crianza que Ruperto les da a sus aves es excelente y eso se ve reflejado en la calidad e estas. Ruperto cuenta con clientela establecida en su zona. Además de esta actividad, Ruperto vende CD´s por las mañanas en un puesto en el mercado de su localidad.

Ruperto solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 900 nuevos soles para  comprar pavos y patos y así aumentar la producción de su negocio. Además comprará el alimento balanceado que estos animales requieren para su buen desarrollo.

Ruperto desea mejorar su calidad de vida y este préstamo le sería de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Ruperto is a happy and hard-working man of 70 years. He lives with his wife and son in an urban zone of the La Victoria district in Chiclayo. Ruperto is a man who has very good personal references. He is a very beloved member of his community.

Ruperto has raised and sold barnyard birds--turkeys and ducks-- for 18 years. He provides excellent care for his birds, and this is reflected in the quality of these animals. Ruperto has an established customer base in his zone. On top of this business, Ruperto sells CD's in the mornings in a stall in the local market.

Ruperto is requesting a loan of 900 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase turkeys and ducks, and thus increase his business' production. He will also purchase the balanced feed that these animals require for their good development.

Ruperto wants to improve his quality of life and this loan will be very useful for him.

loans.use: to purchase turkeys, ducks and balanced feed.

loans.name: Duo Mujeres De San Lorenzo Group

texts.es: Aura Leticia. de 37 años  tiene 4 hijos, ella se dedica a la elavoracion y venta de  muñecos tipicos,desde hace 2 años ella es la leder de este duo,le da gracias a Dios porque le a hido bien en su negocio y sus ventas han aumentado,por eso esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elavoracion de muñecos tipicos al igual que la siguiente socia tambien se dedica a la elavoracion de muñecos tipicos,y nececita capital para trabajar.
texts.en: Aura Leticia is 37 years old and has 4 children. She has been making and selling traditional dolls for the last 2 years. She is the leader of this group of two and thanks God that her business has done well and her sales have increased. Due to this success, she is asking for a loan in order to buy the raw materials necessary to make traditional dolls, as does her fellow group member. She needs the capital in order to work.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials necessary to make traditional dolls

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is a rice farmer who is married and has five children. He has been a farmer for the past 20 years, having learned rice farming from formal training. 

He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and finally in harvesting activities. 

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).
