Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labour costs during rice production.

loans.name: Mikhuyu Group

texts.en:
Allan is the facilitator for Mikhuyu Group in Chwele. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011. Allan says that he joined in order to access good input prices, have access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, grow enough to feed his family, and have additional profits to spend on school fees.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Allan and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Allan joined One Acre Fund in order to access good input prices, grow enough to feed his family, have profits for school fees, and have inputs delivered right to his village market.

Allan has not yet harvested his 2011 maize, but expects that it will yield 8-10 bags on 1/2 acre.  

Allan says that he hopes to use the profits from his harvest to pay for his children's education, repair his home, save for the future, invest in livestock, and increase his investments in farming.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Josabeth

texts.es:
La señora Josabeth es socia del banco comunal Nuevas Amigas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija.
Se dedica  a la venta de prendas de vestir (ropas), trabaja con Manuela Ramos desde hace un buen tiempo y hasta el momento todo le ha ido bien, tiene ya una clientela fija, cuando trae su mercadería es casi todo para distribuir y cobrar a fines de cada mes.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,800.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 docena de camisas, 1 docena de polos, 1 docena de blusas, 1 docena de pantalones.
Gracias a este negocio puede cubrir algunos gastos de la casa porque su hija también contribuye con los gastos que hay en el hogar, gracias a Manuela Ramos ha podido educar a su única hija, ella es su única compañía.  Agradece a Manuela Ramos y pide que siga ayudando a todas las mujeres que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Josabeth is a member of the communal bank Nuevas Amigas in the district of Calleria in the Ucayali region. She is 55 years old and is a single mother with one daughter. Her job is selling clothes and she has worked with the organisation Manuela Ramos for a long time. So far, everything has gone well and she has a strong customer base. When she brings her merchandise it is almost always to deliver it and collect the money at the end of each month.

With her new loan of 1,800 nuevos soles she will buy a dozen shirts, a dozen polo shirts, a dozen blouses and a dozen pairs of trousers. Thanks to this business she is able to cover some of the costs of living, and her daughter also contributes to the household expenses. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, she has been able to educate her only daughter, her only companion. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos and asks that they continue to offer help to all the women who need it.

loans.use: to buy shirts and polo shirts.

loans.name: Ervin Santiago

texts.es: Don Ervin invertirá el crédito en Charolina, royal, forro fino, zuelas, hilos, pega blanca, bega amarilla,  evillas y Alistado.
texts.en: Don Ervin will use the loan to buy more shoe making supplies such as thin lining, soles, thread, white glue, yellow glue, buckles, etc.

loans.use: to buy shoemaking supplies

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, galletas entre otros productos, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos y galletas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to Valle Sagrado de Calca Communal Bank, located in the district of Calca, in the province of Calca and department of Cusco.

Juana, the member, is 52 years old and single with one child.  She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business selling basic household necessities such as rice, sugar, pasta, cookies, and other products.  She works from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m.  With this business Juana gets her child ahead.  She wants to expand her grocery store business.

Juana is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, pasta, and cookies wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making the repayments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, pasta, and cookies wholesale.

loans.name: Tengku Anita

texts.en: Tengku's business is a beauty salon and bridal shop. She is 53 years old and married with four children. Three of her children have already finished school and the youngest one is still in school. She has been in her business for 27 years. Starting from a hobby, now she has a lot of customers. She works out of her house. Her business is going well and she helps her husband send their children to school. The main challenge that she faces is not having enough capital to expand her business. With this loan, she wants to renovate her house and increase the space for her business. In the future, she hopes that she can extend her business by providing catering services.

loans.use: to buy materials to extend her business room

loans.name: Elmera

texts.en:
Elmera is married with four children. She is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Elmera owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year and every month she earns 2,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase additional products to sell.

Elmera has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Elmera hopes to expand her business and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert's primary source of income comes from rice farming. Together with his wife, he plants and harvests rice on his two-hectare rice field. Robert has three school-aged children and would like to provide them with a good education.

During the last harvest season in April, Robert was unable to harvest good crops due to a typhoon that had affected their area. He felt sad about what happened to his crops, but was still determined to provide to the needs of his family. 

In order to ensure good growth of his seedlings, Robert is now asking for a loan of PHP20,000 in order to buy the herbicides and pesticides (chemicals that are used to treat the herbs and pests that affect the seedlings' growth) that he will use in farming. He hopes to improve his crop and produce an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and pesticides for use in farming.

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Koeun is a 31-year-old farmer who also catches fish for sale. He has two children who are too young to attend school. He started farming on his farmland nearly ten years ago. He earns less than 11 US dollars per day to feed his family and he can save about 2 US dollars per day for unexpected expenses. 

This is his second loan with VisionFund. He completely repaid his first loan. Now he is requesting another loan to buy rice seeds for his farmland. 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase crop yield, to sell at a good price and earn more income to build up some savings for his family.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 29 years old, married and blessed with one child. He is a simple farmer who needs to earn more income to satisfy the needs and support the education of his child. He is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. These would be a great help in increasing his opportunity to earn a better income. He believes that when the loan is accompanied by hard work, he will develop his business and satisfy the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Singida Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha, who is in her mid 30s, is married with three children who go to school.  She has been running a business selling clothes for 4 years now. She works from 8.00 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the shop inventory and has paid back her loan successfully.  She wants a loan to buy a good stock of clothes to sell during Christmas time.  Her dream is to one day be able to own a boutique and also sell M-pesa.  

She will share this loan with her loan group "Singinda," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase the stock of clothes.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly, 56, is single and lives alone in Kampong Cham Province. She is a tailor. Ly is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase cloth to sew more clothes to sell to her clients. By doing so, she would be able to earn more profit to support her daily living. In the future, she would like to run a sewing training center from her home and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase cloth in order to sew more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Segundo Jesus

texts.es:
Segundo Jesus tiene 54 años de estado civil Soltero vive con los hermanos en el Cantón Chillanes provincia  de Bolívar.
La ventanilla LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Josè de Guayabal, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz, mora, fréjol.

Segundo Jesus se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, mora. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Chillanes.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz, fréjol, mora. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es incrementar los sombríos de mora para tener mejores ingresos y así un mejor estilo de vida  Le gusta trabajar en el campo  y  que llegue el carnaval.
texts.en:
Segundo Jesus is 54 years old, single, and lives with his siblings in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar.

The community bank Light and Progress is located in Recinto San Josè de Guayabal in the canton of Chillanes, and they work in short-cycle farming of corn, blackberries and beans. 

Segundo Jesus works in agriculture growing corn, beans, and blackberries, and his purchases and sales take place in Chillanes.

He is asking for a loan to buy compost, urea, and liquid fertilizer for the planting of corn, beans, and blackberries. This loan will help him increase his earnings for the use of the family and for investment.

His dream is to grow more of the dark blackberries in order to earn more which will allow him a better style of life. He likes working in the field and when carnival arrives.

loans.use: to buy compost, urea, and liquid fertilizer for the planting of corn, beans, and blackberries

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a resident and a farmer in the area of Nkubu, Central Kenya. She is aged 53 and married with three children. Her oldest two children are adults and the third is still in school. She has been in active farming for 17 years and currently sells her produce of potatoes, cabbage, milk, maize and bananas on the local market.

Agnes has requested a loan of 63,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says this will boost her dairy farming income which will help her in feeding her family and educating the last-born child. She is aiming to concentrate more on dairy farming due to the skills she has acquired in her 17 years in the farming business.

She laments of high costs of farm inputs but appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services saying it was a timely innovation for smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ryakasinga Che School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Polly. He is the Deputy Head Teacher of Ryakasinga CHE School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kabwohe in Sheema with 800 students. Ryakasinga CHE School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Ryakasinga CHE School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Polly ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget is the chairlady of Karura Mwangaza Women Group and a retired primary school teacher. She is married with five children. For many years she has been a chairlady of mothers union and this has increased trust in her from the community around her.Bridget has two dairy cows; they produce between 20-35 litres a day. She sells 30 litres and 5 litres for her home consumption. She supplies milk to a Diary cooperative society and the payments are on time. She is good at book keeping and this assists her in her business as well as helping her group.

loans.use: Bridget wants to construct a permanent structure for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Djamil

texts.en:
Djamil is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. He has had this business for 6 years. He enjoyes looking after calves. He plans o open a shop and o sale of meat. 
Having borrowed a loan of $800 he bought 4 calves and fattened.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to open a shop for sale meat.
Djamil is 38, married, has a child, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporary on front line in Fizuli region.

loans.use: To open a shop for sale meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more metal stocks for his blacksmith business

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en: S. Eldaniz  is 32 years old, and is married with 1 child.  He has been running a small business - a food market - since 2000.  He is a very successful and enterprising businessman.  That is why he has applied for a loan of $1200 from Aqroinvest CU to purchase a cooling system and increase his inventory of products to sell.

loans.use: Going to purchase cooling system and increase inventory

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela P. is 55 years old and is married to Amado Benitez, 58, from the city of Ybycuí. They live together in a house that they worked really hard to acquire. They have one son who is 23 years old and currently studying in the university.

Daniela and Amado are retired. Soon after their retirement in 2005, they started their copetin, a small food shop, in order to finance their son's college education. They are very proud of their son and only wish the best for his future.

Their copetin is located in the Municipal Market. They are very hard workers and work long hours everyday. They dream that their son will have his own room at their house to start his business. With the loan, they plan on buying a refrigerator.

loans.use: Purchase refrigerator.

loans.name: Faavale

texts.en:
Faavale is a 59-year old widow with nine children. Despite her age, she is very keen on making full use of her barbecuing talents. She is a very good cook of all kinds of cuisines, but she chose to pursue a barbeque business.

She spent her first loan of $300 USD to start up this barbecue business. She lives in the town where many night clubs and entertainment joints are located. She carries out her business mostly during the night, so she can satisfy the after-hour cravings of the townspeople. She hopes that her next loan will allow her to build a small house and to buy a new oven for her business. She also hopes to stay in the loan program for a long time.

loans.use: To buy different meats needed for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Yolith

texts.es:
Yolith belongs to the Corazon D. Jesus ("Jesus Heart") community bank. Her business is in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She earns a living selling general merchandise and "chicha D. maiz" (a weak alcoholic drink), which she sells to local people, most of whom are agricultural workers, and to visitors who want to enjoy a local drink.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.500 (500 Peruvian soles or about US$167) to be repaid in 4 installments, Yolith will buy bulk supplies of rice, sugar, egs, cookies, soap, detergent, toilet paper and other products.

Yolith, 63 is married and has 3 children, all of whom are independent. At her age, she's happy that she's able to give the best of herself to her family and her business. She's pleased, too, that she's able to contribute to household expenses and that she can share a tranquil life with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Yolith pertenece al Banco Comunal Corazón D. Jesús, tiene ubicado su negocio en el Barrio San Isidro – Carretera a Shatoja en la Localidad D. San José D. Sisa, provincia D. El Dorado, Departamento D. San Martín. Ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y también D. chicha D. maíz (bebida ligera), la cual es vendida a los pobladores que se dedican principalmente al trabajo agrícola y visitantes que les gusta disfrutar D. esta bebida regional.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 500.00 ($ 167.00), el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más productos como: arroz y azúcar en sacos (01 saco D. cada uno), huevos (02 casilleros), galletas (02 cajas, entre dulces y saladas), jabones (1/2 caja D. cada marca), detergentes D. diferentes marcas, papel higiénico (02 paquetes); y otros productos.

Ella está casada, tiene 63 años y tiene 03 hijos, pero todos ya son independientes. A su edad se siente muy contenta ya que da lo mejor D. ella para su familia y su negocio, se siente satisfecha D. poder aportar en los gastos del hogar y poder compartir junto a su esposo una vida tranquila.

loans.use: Buy general merchandise for resale.

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
This group of women is from the Chaipe District in Paraguay. It has formed from the contact from another group of ladies from the same district. These women have had meetings related to the formation of this group and now they are a total of 15 women workers.

The activities that these ladies are involved with are: running pantries, laundry services, manicure & hair salon services, embroidery design, sale of foods, selling candy, selling jewelry, and running a social pharmacy.

Each member receives an average sum of 500,000 Gs. The purpose of these loans are to purchase goods and inventory required in their respective business, such as fabrics, thread, flour, sweets, sugar, clothing, jewelry, products for hair care, over the counter drugs/pharmaceutical items, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Este comité del Barrio Chaipe ha surgido por contacto de otras señoras de un comité del mismo Barrio, se han realizado las reuniones correspondientes para la conformación, y actualmente el comité esta formado por 15 mujeres trabajadoras.

Las actividades de estas señoras consisten en: despensas, lavandería, manicuras, peluquería, elaboración de bordados, venta de comidas, venta de dulces, venta de ropas, venta de joyas, farmacia social.

Cada integrante recibe en promedio la suma de 500.000 Gs. El destino de estos créditos son para comprar insumos y mercaderías necesarias en sus negocios, tales como: telas, hilos, harinas, panificados, dulces, azúcar, prendas de vestir, joyas, artículos para el cabello, medicamentos, etc.

loans.use: To purchase flour, canned goods, milk, soft drinks, fabric, clothing, jewelry, products for hair, over the counter drugs and health products, and thread.  (Compra de harina, productos enlatados, leche, bebidas, telas,  prendas de vestir, joyas, artículos para el cabello,  medicamentos, hilos, etc.)

loans.name: Agip B 2006(I) Group

texts.en:
Agness is 32 years old and a single mother of seven children. She roasts maize and gonja for a living. Seh wants to use the extra business profits to pay school fees for the children, and also to re-invest in the cureent business. Rukiya has a drug shop and wants to use the loan to purchase more drugs. Yuday has a retail shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more foods.

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en: Mariyam, 38, and her husband A. are both are farmers. Every three months they earn about $128, $42 of which is profit. Mariyam has applied for a loan of $125 to buy fertilizer and equipment. She is a member of MBK and will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and equipment

loans.name: Dolly Valeria

texts.es:
Dolly Valeria T. Marín is an associate of the "Santa Inés" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martin Region, province of Picota, district of Picota, in the area Picota block 8. Her business is located in her own house, where she has installed a wine cellar where she sells general groceries and other daily consumer goods.

She is a teacher of primary education, but she also has a knack for business. Because of this she and her husband invested their savings in a grocery store that did not have the results expected, but they knew that they would overcome this adversity given their perseverance and certainty that they will achieve what they set out to do.

With the credit of 800 soles which will be repaid in a time limit of 4 months, she will buy sugar, rice in bags, preserves in boxes, milk in boxes, soap in boxes, cleaning supplies for the home such as brooms and detergent, personal hygiene supplies, carbonated beverages, water and delicacies that are in great demand among her clients.

Señora Dolly is 32 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She is their main support. She is always smiling and has a jolly spirit that has earned the appreciation and loyalty of the inhabitants of the area. In the future she wants to move her business to a place where she could possibly work as an educator.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Dolly Valeria T. Marín, es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Inés” vive en la Región San Martín provincia de Picota ,distrito de Picota, en el Jr: Picota cuadra 8, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, en la que tiene instalada una Bodega donde vende abarrotes en general y otros productos de consumo diario.

Es profesora de educación inicial, pero además a ella siempre le gusto el negocio, por lo que junto a su esposo invirtieron los ahorros que tenían en abarrotes que no tuvo los resultados esperados pero supo sobreponerse a la adversidad dado su perseverancia y seguridad que tiene en lograr lo que se propone.

Con el crédito recibido de S/.800.00 el cual será pagado en un plazo de 4 meses, comprará: azúcar, arroz en sacos, conservas en cajas, leche en cajas, jabón en cajas y artículos de limpieza para el hogar y aseo personal como escobas, detergentes, bebidas gaseosa y golosinas, que tiene mayor demanda entre sus clientes.

La señora Dolly tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, quien es su principal apoyo, su espíritu jovial y siempre sonriente hace que se haya ganado el aprecio y la fidelidad de los moradores de la zona, en el futuro quiere llevar su negocio a un lugar donde posiblemente trabaje como docente.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, preserves, milk, soap, cleaning supplies, personal hygiene supplies, carbonated beverages, water and delicacies that are in great demand among her clients for sale in her grocery store.

loans.name: Rozi

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Rozi M., who is married and has one child, aged 5. She has one other dependent, her nephew, living with her. Rozi owns a used clothing business and now requires a loan to purchase additional stocks of used clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost and the general appeal of anything western or modern. While there are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of used clothing in bulk.

loans.name: H. Zagou

texts.fr:
H. Zagou B. was born in 1985; he is married and is responsible for two people. A very courageous and determined man, he has owned a shop selling paint for three years. Business is booming because he is the only one in his district and he sells good quality paint. He has a large and steady customer base. Not having enough funds, he is often short of stock, and his customers complain all the time. Faced with this situation, he might lose his customer base.

To bolster his business and to prevent his loyal customers from going elsewhere, he is requesting a loan to enable him to increase his capital and to buy paint in bulk in order to make a profit. This will improve his household's standard of living.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur B. H. Zagou est né en 1985 ; il est marié et a à sa charge deux (2) personnes. Très courageux et déterminé, il tient une boutique de vente de peinture depuis 3 ans. C’est un commerce florissant car il est le seul dans son quartier et vend des peintures et de bonne qualité. La clientèle est abondante et régulière. N’ayant pas assez de moyens, il est souvent en pénurie de stock et ses clients se plaignent tout le temps. Devant cette situation, Monsieur B. risque de perdre sa clientèle.

Pour renforcer son commerce et éviter que ses fidèles clients n’aillent s’approvisionner ailleurs, Il sollicite un crédit qui va lui permettre d’augmenter son capital et d’acheter en gros les peintures pour en tirer plus de profit. Ceci améliorera le niveau de vie dans son ménage.

loans.use: To increase his capital and to buy paint wholesale

loans.name: Herfelinda

texts.es:
Herfelinda used to work in a factory, but it went bankrupt and as a result she was left without work. It was because of this that six years ago she decided to open a clothes stall in the market. She works from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening in this business: later she sells socks in the streets.

However, Herfelina has a daughter who is studying dressmaking, and as a result both have established a workshop and have begun to manufacture kitchen-dryers. The loans which she has received have allowed her to buy the cloth needed to manufacture the dryers.

Herfelina would like to expand her small workshop and begin to manufacture more products. She would also like to acquire a automatic sewing machine.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Herfelinda trabajaba en una fábrica, pero ésta quebró por lo que se quedó sin trabajo. Fue así que hace 6 años decidió poner un puesto de ropa en el mercado. Ella trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde en este negocio, luego vende medias de manera ambulatoria.

Sin embargo, Herfelinda tiene una hija que está estudiando Alta Costura, por lo que ambas han montado un taller y han empezado a fabricar secadores de cocina. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para comprar la tela que necesita en la fabricación de los secadores.

A ella le gustaría ampliar su pequeño taller y empezar a fabricar más productos. También quisiera adquirir una máquina remalladora de ropa.

loans.use: To buy the fabric needed in the manufacture of kitchen-dryers

loans.name: Luís Eduardo

texts.es:
Mr. Luís Eduardo sells natural products for a living. He is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to purchase merchandise (such as candles and natural products) because he does not have the necessary funds for the moment and he does not want his business to lose profits.

He has been in business for over a year. His mother also works in the business, which is located in their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Luís Eduardo tiene un negocio de venta de productos naturales. El está solicitando un préstamo a Kiva para la compra de mercancía (como velas y productos naturales) ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario por el momento y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio.

El tiene dedicándose a este negocio desde hace más de un año. En el negocio trabajan el y su mama y el negocio está ubicado en su propia casa.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Suada

texts.en:
Suada is a 49-year-old woman from the town of Banovići. She is a widow, but she receives pension money from her husband in the amount of 500 KM per month. Moreover, she owns and operates a small shop in town where she sells various goods .

She is seeking this loan through WWI in the amount of 600 KM ($475) to buy additional supplies for her shop in order to expand her inventory for the benefit of her customers. She notes that she needs greater income to support her and her son.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies for her shop.

loans.name: Djidjoho

texts.fr: Âgée de 33 ans, dame N. Djidjoho  est née à Cotonou et est originaire de Porto-Novo. Elle n'a  jamais été à l'école. Toute petite, elle a voulu faire du commerce et très vite elle se mit à vendre du poisson frit ou fumé. Cela a constitué  son activité principale depuis toujours même si par moment elle s'adonne à la vente d'articles divers dont les pâtes alimentaires et les boîtes de conserve. Elle sollicite son sixième prêt pour acheter 75 litres d'huile végétale et 4 cartons de poissons congelés de sorte à accroître son chiffre d'affaire journalier. Mariée à Clément ZINSOU TCHETAN un tailleur, dame N.  Djidjoho a 5 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djidjoho N., 33, was born in Cotonou and is originally from Porto-Novo. She has never been to school. As a young girl, she wanted to become a business person, and she very soon began selling fried or smoked fish. That has always been her main business endeavor, although from time to time she has sold various articles, among others pasta and tinned goods.

She is asking for this, her sixth loan, to buy 75 liters of vegetable oil and 4 cases of frozen fish so as to grow her daily turnover. Married to Clément Zinsou Tchetan, who is a tailor, Mrs. Djidjoho N. has 5 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 4 cases of frozen fish and 75 liters of vegetable oil

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel cumplió 28 años de edad, estudió superior pedagógico, es casada y tiene 02 hijos (01 mujer de 04 años y 01 varón de 01 año de edad). Vive en el Jirón Bolognesi Nº 408 en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno. 

Desde el año 2006 integra el Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras” en Acari. En un inicio, con el crédito de S/.300 compró abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc.). A los 24 años de edad formó su hogar y empezó a vender abarrotes, compraba los productos en la ciudad de Desaguadero y los vendía en la ciudad de Tacna. Actualmente se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ají y orégano, los cuales trae de la ciudad de Tacna (Ite, Sama) y los vende en la ciudad de Desaguadero los días viernes y los días domingos en Yunguyo.

Con este crédito de S/,3,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 04 quintales de ají de primera calidad a S/. 360 cada quintal y 04 quintales de ají de segunda calidad a S/. 280 cada quintal y con el resto comprará orégano, para venderlos al por mayor y menor en la ciudad de Desaguadero.

Su visión es construir su casa en la ciudad de Yunguyo, instalar una tienda de regalos (matrimonios) y apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Maribel is 28 years old, studied pedagogy, is married and has two children (1 girl who is 4 years old and a son who is 1 year of age). She lives in at Jirón Bolognesi Nº 408 in the district and province of Yunguyo, Puno. Since of the year 2006 she has been a member of the Communal Bank "Las Triunfadoras" in Acari. In the beginning, with the loan of S/.300 she bought groceries (sugar, rice, noodles, etc.). At 24 years old she formed her home and started to sell groceries. She bought the products in the city of Desaguadero and sold them in the city of Tacna. She currently works in the business of the of purchase and sale of hot peppers and oregano, which she brings from the city of Tacna (Ite, Sama) and sells in the city of Desaguadero on Fridays and on Sundays in Yunguyo. With this loan of S/3,000, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will buy 400 pounds of first quality hot peppers at S/. 360 for the first 100 pounds and 400 lbs of hot peppers of second quality at S/. 280 for each one hundred lbs. With the remainder she will buy oregano to sell them wholesale and retail in the city of Desaguadero. Her vision is to build her house in the city of Yunguyo, open a wedding gift store and support her children so that they can go to study.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She wil buy large quantities of hot peppers and oregano.

loans.name: Clon Group

texts.es:
El  g/s CLON  esta conformado por 3 integrante mujeres que viven en la zona semi urbana de la ciudad de Masaya todas son madres solteras han pasado por la mala experiencia de no poder contar con el apoyo del papa de sus hijos. Ellas han iniciado su negocio con capital pequeño  solicitaron su primer crédito con adim y se dieron cuneta de los beneficios que se obtienen cuando invierten bien en su negocio y pagan a tiempo su crédito.
Doña  Alba es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella nos manifiesta que su g/s tiene éxito por la buena comunicación y solidaridad de sus integrantes  piensan seguir trabajando y ampliando cada vez más  productos. Son beneficiadas de Es beneficiaria de un tercer ciclo de crédito y se siente orgullosa de no haber quedado mal con ADIM que le ha venido financiando desde hace varios años. 
El g/s ha recibido capacitaciones  en economía y administración del negocio. Su mayor aprendizaje ha sido que para progresar es necesario ahorrar, pues así se queda bien, se pude tener un nuevo crédito y progresar. 
Uno de sus mayores deseos de los miembros del g/s es   poder ampliar y mejorar su casa, para tal propósito ellas de las ganancias del préstamo está ahorrando para que a final de año poder invertir en su casa
texts.en:
The group CLON is made up of 3 women members that live in the outskirts of the city of Masaya. They are all single mother that has been through the terrible experience of not being able to count on the support of the father of their children. They have started a business with a small capital they obtained from their first loan with Adim and they noted the benefits of investment into their business, always making sure to repay their loan on time.

Alba is the coordinator of the gruop. She says that their group is successful due to their good communication habits and the loyatly of the members. They are plan on continuing their work and expanding their selection of products each time. She has benefitted from 3 past loans and she feels prouble that she has remained on good terms with Adim, the organization that has been financing her efforts for many years.

The group has received support financially and in the administration of their business. Their greatest experience has been learning how to save money, and therefore remain on good terms and then be eligible for future loans.

One of their greatest dreams is to make improvements and expansions to their houses. To this end they are saving their earnings made possible through the loan to be able to invest into their homes at year's end.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital: to increase the selection of their products.

loans.name: Keng

texts.en: Keng C. is a widow who lives with her  child, elder mother, and niece in the Kampong Cham Province ofCambodia. She is a tailor who also raises pigs on a plot of land behind her house to earn a living paying her $6 a day. She would like to take out a loan for $900 to purchase more pigs and feed to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es: Marivel tiene 39 años, vive con sus hijos Melani de 14 y Andi de 4 años de edad. La venta de ropa es la actividad a la que se dedica Maribel desde hace ya 8 años para poder mantener a sus pequeños hijos. Marivel comienza su jornada diaria a las 8 de la mañana para terminar a las 5 o 6 de la tarde, felizmente la venta es buena, ya que es muy carismática arrojándole buenos ingresos económicos para su bienestar y el de su familia. Pero el trabajar sola es más difícil, ya que extraña mucho a sus hijos durante esas horas del día. Marivel sabe que debe trabajar mucho para darles a sus pequeños una buena educación, es por eso que recurre a nosotros para que la ayudemos a cumplir todas sus metas trazadas. Marivel se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprara más mercadería para vender en estas temporadas de fiestas, donde hay gran demanda.
texts.en:
Marivel is 39 years old. She lives with her children, Melani, 14 and Andi, 4 years of age. For the past 8 years she has been selling clothes for a living in order to maintain her young children. Marivel begins work daily at 8 a.m. and finishes at 5-6 p.m. Fortunately sales are good as she is very charismatic and therefore she receives good economic income to create welfare for herself and her family. But to work alone is difficult as she misses her children during the day. Marivel is aware that she must work hard to provide her children with a good education and therefore she is requesting our support to reach her goals. Presently Marivel has a loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is very punctual with the payments. With the loan requested she will buy more merchandise to sell during the holiday season when demands are high. .

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Bismark Antonio

texts.es:
El caballero Bismark M. es originario de la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua y se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de carne de pollo en el mercado con el propósito de mantener su núcleo familiar proporcionando las condiciones necesarias de vida a su cónyuge y sus dos pequeños hijos. 

Hoy en día la razón por la que el señor Bismark ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita adquirir la carne de pollo para su respectiva comercialización. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y beneficia de igual forma a su amada familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
The gentleman Bismark M. is from the city of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, and he works attending to his business selling chicken in the market with the purpose of supporting his family by providing the necessary living conditions for his wife and two small children. Today the reason why Bismark has applied to Ceprodel is to benefit from a loan that will allow him to acquire the chicken for its respective sale. With this loan he will benefit greatly as will his beloved family that so greatly requires your help.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mrs. Ry M. is a villager in Tonle village in Takeo province who breeds ducks for a living. Her husband, Mr. Seas Soeun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Although they work hard, they still don't earn enough to support their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Ry M. is applying for a loan to buy a motor-vehicle for her husband to use as a motorbike taxi. She is a 28-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a motor for her husband use as a motorbike taxi.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel K. is forty-six years old. He is married and has three children who are currently in the basic school. Emmanuel lives with his family in a community called Nkwaateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. An appreciable number of women are involved in palm oil production.  Emmanuel identified this as a business opportunity and bought three sets of milling and processing machines to start commercial palm nut processing in his community. 

He has one set of machines that pound the cooked palm nuts, and another one that extracts the oil from the palm nut fiber. His services have greatly reduced the drudgery that was previously associated with palm oil extraction and processing.

Since palm oil production is increasing in his community, he seeks a loan to enable him to buy additional milling and processing machines as well as accessories, in order to provide satisfactory and on-time services to his clients. He believes the loan will enable him to increase production and thus to serve a larger market. Eventually, the income will help improve his family's finances. 

Emmanuel is a member of a Trust Bank group called Temple Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another, as social collateral, so as to access loans, and they support one another in handling the repayment of a loan.

loans.use: To procure milling machines and accessories.

loans.name: Vasile

texts.en:
Vasile is 35 years old and he is the father of three children. His wife works as a teacher in kindergarten in the city. Both spouses love children very much. So, Vasile has decided to open a small shop where he will sell many things needed for children as small toys, nipples, clothing and more things babies require.

Vasile came to Microinvest to borrow the amount of money needed to start up a business, namely to rent the shop from the beginning, in order to pay monthly rent and then to increase the stock of goods. In this district the birth rate exceeds mortality, so business will be profitable.

Vasile is quite satisfied with what he does for himself in the first round and of course for young children.

loans.use: starting up a business

loans.name: Together We Tinap Group

texts.en:
Here we see Abdul K., Adamsay S., Isatu F., Aminata K., Augusta S. and Susan S.. They are members of a loan group called Together We Tinap. They have applied for their third loan from SMT/Kiva. Their previous loans have had a huge impact on the lives of these entrepreneurs. Having repaid those loans successfully and on time, they are requesting a new loan to increase the size and quality of their businesses, make greater profits and improve their standards of living. 

Abdul (second from left) is the leader of this group. He is 35 years of age and was born in Makeni City, northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have three children, all of whom are still in school. Abdul makes a living selling plastic slippers in Makeni. With this loan, he will be able to increase his stock of items to sell. This will bring many positive changes by providing his family with food, clothes to wear, the ability to go to school and so on.

loans.use: To expand several small businesses.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is engaged in soft drink retailing, but she also sells other commodities aside from soft drinks. She is also managing a school canteen but only on school days. Since it is vacation now, her focus is her retail business. She would like to request a loan of PHP 12,000 as additional business capital. She also plans to purchase some commodities for her canteen in preparation for the school year.

Lydia's income is just enough to meet the needs of their family and she hopes that she can have the opportunity to make her business grow and hopefully expand it someday. Lydia believes that “if there’s a will, there’s a way”. She knows that they will be able to survive life’s difficulties because she never gives up looking for resources for her family. Lydia is 46 years old. She is married to Alfredo and they are living in the rural and mountainous village of San Rafael (Cabisera 17-21) of Ilagan, Isabela. They were blessed with four children; three of them are still studying. They are: Jeffrey, 25 years, criminology student; Janice, 23 years old, a college graduate but still unemployed; Jo-em, 12 years old, and Jinky, 10 years old; the younger two are still in grade school.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Mwasafari

texts.en:
Mwasafari has been a cosmetics and bread seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for five years. She belongs to the Hakuna group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Every day, she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more cosmetics items to add to her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mwasafari is 31 years old and married, and she has five children, ages 3, 4, 10, 12, and 15.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics items to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
L. Lê Thị is a 56-year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương.  She is married and has five adult children.  To making a living, L. owns and operates an agricultural business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  L. has been engaged in this business for more than a year and earns approximately 1,200,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  L. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND (US$525), which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  The loan will be the fourth loan she has taken out from TYM Fund.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Magdalena's Group

texts.en:
Magdalena G., age 59, is the mother of 8 children and the wife of a carpenter. Magda used to work in a garment factory as an inspector, but when the company closed, she began a direct-selling business.  

Through the commission, she received from a big realty deal, and she managed to start what is now a thriving business.  As a manager/distributor of personal collections, she earn an average of P20,000 per month, in addition to the income from other products that she sells.

She will use her new loan to buy more products to sell. Magda is now enrolled in CCT Entrep-Eskwela and is very thankful because she is learning how to manage her business properly.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma J. owns a small rice farm in Sto. Nino, South Cotabato, Mindanao. She started her farm business in 1976. Now, she still supports her husband, Benito J., by tilling their rice field for an abundant harvest.

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. The loan will bring forth better income for her family to enjoy. She will use the loan to purchase farm supplies, fertilizers, and chemicals. Because she has three children, the income of her business was put to good use especially in paying for school and books.

Now that she is connected with the CEVI credit program, she has the loans, training, and insurance that come with joining CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Pedro Joaquín

texts.es: Pedro Joaquín A. vive ene departamento de Ahuachapán.  A sus 53 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijas, las cuales estudian bachillerato. Pedro maneja una tapicería de muebles desde su propia casa, donde  fabrican todo tipo de muebles para casa u oficina. La Tapicería “San Jose” tiene 23 años de existir y se convertido en un sueño hecho realidad para Pedro y su familia, pues ha sido la base para la superación de la misma. Pedro solicita un préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio y comprar nueva materia prima, para continuar elaborando muebles de alta calidad y duración.
texts.en:
Pedro Joaquin A. lives in the district of Ahuachapán. He is 53 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters, who are both high school graduates. Pedro operates a furniture upholstery shop out of his house, where he covers all types of home and office furniture. His shop, called "San Jose", has been in business for 23 years and has been a dream come true for Pedro and his family.

He is requesting a loan to invest into his business and purchase new materials so that he can continue offering high-quality, durable furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase upholstery material

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 25 years old and single. He owns a grocery store in Hebron city , Palestine. He would like to increase trade by purchasing canned goods, soft drinks and other products for his shop. Doing so means he would be able to contribute to improving the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: Increase trade by purchasing canned goods, soft driks and other products for his shop.

loans.name: Garanti Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Garanti sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne  42 ans et 3 enfants .Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Balan, sous-préfecture de Fana Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage, de mariages et excellent dans l’achat vente du charbon de bois, du bois de chauffe et d’articles divers de consommation courante.  
Ces femmes ont intégrés  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent acheter, du charbon de bois au niveau du village (en vrac qui sera mis dans des sacs) pour être revendus à Fana et au retour elles s’approvisionnent en articles divers sur le marché de Fana pour les  revendre au comptant, sur place à Fana même et dans le village de Balan à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent avoir 20.000 FCFA de bénéfice mensuel par personne. Une partie du bénéfice est réinvestie dans l’activité et l’autre est utilisée pour les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the group Garanti are married women who average 42 years of age and 3 children.  With their husband and children, they live in traditional families in the village of Balan, sub-prefecture of Fana, region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali. They know one another through ties of community and marriage. And they excel in buying and selling charcoal, firewood, and a variety of commonly consumed goods.  The women joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of sustaining their lucrative work.  They are now on their 11th group loan.  All the preceding loans have been properly repaid.  In the village, the women intend to buy some charcoal (unbundled, which will be put into sacks) to be resold in Fana.  Once back, they stock up on a variety of goods at the Fana marketplace and then resell them, cash or credit accepted, locally in Fana and even in Balan, to customers composed of women and men.  The group members hope to obtain a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA per person.  A portion of the profits are reinvested in the business, and the other portion is used to meet family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Todas las mujeres destinan sus créditos para el sustento de sus actividades comerciales que les permite obtener pequeños margenes de ganancias para soportar sus gastos diarios en alimento, educación de sus hijos, gastos  de salud, y para reinvertir en sus negocios.
Como veremos en la descripción de sus negocios solo dos señoras se dedican a actividades  diferentes a las demás que son chiperas, este negocio requiere de mucho esfuerzo más aún para las mujeres , ya que el proceso de producción inicia generalmente a las 03:30 entre las 04:00 horas de la madrugada, preparando el horno a leña, más conocido como tatacua en la que posteriormente se introduce la masa de la chipa moldeada. Esto implica soportar un alto grado de calor manipulando el proceso de cocción  del producto mencionado  durante varias horas.
Una vez terminada el producto queda la ardua tarea de venderlas en su totalidad para que de esta única forma sea compensada el tan forzoso trabajo de las chiperas.
Todas estas  mujeres forman parte de un programa de desarrollo social y económico denominado Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras impulsado por la Fundación Paraguaya, ofreciendo a las involucradas una gama de capacitaciones por ciclo de vida del comité, y un apoyo financiero para que las mismas cuenten con un capital operativo que netamente invierten en sus respectivos negocios.
Por este hecho el Comité Santa Lucia, agradece  a la Fundación Paraguaya  y Kiva por la confianza puesta en sus personas para que de este modo las mismas puedan ir mejorando sus vidas paso a paso.

loans.use: insumos para la producción de chipa (maiz, harina, huevo, etc)

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 31-year-old married man and has two children who are still in school. He has been working as a flooring man since 2006 and has six years of experience in this field.

Today, Ali is requesting $1,000 to buy additionA. supplies and tools in order to develop his business.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies and tools

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
la sra. Veronica L. E. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en la colonia sagastume de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, su negocio es la confeccion de trajes para dama, vestidos para boda y vestidos para 15 años.
Veronica tiene una hija y en estos momentos ella le paga los estudios ya que su esposo no esta trabajando, nos comento que le ha costado mucho conseguir empleo ya que la situacion que vive nuestro pais es un poco dificil y Veronica esta viendo la forma de tener mejores ganancias. esta es su unica fuente de ingresos. Veronica necesita el credito para la compra de materia prima para la fabricacion de sus vestidos, nos comento que para esta epoca navideña dice que fabrica varios vestidos y tiene que tener listos los materiales para dicho compromiso.
texts.en:
Sra. Veronica L. E. is 37 years old and lives in the subdivision of Sagastume in the city of Tegucigalpa. Her business involves making women’s clothing, wedding dresses, and evening gowns and she has been doing this for 15 years.

Veronica has a daughter whose education she is funding because her husband is not working. She says he is not able to find a job because the economic situation in the country is difficult, so she is looking for ways to generate better earnings. At the moment, Veronica’s business is her only source of income.

She is requesting a loan to purchase materials for making dresses. Veronica says that she makes different types of clothes for the Christmas season, so she wants to have materials on hand so that she can fill orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, buttons, lace, sponges, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy, by boxes, candies, soaps, toilet paper, detergents, mosquito repellents, etc

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married. She runs her small clothing sales venture in her home town of Melitopol. Yelena owns a vending kiosk in the local central market which is always busy with customers. She has been in business for ten years. Presently, Yelena has $1,250 in gross income. Her monthly net profit amounts to $625.  

Yelena has managed to develop a stable, profitable business based on products that are always in demand. Her business has become the main source of income for her and her family. Yelena’s business is growing. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH to increase her working capital and help boost the further development of her business.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita S. is a 56-year-old mother with five grown-up children. She works hard to achieve her simple dreams: to improve the living conditions of her family and to send her youngest child to college to have a good job. Nenita lives in the village of Sitio Nasug-ong, Brgy Caradio-an, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. Her husband, Oscar, helps her in the business but only for a limited amount of time because he also has a job.

Because Nenita wanted to help her husband improve their living conditions, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in the year 2000 and started her own business. She put up a general store adjacent to her house where it helps her to meet their household needs. As the loans continued, she also invested in a networking business with Avon, Natasha and MSE products. With this additional income, she earns 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month, most of which is saved for college education and household needs.

Nenita's previous loan of 16,000 PHP was used as additional capital for her general store business. This loan was repaid to NWTF-PD in full and on time. Presently, with a loan of 16,000 PHP, she purchased additional inventory for her general store and networking business.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for a general store

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mrs. Mon V. is a villager in Royak village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since her pig breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets, pig food, and a cow for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Ek Puy, is a farmer who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice. Mrs. Mon V. is 50 years-old and the mother of four children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the fourth attends a local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, pig food, and a cow.

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.es:
El Sr. Gerónimo es casado con la señora Toribia tienen tres hijos ellos son oriundos de Sucre la capital de Bolivia tambien denominada la ciudad de los cuatro nombre porque tiene cuatro nombres, actualmente viven en la comunidad Paso del Chivo Municipio de El Torno Santa Cruz, aproximadamente 4 años que están trabajando en la agricultura en su propio terreno, ellos siembran maíz para luego comercializar sus productos en el mercado de su zona.

Los señores están agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Gerónimo is married to Sra. Toribia. They have three children and are originally from Sucre, the capital of Bolivia. Sucre was also called “the City of Four Names” because it had four names. They currently live in the community of Paso del Chivo, which is part of the city of El Tomo Santa Cruz. Gerónimo has been working in agriculture for approximately four years and has his own land. He grows corn that he will sell at the local market.

Gerónimo is grateful to Emprender for providing its support.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for his farm

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Felipe is 56 years old from Banga, South Cotabato. He manages a 1 hectare rice field. The harvest is the main source of his income which is very helpful to sustain his family. He has joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and asks for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos. It will be very helpful for him to buy farm necessities and to be able to finance his business with a lower interest rate from CEVI.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Antwaan

texts.en: Antwaan is a 49 year old single man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. Antwaan has owned and operated a grocery store from where he sells canned food, candies, home cleaning products, rice and pasta, coffee and other items. He also sells fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, lettuce, cucumber, and oranges, bananas, etc. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his first loan request from Al Majmoua. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he did not face many difficulties. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa is a 43-year-old single woman living with her parents. She has been working in clothing sales for the past 10 years. In 2008, she opened her own clothing shop to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is thankful for her business income; it allows her to take care of her old parents. 

Today, Najwa is asking to borrow $1,000 to expand her inventory for the summer season and before the coning holidays to increase her sales and make good revenue.

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es una señora trabajadora y emprendedora la cual se dedica a la comercialización de artesanías nicaragüenses y cosméticos en Costa Rica. Ella inicio con este negocio porque un día que recibió la visita de su hermana quien le llevaba cajetas, pinolillo y otros productos típicos a su centro de  trabajo (un Auto lavado) a trajo mucho la atención de sus clientes los cuales estaban muy interesados por dichos productos.

Es en se momento según comento Marisol que se le ocurre empezar a comercializar esos productos en ese país en un comienzo era poco pero este ha ido creciendo y aumentado poco a poco.

Actualmente ella esta en Nicaragua junto a sus dos pequeñas una de 18 años que esta embarazada y otra de 10 añitos construyendo su casa que es su mayor anhelo y deseo para lo cual ocupara el crédito en la compra de materiales y mano de obra.
texts.en:
Marisol is a hardworking and enterprising woman who sells Nicaraguan handicrafts and cosmetics in Costa Rica. She started this business when her sister visited her one day and brought “cajetas” (caramel treats), “pinolillo” (a Nicaraguan drink mix), and other traditional products to her workplace (at a car wash). These products drew a lot of attention from her customers, who were very interested. At the time, Marisol says it occurred to her that she should start selling these products in Costa Rica. She started out small, but over time her business has grown and increased gradually. At the moment, she is in Nicaragua with her two children. One is 18 years old and pregnant, while the other is 10 years old. Marisol’s greatest wish is to build a house, so she will use this loan to buy materials and pay for labor.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials & pay for labor to build her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
Alberta tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Lagartera del distrito de Mórrope, una zona caracterizada por tener a la mayoría de su población situada en zonas rurales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace veinte años a la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría diversos animales para venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona, este negocio le ha permitido ayudar a la economía de su hogar y hace poco, con los ahorros frutos de esta actividad pudo instalar una pequeña bodega en su vivienda. Este negocio tambien goza de buena acogida debido a que el lugar en donde viven se encuentra alejado del pueblo y no suelen contar con productos de uso diario al alcance de la mano.

Alberta desea ampliar su bodega comprando más productos, de modo que pueda percibir mas ingresos y satisfacer la demanda de la zona, adicionalmente desea adquirir alimento para sus animales, siguiendo con este objetivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Alberta es una mujer entregada a su familia y que siempre vela por su desarrollo y bienestar. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Alberta is 43 years old, married with 5 children, and lives with her family in the Lagartera neighborhood in the Morrope district, a region which is characterized by having most of its population in rural areas, that belongs to the Lambayeque province located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has been raising and selling animals for the past 20 years; she raises a variety of animals to sell to the people that visit this area. This business has allowed her to help the finances of her home. Recently, with the savings she managed to put together with this activity, she installed a small store in her house. This business has been accepted gratefully by the locals because she lives far away from town and they don't usually have access to basic day-to-day products nearby. Alberta wishes to increase the size of the store by buying more products, so she can get more profits and satisfy the demand in the zone. She also wants to acquire feed for the animals. This is why she needs to request a 1500 nuevos soles loan to Edpyme Alternativa. Alberta is a woman who is devoted to her family and that is always working for their development and well-being. She has worked with our institution before and has shown punctuality and responsibility in her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Material to increase the size of a store and feed for animals on sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish and pig feet to sell

loans.name: Jessica Maria

texts.es:
La señora Jessica es madre de 4 hijos está formando parte del banco comunal Alfa desde hace 6 ciclos, este banco se reúnen en la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita.

Casada tiene 1 hijo, 27 años, el esposo es pintor trabaja pintando escuelas, edificios y mas 12 horas diarias, nuestra socia es ejecutiva del hogar pero también tiene su negocio fuera de casa,  vende ropa de una manera informal, compra ropa al por mayor  para damas caballeros y niños; como medias, blusas Y  pantalones; en los actuales momentos está embarazada de 8 meses está a la espera de su segundo bebe pero eso no ha sido impedimento para que ella realiza sus actividades con total normalidad, desde hace 3 años visita  puerta a puerta con su negocio a sus clientas en diferentes localidades de la ciudad;  para poder surtir su negocio tiene que viajar hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil, le acompaña el esposo; con este nuevo crédito nuestra socia podrá invertir en mas mercadería como lo ha venido realizando, utilizara todo el crédito.

La señora Jessica está muy motivada con el trabajo que sostiene y le está muy agradecida a la Fundación porque ha sido un gran aporte en su diario vivir;  su mayor sueño es poder tener su casa, por ahora vive en un  departamento que la mamá de ella le ha dado para que vivan, ya son 9 años que lleva casada y poco a poco han ido adquiriendo sus cosas; su esposo con su trabajo y mas el de ella están ahorrando para hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en:
Jessica, 27, is married and the mother of one child and has been a member of the Alfa communal bank for the last 6 cycles; the bank meets in Portoviejo, Manabí province capital. Her husband works painting schools and buildings, etc. for 12 hours a day. She is a housewife but also has a business outside the home: she is an informal clothing merchant. She buys women’s, men’s and children’s clothes, like hosiery, blouses and pants, at wholesale. She is currently 8 months pregnant, expecting her second child but this hasn’t been an obstacle for her and she continues with her work completely normally. For the last three years she has gone door-to-door seeing her customers in various locations throughout the city. In order to stock her business she must travel to the city of Guayaquil; her husband accompanies her. She will use this new loan to buy more merchandise like she’s been doing to date; she will spend the entire loan amount this way. Jessica is very motivated with the work she does and is very grateful to the Fundación because it’s been of immense help for her daily survival. Her greatest wish is to have her own home because she currently lives in an apartment that her mother has provided for them to live in. She has been married for nine years now and has gradually acquired things. With her husband’s work added to hers they are saving up to make their dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For pants, blouses, hosiery, shirts, t-shirts.

loans.name: Luy

texts.en:
Luy L. is 50 years old and the widowed mother of three children who are single. One of them earns about $90 a month as a garment factory laborer.

Luy L. has used a stall next to her house for raising some animals for income since her kids were very young. She and her daughter have another skill in sewing clothes and they want to use this knowledge to earn additional income. However, they have no capital to make that possible. Because of that, Luy L. borrowed a loan of $200 to buy a sewing machine that she will use to provide a sewing service for a profit.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey M. is from the village of  Mainit, Iligan City. He is 21 years old and married. Rey owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. Rey has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Rey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rey is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Rey from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase items such as clams and fish

loans.name: Bless United Women Group

texts.en:
Esther S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Bless United Women. She is 43 years old and is married with three children who range in age from 12 to 23 years. She also cares for one sibling. Esther was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to lack of financial support.

For 14 years, Esther has been selling dried fish in Gardnerville Market on Somalia Drive, Monrovia, Liberia.

Esther plans to use her 7,500 Liberian dollar portion of this 34,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dried fish to sell. She describes herself as a serviceable woman.

Esther’s dream is to improve her business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Jenneh is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Pilar Del Socorro

texts.es:
PILAR DEL SOCORRO J. L. Trabajo como Administradora en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua, ES MADRE DE FAMILIA DE DOS HIJOS Y ESTOS SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
 el préstamo  en el sistema eléctrico de su casa de habitación y repellar algunas paredes de su casa de Habitación.
VA ACOMPRAR ARENA, CEMENTO Y CABLES ELECTRICOS.
texts.en:
Pilar Del Socorro J. L. works as an administrator in The Autonomous University of Nicaragua. She is also a mother with two school-aged children.

The loan will be used for the electronic system in her home and to plaster some walls. She plans on buying sand, cement, and electric cables.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her home by changing the electric system and plastering some walls.

loans.name: Tereza De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Teresa de Jesús Martínez E. de 68 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y prendas, así como accesorios personales para lucir en nuestra vida diaria. Ella desde muy joven se dedicaba a ésta actividad, pues la madrastra de su esposo le dejaba a ella la mercadería que traía de Panamá para que la ofreciera al crédito (2 pagos solamente) y así cobrará los créditos otorgados.

Ella utilizará el crédito para la compra de mercadería nueva e invertir más en prendas de oro y plata. Su meta es aumentar su capital de trabajo y tener siempre las fortalezas para trabajar y seguir adelante
texts.en:
Teresa is 68 years old and makes a living selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics, jewelry and other personal accessories to enhance our appearances in our daily lives. Since a very young age she has made a living in this activity, and her husband's stepmother left her merchandise that she brought from Panama so that she could be offered a loan and cover the expenses. Teresa plans to use the loan to purchase new merchandise and invest in more gold and silver jewelry. Her goal is to increase her working capital and to always have the fortitude to work and keep making headway.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Reynaldo Vive en la localidad de la Guardia distante a 20 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, en el barrio 23 de diciembre, su actividad principal es el trabajo en la construcciones civiles como albañil, su esposa  con la cual tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de pan de trigo, con lo cual le ayuda a su esposo en sostener a su familia, el destino del credito es para comprar insumos como harina de trigo, manteca, levadura, etc y así crecer en el negocio de su esposa quien elabora y comercializa el pan que realiza, es nacido en el departamento de Beni capital ganadera de Bolivia, hace 15 año que radica en el departamento de santa cruz, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Reynaldo lives in the town of La Guardia, which is 20km from the city of Santa Cruz, and resides in the December 23rd neighborhood. His main business activity is working as a mason on civil construction projects. He and his wife have four school age children. She makes a living by selling wheat bread, which helps to support their family.

This loan will be used to buy supplies such as wheat flour, butter, yeast, and other ingredients to grow his wife’s business of making and selling bread. Sr. Reynaldo was born in the Department of Beni, the livestock capital of Bolivia. Fifteen years ago, he settled in the Department of Santa Cruz. He is grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for his wife's business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita L. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya in the Philippines. She is 41 years old and married, with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Margarita plants and harvests rice for sale. Margarita has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 35000 PHP per harvest.

In 2007, Margarita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Margarita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Margarita from ASKI.
