She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For services that will increase crop yield

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last twenty years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables which he sells locally. He also earns income from his employment as a nursing officer.

Alex is 54 years old. He is married with 6 school-aged children.

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 62,400 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that his income will increase with the additional sale of milk and this will enable him pay school fees for his children with ease. His biggest challenges have been diseases and fluctuation in the market prices of milk and sometimes unreliable labor. In future, he would like to set up a zero grazing unit and also own a high quality breed of dairy cows.

He comments that Juhudi is definitely out to empower him and others economically and things will never be the same for all the members of his group.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella tiene dos tiendas que atiende desde las 8:30 hasta las 11:00 p.m, ella vende chompas, casacas, chalinas y mantas, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio de venta de artesanías. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Roxana is a member of the Communal Bank “Huayna Picchu”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 45 years old, married, and has one child. Roxana divides her time between her daily activities and managing her business selling crafts. She has two stores that she manages between the hours of 8:30am and 11pm. Roxana sells sweaters, jackets, scarves, and blankets. She wants to expand her craft business, so she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her stores.

Roxana is grateful to those responsible for making her dream come true, so she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in her craft stores

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: A. Dorothy, a hardworking 40-year-old, has been operating a retail shop in Kyakatara- Kyenjojo for the last 12 years. It is a business which has been beneficial to her and her family in many ways, principally through improved welfare and better education for her 3 children. Dorothy began the business with funds from her first business - tea selling. The business generates 500,000 UGX monthly for her. Dorothy is married and she plans to use this loan to buy more retail merchandise for resale at her shop.

loans.use: to purchase more retail merchandise for resale

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “HUCHUY QOSQO ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Lamay perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luisa; La socia tiene 26 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene  3 hijos la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz, ella también se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores y a la elaboración y venta de chicha de maíz amarillo (esta es la elaborada bebida a base de maíz amarillo pasando por un proceso de maceración). La socia desea comprar maíz para la elaboración de chicha y así poder vender en su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor y poder elaborar la chicha.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the “HUCHUY QOSQO” community bank which is located in Lamay district, in Calca province, in Cusco department.

Luisa is 26 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 3 children.  Her business is buying and selling corn.  She also buys and sells young animals and makes and sells yellow corn 'chicha' (a drink made by putting yellow corn through a soaking process).  She would like to buy corn for making her 'chicha' which she can sell from her home.  She is requesting the loan to buy corn wholesale so that she can make 'chicha'.

She is grateful for the loan and appreciates it.  She pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy corn wholesale so that she can make 'chicha' (a corn-based drink)

loans.name: Puchh's Group

texts.en:
Nine members form this village loan. They are located in Ruessei Chrouy village in Kandal province. Mr. Puchh S., 44 years old, is the village bank president having been selected by the members of this village. Each member will use their money for different purposes. 

Mr. Puchh S. makes his living breeding poultry, earning a small income to support his family. With this business, he still does not earn enough income to make improvements for his family. In order to increase his income to improve the family's living conditions, Mr. Puchh S. would like to ask for a loan to buy more chickens and ducklings for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Chan Kunthea, 30 years old, works as a seamstress in a garment factory. They have a child who is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and ducklings for breeding

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a forty two year old married man with five children living in an owned house in Fort Portal Uganda hoping to secure a stable income in the future. He charges batteries for a living and has been in this business for three years which has enabled him to secure school fees for his children, he started as a laborer and later set up his own business. Patrick intends to use the credit to buy a battery charging machine.

loans.use: To buy a battery charging machine

loans.name: Gema Mylu

texts.es:
Gema es una joven de 26 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijo, hoy en día trabaja como recepcionista, y venta de cosméticos en donde lleva cuatro años en este negocio, aprovechando su medio de trabajo para sus  ventas en donde vende por catálogos productos Avon,  a si como productos variados para ofertar, ya que son accesibles, y de buena calidad.
Iniciando con pocos productos, y aumentando su inventario atreves de Afodenic.
Con este nuevo préstamo será invertido en productos de cosmético para aumentar los niveles de venta, y lograr a poyar a su familia, ya que todo está ah altos costos y tiene que cubrir alimentación, medicina, vestimenta el cual se esfuerza y esmera por amor a su familia.
texts.en:
Gema is a young woman of 26.  She is married and has three children.  She currently works as a receptionist and sells cosmetics.  She has been in this business for four years, taking advantage of her work to make sales with her catalogs.  She sells Avon products and other products which are affordable and good quality.  She started out with only a few products and has increased her inventory with Afodenic's help. 

Gema will invest this new loan in buying cosmetics to increase her sales levels and support her family as everything costs a lot and she has to cover food, medicine and clothing costs.  She works hard and takes great care in doing all this because of her love for her family.

loans.use: To invest in buying ladies' and men's cosmetics so that she can improve her sales and profits

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun C. is 35 years old.  She lives with her old mother and her niece in the Battambang province. She sells grocery products and grows corn to help support her family. She typically makes $22 a day. For the last three years, her farming of corn has not done well because of the weather changes. Fortunately, her grocery business has been successful. Currently, she has a large number of grocery items to sell to her local customers. Hun C. is asking for a loan of $500 to expand her current grocery store and to buy fertilizer to grow corn.

loans.use: To expand grocery store and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more body lotion and ladies' underclothes

loans.name: Callixte

texts.fr:
Callixte K., est un homme de 54 ans, né à Bujumbura au Burundi, il est veuf, il 6 enfants entre 24 et 10 ans.
deux de ses enfants vont à l'école,son niveau d'étude est secondaire. il est chauffeur d'une camiotte, cette camionette est non propriete.il veut acheter les pieces de rechange pour son vehicule. sa vision et son ambition c'est d'elever ses enfants en leur payant le minerval, jusqu'à un niveau d'etude elevé.
texts.en:
Callixte K. is a 54 years old man, born in Bujumbura, Burundi. He is widowed, has six children between 24 and 10 years of age.
Two of his children are attending school and he has a secondary level education. He is a van driver and the vehicle is not of his property. He wants to buy spare parts for this vehicle. His vision and ambition is to raise his children and be able to pay their school fees to allow them to achieve a high level of education.

loans.use: Purchase of vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is widow with six children. To make a living, Edith owns and operates a medical clinic and also raises poultry for sale. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years. 

Edith joined Kiva partner, Yehu microfinance, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edith is requesting a new loan of 40,000 which will be used to purchase medication and manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.use: To  purchase medication for her medical clinic.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is the resident of Khanewal, which is a small city of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. Her house is located in Jaswant Nagar where she has been living with her family in a 3 room brick house for past 5 years. 

She has a sewing machine with which she sews dresses and sells to her neighborhood clients. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. She also does embroidery and earns good profits through this skill as well. 

Her husband’s name is M. M. and he has a laundry business. He has contacts with different homes of the areas and offers them clothes washing services for reasonable rates. Sakina has 2 daughters. Both of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy thread, cloth and beads to offer better and timely services to her customers to earn more profits. 

She has been in this business for some time now and hopes that the loan investment will help her further improve her business.

She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sakina

loans.use: to buy thread, cloth and beads for her embroidery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase good quality seed and tools he needs for his land.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is 34 years old, married, and has a five-year-old child.  For three years, she has been selling clothes.  She started the business after clearing school.  With the trainings offered by Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to keep business records.  Therefore, she has been able to run her business well.  She hopes to open a boutique in the future.  She has requested 40,000 Kes to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian runs a business venture in the retail sector specializing in rice retail for the local communities. She is 48 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Talairon, Oroquieta City. Vivian has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Vivian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more sacks of rice for her rice retail business. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice for her rice retail business.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 23 years old, a craftsman from village Kisiskhevi, East Georgia. Gela is married and lives with his wife Anano and parents in the village.

He is a craftsman and makes various items from gypsum plaster. Besides his main handicraft, Gela is also busy with the agricultural business of the family. In particular, the family has a milk cow, three pigs, and two sheep. The family sells milk, piglets and lambs. The total income of the family is approximately 1200 Laris per month. 

With the requested credit Gela will purchase calves to raise. After a year they will be milked and the family will be able to sell more milk. That will positively impact the family’s income. In the future Gela plans to further expand their dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase calves for their dairy farm.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino is 59 years old and married with five adult-aged children. He earns about 50,000 PHP per crop as a farmer working in the Philippines. He has been growing corn for the past 39 years.

Avelino is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and corn seed for his four hectare field. He will also use the loan to pay for the preparation of his fields.

Avelino dreams that someday his farm will be profitable enough to lift his family’s living situation and to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and corn seed and to pay for preparation of his fields.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny de 55 años es una mujer emprendedora que tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 22 a 35 años,  y vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla,  donde tiene un negocio iniciado en el año 1982, cuando no tenía ninguna fuente de ingresos y decidió emprender su aventura empresarial con un pequeño capital, arrendando un local donde instaló un kiosco que aún existe y en el que en la actualidad vende refrescos y también ofrece artesanías. Durante las ferias  exhibe sus productos y busca un ayudante porque sus ventas se incrementan y no puede atenderlas sola. Sus mayores ventas ocurren en los meses de Junio y Julio y desde Diciembre hasta  las épocas de carnavales que mucha gente compra mochilas y atuendos que adicionan a sus  disfraces. Ella es una persona muy responsable con sus obligaciones y se destaca por ser muy puntual en el pago de las mismas; sus hijos son todos profesionales y esto lo han logrado con su apoyo y la gran disciplina de estudios que profesan. Sus principales clientes son transeúntes y maneja compradores en la ciudad de Cúcuta, en Norte de Santander, porque allí viven sus hijos y le apoyan. Con su trabajo ha logrado adquirir su vivienda y un local en una galería popular en la ciudad de Valledupar que se encuentra en calidad de arriendo. Su credikiva es el quinto financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará artesanías y mercancías en general, para surtir el Kiosco, porque está muy cerca la época en que repuntan sus ventas y necesita estar bien preparada, para continuar respondiendo exitosamente a su decisión de hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Jenny, 55 years old, is an enterprising woman who has 4 children, aged between 22 to 35, and lives in the city of Barranquilla.  She has had a store here since 1982. She had no source of income and decided to begin her enterprising adventure with a little capital, renting a space where she installed a kiosk. It still exists and at present she sells soft drinks and artisan crafts. 

During the local fairs Jenny exhibits her products and has to look for an assistant because sales increase and she can't attend to all the business. Her largest sales occur during June and July, and between December and carnival, when many people buy back packs and attire to add to their costumes.

Jenny is a very responsible with her obligations and she is notably punctual in her payments. Her children are all professionals and this has been achieved with her help and the discipline required by their studies. Her principal customers are passers-by and she uses suppliers in Cucuta in the north of Santander, where her children live and can help.

Through her work, Jenny has acquired her home and a stall which she rents in the popular gallery of the city of Valledupar. This 'credikiva' will be her 5th loan received through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. Jenny will buy artisan crafts, and general merchandise to restock her kiosk, because the era when her sales pick up is very near and she needs to be prepared if she is to continue successfully responding to her decision to make her business grow.

loans.use: buy artisan crafts and general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Tatiana Rosibel

texts.es: Tatiana Rosibel de veintiséis años de edad vive con sus dos hijos. Ella posee una venta de cosméticos en variedad, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente pues la prefieren porque vende productos de muy buena calidad, novedosos y a precios bajos, además Tatiana es una mujer muy carismática emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante trata a sus clientes con lo mejor de sí. Tatiana piensa y tiene muy claro que el mundo está en manos de aquellos que tienen el coraje de soñar y de correr el riesgo de vivir sus sueños y su pensamiento la ha motivado a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cosméticos de toda variedad como, sombras, rubor, base facial, lápiz labial, delineador, todo por mayor porque así obtiene precios más accesibles, es una buena forma para que no decepcione a los clientes y siempre se mantenga al frente de la competencia. Tatiana tiene la esperanza que su trabajo le dará la oportunidad de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Tatiana Rosibel is 26 years old, and she lives with her two children.  She sells a variety of cosmetics.  She has acquired lots of customers now.  They prefer her because she sells very good quality products at low prices.  

Tatiana is a very charismatic and enterprising woman with the desire to get ahead.  She takes care of her customers by giving the best of herself.  Tatiana believes, and it is very clear to her, that the world is in the hands of those who have the courage to dream and to run the risk of living their dreams.

This thought has motivated her to request a loan from INTEGRAL.  A loan will allow her to buy a complete variety of cosmetics like eye shadow, blush, foundation, lipstick, and eye liner.  She will buy everything wholesale because that is the way she gets more accessible prices.  This is a good way to buy so that she does not disappoint the customers and to always stay ahead of the competition.

Tatians has the hope that her work will give her the opportunity to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy eye shadow, blush, foundation, lipstick, and eye liner.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a hardworking 42-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children who are school-aged (7, 4 and 3). He has been farming so as to provide for his family. He supplements his income by the earnings he makes from offering security services. In the next five years, he wants to have increased the capacity of milk he takes to the milk-processing firm. His dream is to add dairy cows to his farm in the future.

He had earlier taken a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, which he has repaid. He is now requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy another dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.es: Elisabet tiene 26 años, convive con Jhonny de 31 años, con quien tiene 03 hijos. Juntos residen en la comunidad de Sta. Rosa Alta del distrito de Sivia. Elisabeth, Desde muy joven trabajaba en la venta de productos de primera necesidad, negocio que estaba instalada en casa de su madre. Con el tiempo logró reunir una cantidad de dinero y eso le sirvió para comprarse un terreno, en donde construyó su propia casa y con el apoyo de su esposo, pudo acondicionar su tienda. Elisabet se muestra contenta con los logros que esta obteniendo, pero aún así desea tener una tienda más amplia para vender variedad de productos no perecibles, por tal motivo solicita un nuevo crédito a MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con los 3.000 nuevos que solicita, adquirirá nuevos productos para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Elisabeth is 26 years old and in a common-law relationship with Jhonny, age 31. They have three children and live in the community of Santa Rosa Alta in the District of Sivia. From a young age, Elisabeth has been selling basic necessity products from a business located at her mother’s house. Over time, she was able to accumulate a sum of money that she used to buy a piece of land where she built her home. With the help of her husband, she was able to establish her store. Elisabeth is pleased with what she has been able to obtain, but she wants her store to be larger so that she can sell a variety of non-perishable products. For this reason, she is requesting a new loan from MFP which she promises to repay on time.

This will be her second loan with MFP and she hopes to receive support from everyone. The loan of 3000 PEN that she requested will be used to acquire new products to keep her store in operation.

loans.use: to purchase new products for her store.

loans.name: Mercedes Solandi

texts.es:
Mercedes  de 26 años de edad, vive con su familia en casa de sus padres, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Motupe que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace algunos años Mercedes se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, desde hace 3 años, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías con la intensión de surtir su tienda, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga los productos necesarios para ofrecer a sus clientes.  Mercedes es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarles más comodidades a sus hijos y otras oportunidades en un futuro.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 26, lives with her family in her parents’ home, which has all of the basic amenities and is located in Motupe district in Lambayeque department. This area is characterized by agriculture and cattle raising.

For several years Mercedes has sold basic supplies (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, etc.) and beverages. For the past three years, she has operated her business from her own home for her convenience and security. She tries, with the profits obtained from store sales, to meet all of her household expenses as well as raise her family’s standard of living.

In order to expand her business she has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which she will use to buy more merchandise to stock her store. Her goal is to see her business grow and to have the necessary items to offer her customers.  

Mercedes is a responsible, dedicated and hardworking person who is dedicated to providing more advantages and future opportunities to her children.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 38 years old and married, with 4 children between 5 and 21.  She runs a clothing store in Waterloo near Freetown.

Fatmata has owned this business for 5 years and sells lace, cotton, traditional patterned material her at store. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenge to her business is the transportation problem from Freetown to Waterloo.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase lace, cotton and traditional patterned material. Fatmata says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children. In the future, she would like to be a supplier to other partners.

loans.use: To purchase more lace, cotton and traditional patterned material.

loans.name: El Hadji

texts.fr:
El hadji est menuisier depuis 10 ans,il fait son apprentissage chez son patron qui a travaillé dans le sud et au nord du sénégal.Quand il a son diplome,il préfére ouvrir son propre atelier de travail dans la ville natale.Il achete son bois de menuiserie en quantité pour bénéficier des reduction de prix.50% de son travail c'est par commande le reste exposé devant son atelier.

El hadji décide de prendre un crédit pour développer son atilier et éventuellement acheter des machines.Il est mairé avec 1 enfant de 1 an 1 mois.Il veut développer pour avoir une maison et la scolarisation son enfant.
texts.en:
El Hadji is married with a 13-month-old child. He has been a carpenter for 10 years. He apprenticed with his boss, who has worked in the south and north of Senegal. 

Upon getting his diploma, he opted to open his own workshop in his hometown. He buys his lumber in large quantities to get lower prices. Half of his work is made to order, whereas the remainder of his merchandise is displayed in front of his shop. 

El Hadji decided to apply for a loan to expand his business and purchase equipment. He wants to get a house and provide for his child’s education.

loans.use: to buy lumber to make beds, tables, dressers, etc.

loans.name: Secundino

texts.es:
El señor Secundino, es macatero, es decir, se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropas como ser jeans para damas y caballeros, remeras deportivas y de vestir, y calzados como ser de vestir y deportivos, todo esto lo realiza por la tarde, y que por la mañana vende frutas y verduras.
Tiene una camioneta que es de su propiedad, con el cual realiza su negocio, tiene casa propia en la ciudad, según el cliente hace 2 años que se dedica a este rubro, anteriormente trabajaba como empleado en la minería de ypacarai, con una antigüedad de 12 años.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas para la temporada, como camisa, remeras, y calzados, entre otros. Está agradecido a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da,pues de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Secundino is a “macatero” (a rural salesman) who travels around selling clothes such as jeans for women and men, t-shirts for sports and casual wear, and shoes (both dress shoes and athletic shoes). He sells this merchandise in the afternoons since he spends the morning selling fruits and vegetables.

Secundino owns a truck that he uses for his business, as well as a house in the city. He says that he has been in this business for two years. Previously he worked as an employee for a mining company in Ypacarai, where he had 12 years of experience.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy seasonal clothing such as shirts, t-shirts, shoes, and other items. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to him. Obtaining credit will be a great help to his enterprise.

loans.use: to buy shirts, t-shirts, shoes, and other items.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena; ella tiene 57 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tejido de chompas, ella teje chompas para niños, mujeres y varones y luego lo vende en forma independiente, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tejido de chompas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lana de diferentes colores, agujas y palitos de tejer.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "KANCHARY", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Elena, 57, is married and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her sweater knitting business.  She knits for children, women and men and sells independently.  Her work hours are from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. and through her business she has been able to support her children.  She wants to increase her knitting activity and is requesting a loan to buy different colored yarn, pins and knitting needles.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy different colored yarn, pins and knitting needles.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Las Rosas”, lo conforman 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, pero principalmente los oficios de peluquería y costuras. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de La Serena.
Héctor integrante y secretario del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en el medio y fondo del grupo, él se dedica al corte y confección de ropa, desde hace 10 años. Comenta que aprendió de manera autodidacta. 
Hector confecciona y repara ropa, sus clientes cuando requieren sus servicios de confección van a su domicilio, el está disponible durante todos los días de la semana. Comenta que su clientela es fija y cuenta con un gran número de ellos. 
Sus materiales los compra en la ciudad de Santiago y los encarga por internet, por lo que sus insumos llegan por encomienda. Comenta que ésta dinámica de compra resulta más cómoda. Sus materiales los compra cada vez que necesita confeccionar alguna vestimenta. 
Con el crédito comprará género e hilos. 
Sus metas son tener un taller y adaptarlo en su propia casa. 
Hector vive junto a su madre, hermana y dos sobrinos. Sus sueños a nivel personal son prosperar en su negocio, para generar mejores ingresos y así brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 
Sus motivaciones de continuar, se deben a los ingresos económicos que le brinda su negocio. 
El está muy contento y agradecido de los créditos y servicios otorgados por Fondo esperanza, comenta que la experiencia grupal le ha servido para compartir con mas personas. 
Las capacitaciones le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias en la administración de su negocio. 
La Serena es una ciudad al norte de Chile, ubicada en la  Región de Coquimbo, provincia de Elqui. Es un importante sitio turístico, especialmente durante el verano, donde la gente va a visitar sus playas. La ciudad se dedica principalmente al sector de los servicios, habiendo varios bancos e instituciones financieras y una variada oferta gastronómica y hotelera. En las últimas décadas, el turismo se ha convertido en unas de las actividades económicas más importantes, además la ciudad es paso obligatorio de cientos de cruceros que arriban a la ciudad de Coquimbo, en donde en La Serena encuentran el lugar de residencia provisoria para visitar la zona y el Valle de Elqui.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Las Rosas” and has 17 entrepreneurs who are in a variety of businesses though mainly barber services and sewing.  All are from the city of La Serena.

Héctor is a member and Secretary of the communal bank.  In the photo he’s in the middle in the back of the group.  He has been making clothes for the last ten years.  He comments that he’s self-taught.  He makes and repairs clothes.  When his customers need his services they go to his house.   He’s available every day of the week.  He comments that his customers are regular and he has quite a few of them.

He buys his supplies in the city of Santiago or orders them on the Internet so his supplies are delivered to him.  He comments that this way of purchasing is more comfortable.  He buys supplies each time he needs to make a garment.  He will use the loan to buy fabric and thread.  His goal is to have a workshop set up at home.

Héctor lives with his mother, sister and two nephews.  His dream on a personal level is to make progress in business to generate better income and provide his family with a better quality of life.  His motivation to continue is the income he earns from his business.

He is very happy and grateful for the loans and services granted by Fondo Esperanza.  He comments that the group experience has allowed him to share more with other people.  The training has been useful to learn new business administration strategies.

La Serena is a city in north Chile located in the Coquimbo Region, Elqui Province.  It’s an important tourist center especially in summer when people come to visit the beaches.  The city is primarily service sector oriented; there are several banks and financial institutions and a varied cuisine and hotel sector.  During the last few decades tourism has become one of the most important economic activities.  The city is an obligatory stop for hundreds of cruise ships that arrive at the city of Coquimbo and people find temporary housing in La Serena for their trips to visit the zone and the Elqui Valley.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 49 years old and a dairy farmer. His wife Mercy is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children, ages 8 and 11 years. He has been in the dairy farming business for the past ten years with the monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan after repaying the previous loan successfully. John will use the loan to buy a bull and animal feeds. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will venture into pig farming. 

His hopes and dreams are to rear pigs in large amounts, to earn money to help educate his children and improve the living standard of the family.

loans.use: To buy a bull and animal feed.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
At the young age of 18, Jacqueline had already settled into marriage and was living separately from her parents. She was not able to seek employment, so she engaged herself in a retail business to earn income and make a living. She usually earns about 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month and uses the money to pay for her children's school fees, room and board, and allowances.

Jacqueline is now 31 years old and has four children. Her family lives under less fortunate circumstances but is happy to be together. Jacqueline is now requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy vinegar, cooking oil, sugar, milk, soap, and detergent for resale in her store. She hopes these additional grocery items will increase her sales capacity.

Jacqueline hopes to strengthen and improve her sales from her business and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy vinegar, cooking oil, sugar, milk, soap, and detergent for resale

loans.name: Mirzomutdin

texts.ru: Мирзомутдин проживает в районе Рудаки. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Мирзомутдин имеет средне – специальное образование. Он плотник. Уже восемь лет как он занимается изготовлением мебели. Кредит берет для закупа шифера и досок, чтобы достроить навес.
texts.en: Mirzomutdin lives in the Rudaki region. He is married and has two children. His wife is a homemaker and Mirzomutdin has a technical degree. He now works as a woodworker and has been making furniture for the last eight years. Mirzomutdin is requesting this loan to purchase eternit and wood for building a shed.

loans.use: to purchase wood and roofing materials(eternit) for a shed

loans.name: Ran

texts.en: Ran has been engaged in a sewing business since 2007. She works for a garment factory in Phnom Penh city and usually gets a monthly salary. She is now 26 years old and a mother of a small child who is at the age for attending school. As shown in the picture, Mrs. Ran has a small farm in her yard where she has raised some piglets for more profit. If this business becomes successful, she will expand this piggery  and raise many piglets at the same time. With this loan amount from Kiva’s funders, she will buy 13 head of piglets and 10 sacks of feed for her project. She is very happy and appreciate  the support. In the future, she hopes to provide a good quality of life to her family and to ensure a bright future for her child.

loans.use: To buy 13 head of piglets and 10 sacks of feed for her project.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Teopista has been working hard to manage her grocery store, which sells fish, tomatoes, and onions. 

To help expand her business, Teopista has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fish and produce for resale, and it will help Teopista to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Teopista hopes that in the future she will be able to start another business. 

Teopista is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Teopista who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more fish and produce for resale.

loans.name: Lucely

texts.es: La señora Lucely a sus 48 años de edad es madre cabeza de familia, vela por su hijo y se dedica desde hace más de 18 años a la venta de comidas rápidas y fritos. La señora Lucely requiere de la compra de insumos para elaborar sus productos y comercializarlos, adicionalmente realizar adecuaciones en el piso y paredes de su local donde vende los productos que esta localizado a la orilla del rio Medellín. La señora Lucely espera mejorar sus ingresos y con estos la calidad de vida de su familia y cumplir su sueño de comprar una casa propia para que su hijo tenga asegurado donde vivir.
texts.en: Lucely, 48, is a mother and head of household.  She cares for her son, and for more than 18 years she has had a business selling fried fast food.  Lucely needs to buy supplies to make her products and sell them.  In addition, she needs to make some repairs to the floor and wall of the premises where she sells her products, located on the bank of the Medellín river.  Lucely hopes to improve her income and with it the quality of life of her family, and to fulfill her dream of buying her own house so that her child can be assured of a place to live.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as corn, cooking oil and vegetables, and also to make some repairs to the floor and walls of her business premises

loans.name: Zeby

texts.ru:
Зеби 46 лет, замужем, воспитывает трех детей.  Основным источником дохода для семьи Зеби является животноводство, начатое ей в 2006 году. Стартовав с начальной суммы в 32,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство приносит около 14,000 сом в месяц.  Доходы от бизнес – деятельности позволили Зеби оплатить учебу  в университете для своего сына.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зеби обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку трех бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы Зеби планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, в будущем мечтает видеть и младших детей – студентами университета.
texts.en:
Zeby is 46 years old, married and raising three children. The main source of income for Zeby's family is animal husbandry, started by her in 2006. Having started with a sum of 32,000 som (KGS), her farm today brings in around 14,000 som (KGS) per month. The income from the business allowed Zeby to pay for tuition at the university for her son. 

In order to further develop her business, Zeby turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of three calves for fattening and resale. Zeby plans to invest the income in further increasing the number of livestock, and dreams of seeing her younger children as university students in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y querer ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Emilia es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 4 hijos, a quienes su padre abandonó desde hace un largo tiempo; es por esto que Emilia tiene la urgencia de garantizarles a sus hijos los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de sus gastos. Emilia tiene un puesto de venta de comidas en un lugar muy concurrido de la ciudad, y gracias a la buena calidad de sus comidas tiene muy buen reconocimiento por parte de sus clientes. Emilia tiene este negocio hace aproximadamente 2 años, y gracias a esto ha podido generar los ingresos con los cuales les puede ofrecer a sus hijos una buena educación. Debido a que su negocio lo inició con muy bajo capital, Emilia compró un carro de comidas que estaba bastante viejo, sin embargo, con su cuidado, ha ido arreglando algunas cosas que requerían mejoras. Es por esto que ahora Emilia busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a pintar su carro de comidas rápidas de modo que se vea mejor presentado para sus clientes y comprar una mesa y unas sillas para que sus clientes puedan comer sus comidas en su puesto de comidas y no sólo las compren para llevarlas. 
Emilia espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues ya podrá ofrecer a sus clientes el servicio de comer sus comidas rápidas en el punto donde ella las prepara, pues sin las mesas no tienen donde ubicarse en su puesto de comidas. Además, Emilia espera que con mayores ingresos pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y les pueda ofrecer un futuro económico más próspero.

loans.use: Pintar su carro de comidas rápidas de modo que se vea mejor presentado para sus clientes y comprar una mesa y unas sillas para que sus clientes puedan comer sus comidas en su puesto de comidas y no sólo las compren para llevarlas.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Djigonso, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec   NANA, 1ere debout de la droite  vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Benkadi 4" are married women averaging 34 years of age and three children each all living in traditional families in Djigonso, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali) The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with NANA, the first one standing from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs and some seeds and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining one hectare.

The produce will be sold in the village and at the San market after the harvest. The customer base is composed of men and women. 

She expects to make an average profit of 160,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and to buy farm inputs and some seeds

loans.name: Sabougnouman I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMAN I sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zagnanabougou, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil, l’arachide et du fonio. Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SIGA deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare de mil.
La production  est vendue au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000F CFA environs par campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
C e groupe est créé depuis juillet 2011.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme lien la solidarité.

Fatou qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée et  mére de 06 enfants dont 03 garçons.

Elle pratique le petit commerce,elle vend de l'huile de palme et du cola,elle s'approvisionne à koungheul et au marché hebdomadaire de bamba.

Ainsi avec le crédit,elle compte acheter  un panier de 50 kg de colas à 60000f et 12.5l d'huile de palme à 1200f le litre.

Le bénéfice réalisé lui permettra de réfectionner sa case et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2011.  It is made up of members who all live in the same village and work to support one another.  

Fatou (on the right with her hand raised in the photo) is the group representative.  She is married and has six children, of whom, three are boys.  Fatou sells palm oil and cola nuts.  She buys her supplies in Koungheul and at the weekly market in Bamba.

Fatou plans to use her loan to buy a 50kg basket of cola nuts for 60,000 francs CFA, and 12.5 litres of palm oil, for 1,200 francs CFA a litre.  Her profits will be used to refurbish her stall and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and cola nuts for resale.

loans.name: Inti Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “INTI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cuscon y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ghiovanna ella es soltera y tiene 31 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “INTI”. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Sra. Ghiovanna. She is single and 31 years old. She works in her restaurant business. She prepares different plates such as chicken with potatoes, soups, and sautéed beef. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She already has 10 years in this business and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her restaurant business. She requests a loan to buy products for cooking such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

The other members make a living by selling clothes, an internet business, a grocery business, and a restaurant business.

The member thanks those who are a part of this dream through this medium and agrees to comply with the payment of dues by the deadline.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking, such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Sr De Coyllority Cachimayo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITY CACHIMAYO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Carmen, la socia continua dedicándose a la  crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera mediante  su negocio obtener más ganancias para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar alimentos y cuyes entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chompas, negocio de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, crianza de animales menores, ganadería y venta de comida.
Los socios  que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.

loans.use: para comprar alimentos y cuyes entre otros.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en: Eulalia’s business is banana chips. She sells them at the market and also supplies it to some Supermarkets in the town area of Apia. With her current loan, she was given the amount of $775 and has used it to buy ingredients for her banana chips and maintenance of her kitchen. Eulalia is planning to extend her business with her next loan, to delivering of her chips to shops and schools in both urban and rural areas.

loans.use: Buying Ingredients/Maintenance

loans.name: Sarvan

texts.en:
Sarvan was born in 1980 in the Fizuli region of Azerbaijan. He is married and  has 2 children. 
Having borrowed a loan amount of $600 he bought shoes and socks. 
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy clothes.

loans.use: Add clothing stock to his shoe store.

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico lives in a rented house on Villamil de Rada Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosí zone, on the western slope of the city of La Paz. He is 43 years old and has a business making wallets from leather and leather-like vinyl. He has been working in this for more than 15 years and his wife helps him with the business. She is the one who sells the products on market days, which are Thursday and Friday, in the city of El Alto, on July 16th Street. This business gives him the opportunity to create jobs; in the making the wallets, Federico cuts the leather and assembles the wallets, while an employee sews them. The employee receives wages of 3 Bolivanos per piece, which is equivalent to $0.38. In addition to this employee, he employs two street vendors, who receive a percentage of their sales.

This is Federico’s first loan with IMPRO. According to the characteristics of the business and the evaluation that has been done, and the fact that he generates other jobs, it is considered that he will be able to fulfill this obligation. p> Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Federico vive en anticretico en la calle Villamil de Rada de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí (ladera oeste) de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 43 años de edad y se dedica a la confección de billeteras de cuero y cuerina; realiza este trabajo por más de 15 años, tiene la colaboración de la esposa que es la que vende el producto en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto en la Av. 16 de julio los días jueves y viernes. Este trabajo le dá la posibilidad de creara fuentes de trabajo, asi en la confección de las billeteras, Federico realiza el cortado y armado y tiene un empleado que es el que se encarga de coser cada una, con un salario de BS. 3.- (Tres 00/100 Bolivianos) por pieza lo que equivale a $us.0.38 (Treinta ocho centavos de Dólar Americano), además de este empleado cuenta con dos vendedores ambulantes a quienes les paga en porcentaje por ventas. Este es su primer crédito en Impro, y por las características del negocio y la evaluación efectuada, además de ser una persona que genera empleo se considera que está en posibilidades de cumplir con la obligación contraída.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase on the stock

loans.name: Dina Elisa

texts.es:
Ms. Dina Elisa Sánchez García is 38 years old and lives in the Roma Annex of the district of Ascope, state of La Libertad, Peru. She works selling breakfasts in the mornings from 7 to 11, and at night she takes out a cart with treats and a grill with meat skewers to the plaza in her community. With her first loan of approximately $95 she returned to this business after having left for a year to go to Lima and work with a relative. Now she is very happy because this business allows her to be close to her three children and educate them since she is a single mother and lives alone with them.

The work she's done allows her time to work with her community as president of the Mothers' Club "Arbol de Vida" (tree of life).

Ms. Dina hopes to have her own home, for this reason she wants to serve her customers better and better so she can increase her income. With the loan she will receive for approximately $250, she wishes to buy a stove for preparing the breakfasts.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora Dina Elisa Sánchez García Tiene 38 años de edad y vive en el Anexo Roma del Distrito de Ascope en el Departamento de La Libertad - Perú se dedica a la venta de desayunos de 7 a 11 de la mañana y por la noche saca una carretilla con golosinas y una parrilla con anticuchos para vender en la plaza de armas de su comunidad. Con su primer préstamo de S/.300 ($95 aproximadamente) en el B.C. ”Romanas Luchadoras” retoma este negocio después de un año de haberlo dejado para ir a Lima a trabajar con un familiar vendiendo menú. Ahora se siente muy contenta porque su negocio le permite estar cerca de sus tres hijas y educarlas ya que es madre soltera y vive solo con ellas. Pese al trabajo que realiza se da tiempo para colaborar con su comunidad presidiendo el Club de Madres “Árbol de la Vida” La señora Dina sueña con tener su casa propia, por eso quiere atender cada vez mejor a sus clientes para que pueda incrementar sus ventas; con el préstamo que recibirá de S/.800 ($250 aproximadamente) desea comprar una cocina para la preparación de los desayunos.

loans.use: To buy a stove (equipment)

loans.name: Lemafoe

texts.en: Lemafoe is 47 years old and a mother of 5.  Her last loan used to restock her shop and now she is applying for another loan to buy inventory stuff for her shop and equipment for her 4 acre land not far from her house. She earns approximately $200-$300 per week.

loans.use: To buy gramoxone (a weed-killing chemical), knives, spades and other supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en: My husband is very ambitious to improve our living standard. He runs a small mobile phones store. His store has been growing gradually since inception. Mobile phones have become a necessity and a rapid form of communication these days. Therefore, due an increased demand for these phones, my husband wishes to expand the range of mobiles at his store for which he requires a loan of $250. He wants to develop a strong client base so that he can increase his earnings. We hope to have a prosperous future with all the luxuries of life for us.

loans.use: Buy an extended range of mobiles for my husband's store.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine M. is a 50 year old married mother of 10 children. She currently raises pigs and wants the loan to open a retail shop. With the profits she hopes to begin another business in cow rearing.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To open a retail shop

loans.name: Theopister

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Theopister M.. She is married with two children, ages 13 and 17. In 2002 Theopister established a shoes and clothing business, and now requires a loan of $875 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Siti Maimunah

texts.id:
Siti Maemunah is a housewife who must work hard for her family's wellbeing. Her husband used to be a driver, but he is now completely blind in both of his eyes due to nerve damage. Besides supporting her family by buying and selling second-hand goods & recyclables, Siti Maemunah also has a store where she sells snacks and drinks. Times are very difficult right now because she is not making enough to support their family. All of the profits she makes from her store go into making her snacks. She has one child who is not married and two grandchildren that live with her since their parents have gone to work Java. Seeing the situation, Siti Maemunah wishes to grow her business by selling bakso (meatball soup) and nasi goreng (fried rice). To accomplish this she would like to borrow 1,000,000 Rupiah for her business. She hopes with this loan she will be able to grow her business and better support her family and be able to send her two grandchildren to school.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Siti Maemunah seorang ibu rumah tangga yang harus bekerja keras untuk menghidupi keluarganya. Suaminya yang dulu seorang sopir kini mengalami kebutaan secara total pada kedua matanya karena kerusakan pada syaraf. Selain menjalankan usaha keluarga yaitu jual beli ban bekas, Siti Maemunah juga mempunyai usaha warung yang menjual minuman ringan dan makanan ringan. Hal ini dilakukan karena usaha keluarga tidak mencukupi untuk biaya sehari-hari yang harus dikeluarkan. Keuntungan yang diperoleh dari usaha warung ini dipakai untuk keperluan dapurnya. Karena Siti Maemunah menanggung satu orang anak yang belum menikah dan juga dua orang cucunya yang ditinggal oleh orangtuanya ke Jawa. Melihat situasi yang memungkinkan untuk usaha warung tersebut maka Siti Maemunah berkeinginan untuk menambah usahanya dengan berjualan bakso dan nasi goreng. Makanya Siti Maemunah minta pendampingan dan pinjaman modal dari Dinari sebesar Rp.1.000.000 untuk usahanya ini. Siti Maemunah berharap dengan bertambahnya usaha ini, maka keuntungan yang diperoleh pun semakin bertambah dan kebutuhan keluarga bisa terpenuhi,sehingga kedua cucunya pun bisa menikmati bangku sekolah.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks and snacks to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase many types of products

loans.name: Assana

texts.en:
Assana A. is married and has four children. She owns a provision store but she is running out of stock.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Mouniratou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mouniratou C. was born in 1956 in Lagos, Nigeria; she is married and the mother of five (05) children. Her husband has been unemployed for 4 years and her dry goods store is the only source of income for the family. She has been practicing this trade for over 20 years but her insufficient means do not allow her to develop and increase the number of her customers. Nowadays, she is anxious to revive her activity, to better outfit her store in order to attract more customers; Mrs. C. Mouniratou is requesting a loan. This will increase her profit and improve her family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1956 à Lagos au Nigeria Madame C. Mouniratou est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Son mari est sans emploi depuis 4 ans et son commerce de mercerie constitue la seule source de revenu pour la famille. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis plus de 20 ans mais ses maigres moyens ne lui permettent pas d’évoluer et d’avoir plus de clientèles. Aujourd’hui, soucieuse de relancer ses activités et mieux équiper sa boutique pour attirer plus de clientèle ; Madame C. Mouniratou sollicite un crédit Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaires et améliorera son niveau de vie et celui de sa famille.

loans.use:
To outfit her dry goods store

Equiper sa boutique de mercerie

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Born around 1974 in the Department of Couffo in Benin, Mrs.Jeanne K. is married to Mr.Severin Anagonou - a mechanic by training. Mrs.K. is the mother of two children, Juliette and Carole, ages 7 and 5 respectively. A hair dresses by training, she owns two beauty salons with six apprentices under her. Apart from this, she also retails cosmetic and personal care products to her clients. She is seeking a loan in order to stock up on supplies.

Translated from French by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Née vers 1974 dans le département du COUFFO au BENIN, dame K. Jeanne est mariée à Monsieur ANAGONOU Sévérin,mécanicien de profession. Elle est mère de 2 enfants, Juliette et Carole respectivement âgées de 7 et 5 ans. Coiffeuse de profession, elle a deux salons de beauté avec six apprentis sous sa responsabilité. En dehors de cette profession, elle revend à ses clients, des produits cosmétiques et de soins corporels. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour s'approvisionner.

loans.use: Purchase 4 boxes of cosmetic products and 5 dozen hair extensions

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther has 3 school age children, who are the reason for her daily toil because she wants to give them the necessities. For 5 years now, she has been selling food, offering lunches to truckers from Monday through Friday. On weekends, she sets up tables and chairs on her patio in order to sell beer. Esther wishes to have a recreational center where she can sell food and drinks. For this, she needs to start setting up a space and buy furniture, games, etc. She is requesting this loan in order to increase capital so that she can start making her business grow. Furthermore, she will use the loan to purchase the ingredients needed to make her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Esther tiene 3 hijos que actualmente están en la escuela, y por los que realiza su labor diaria para darles lo necesario.Hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de comida, ofreciendo almuerzos diarios a los transportistas, de lunes a viernes.Los fines de semana acondiciona su patio con mesas y sillas para la venta de cerveza. El deseo de Esther es tener una casa recreo, para los fines de semana, donde pueda vender comida y bebidas. Para ellos bebe ir acondicionando el espacio, comprando muebles, juegos, etc.Solicita el presente préstamo para incrementar su capital y pueda iniciar el crecimiento de su negocio, además de comprar alimentos para la preparación de sus comidas.

loans.use: Increase capital for her food and beer business

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. José M. lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. He is a 56-year-old married father of a 10-year-old son. His wife is a homemaker. Mr. M. works in the operational field of the National Police with 28 years of experience. The country’s financial situation does not allow its inhabitants to construct their homes at one time, which is why they need to take out small loans so that they can improve their homes little by little. With this loan that he is requesting, he plans to construct a wall in the backyard of his house in order to provide more safety for his family because his neighborhood is very dangerous, and his wife and son are on their own all day long.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. José habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa. Don José trabaja en la Policía Nacional desempeñándose en el área operativa y tiene 28 años de experiencia. La situación económica del país no le permite a los habitantes poder construir sus viviendas de manera total, es por eso que ellos solicitan pequeños créditos para ir haciendo poco a poco mejoras a sus hogares. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para infraestructura en la construcción de un muro en la parte trasera de su vivienda para lograr más seguridad para su familia, ya que el barrio donde él habita es bastante peligroso, y su esposa e hijo quedan solos todo el día.

loans.use: Build a protective wall in his backyard

loans.name: Ivanna

texts.en:
Ivanna sells household items in Belaya Tserkov, in a local market called Belotserkivets. She is the only vendor offering this type of product in that neighborhood. Ivanna started her enterprise about 10 years ago when she became a widow and couldn't live on the retirement pay she received. Presently, she has about $12,000 invested in merchandise. Her net profit is about $800 a month. 

Ivanna would like to invest a 3000-Grivna loan in reconstruction of her vending facility. She is hoping to see her business flourish and bring her a more sufficient income. Ivanna is planning to use part of the profit generated to finish construction of her house, which has been quite a lengthy process. Ivanna is a strategic planner, and we believe this quality will help her keep moving towards her business and personal goals. 

Note: This is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To finish reconstruction of her vending facility

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana C., trabaja en la venta ambulante de golosinas desde hace más de 10 años, su esposo es portero de una institución educativa, y ambos aportan económicamente para cubrir los gastos del hogar, tienen 3 hijos en edad escolar, formando una felíz familia. Laboralmente la señora Juana se dedica a vender golosinas en la puerta de la institución educativa en la que trabaja su esposo, especialmente en épocas de clases, ya que en períodos de vacaciones y al no haber venta, ella, deja de sacar créditos, para no fallar en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Juana C. has worked in traveling sales of snacks and treats for more than 10 years, and her husband is a doorman in an educational institution. Both contribute to covering household expenses. They have 3 school-age children, together comprising a happy family. Juana sells treats at the door of the educational institution in which her husband works, especially during the times when classes are held. During vacation periods when there are no sales, she does not request loans that cannot be repaid.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz tiene 34 años es  madre soltera de dos hijos Alexis de 15 y Henry de 12. Mariluz se dedica a la venta de artículos varios como detergentes, cepillos, artesanías, etc en el pueblo de acora, que esta a 30 minutos de donde ella vive, para  poder cubrir con los gastos de su hogar. Mariluz trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana cuando ha despachado a sus hijos al colegio, terminando a las 5 o 6 de la tarde siendo apoyada por sus hijos a su llegada. A Mari luz le parece un trabajo honrado que le permite brindarle a sus hijos una buena educación y cubrir son sus gastos de salud así que esta contenta al realizarlo. Es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero con que apoyes a Mariluz ella podrá comprar más de sus productos para aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Mariluz is 34 years old and a single mother of two children, Alexis,15, and Henry,12. Mariluz is dedicated to selling various items such as detergents, brushes, handicrafts, etc. in the village of Acora, which is 30 minutes away from where she lives, in order to cover the household expenses. Mariluz works from 8 in the morning when she sends her children off to school, finishing at 5 or 6 in the afternoon to help her children when they arrive. For Mariluz this is honest work because it allows her to provide her children a good education and cover their health costs.This is her first loan from Prisma Microfinance. With the money provided to Mariluz she will purchase more products to increase her economic earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise that she sells

loans.name: Brooms, Foods Group

texts.vi:
Phạm Thị Vụ, sinh năm 1957 (Ms:010105030041 ) tham gia vay vốn mức 3.180.000 vn đ, chị hiện đang sống cùng mẹ chồng và cô con gái lớn đã đ làm. Chị là người nhiệt tình, cởi mở và mọi người yêu mến. những người dân trong làng thường có nghê làm chổi tre, chị là một trong số họ. Với số tiền vay được chị mua tre về làm nguyen liệu làm chổi. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vn đ/ tháng . Chị là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm 7 thành viên:(p/)
 Phạm Thị Hoa, sinh năm 1970 (Ms 010105030043), tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 3.180.000 vn đ để mua tre nứa về làm chổi tại nhà, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vn đ/ tháng
Chử Thị Lan, sinh năm 1958 (Ms010105030042 ), tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 3.180.000 vn đ để đi chợ thu gom chổi nan đem bán lẻ, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.500.000 vn đ/ tháng
 Vũ Thị Quế, sinh năm 1957 (Ms 010105030044), tham gia vay vốn mức: 3.180.000 vn đ để mua tre nứa về làm chổi, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng: 2.000.000 vn đ/ tháng
 Ngô Thị Thanh, sinh năm 1953 (Ms  010105030045), tham gia vay vốn mức 3.180.000 vnđ, chị vay vốn về kinh doanh hàng ăn sáng, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 1.500.000 vnd/ tháng
 Hoàng Thị Hồng, sinh năm 1962 (Ms 010105030049), tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 2.204.000 vnd để kinh doanh bán hàng giải khát, đan chổi, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng; 2.000.000 vnd/ tháng
texts.en:
Mrs. P., born in 1957, joined the Fund with a loan of 3,180,000 VND. She is currently living with her mother-in-law and her own grown daughter. She is an honest, open person who everybody admires. The people in her village mostly do work making bamboo brooms, herself included. With the loan, she bought bamboo to use as feedstock for her brooms. Her family's average income is about 3,000,000 VND/month. She is the group leader, which includes 7 participants: Hoa Thi P., born in 1970, is borrowing 3,180,000 from the Fund to buy bamboo to make brooms at home. Her family's average income is around 2,000,000 VND/month. Lan Thi C., born in 1958, joined the Fund with a loan of 3,180,000 VND to buy brooms at the local market and resell them. The family's average income is around 2,500,000 VND/month. Que Thi V., born 1957, joined the Fund with a loan of 3,180,000 VND to buy bamboo to make brooms. The family's average income is about 2,000,000 VND/month. Mrs. Thanh Thi N., born in 1953, joined the Fund with a loan of 3,180,000 VND to use in running a breakfast business. The family's average income is around 1,500,000 VND/month. Mrs. Hong Thi Hoan, born in 1962, joined the Fund with an amount of 2,204,000 VND to do business selling beverages, weaving brooms. The family's average income is around 2,000,000 VND/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Manufacturing brooms, food stands

loans.name: Zoidolith

texts.en:
Zoidolith I. P. is 32 years old.  She lives in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country.  This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River.  Zoidolith is a member of the Las Heroinas communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 5 years to support her corner store, where she offers snacks and refreshments.

Zoidolith is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 1,300 Nuevo Soles to purchase bottled sodas, juices, candies and crackers to stock her store on Inmaculada Street.  She will repay the loan in monthly installments.  She is photographed above with some of the wares she offers from her stand.  It is only open in the evenings, in the morning Zoidolith takes care of her family and her household.  With the proceeds from her business, she is able to provide for herself and her children.

loans.use: To purchase bottled sodas, juices, candies and crackers for resale

loans.name: Hem's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by three members, all residents of Prek Ho Commune, Kandal Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Y. was selected to be group leader by the group members. Y., age 24, makes a living selling fish in the vicinity of Beung Trobek Market. She has been doing this since early 2008, and earns around of $5 each day. She is married and the mother of two children; both of them are still young and under her care. Her husband's name is Bunthorn, who is a truck driver in a small firm. Presently, Y. tries her best to make an income from her business. She hopes to expand the business, so she needs a loan of $300 to buy more fish to sell.

The other two borrowers are:

R., a widow, sells fish and she asks for a $250 loan to purchase additional fish for sale.

S. is a fish seller and a widow. She needs a loan of $150 to buy fish to sell for her daily income.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Yem Y. lives in Tonle village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Touch Pheap, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate both rice and vegetables. Mrs. Yem Y. is a applying a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She has three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other one helps with the farm work. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: N. Grace is 32 years old. She owns a restaurant in Ibanda town which she has been running for 4 years. Grace is using the loan to purchase more cooking utensils, food, and drinks. She also wants to complete her house with 4 rooms in order to rent it out and get some money. Grace is married with one child.

loans.use: purchase more cooking utensils, food, and drinks.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia H. is 37 years old.  She is married with three children, two of whom are currently in school; junior high and the basic school.  One of them is learning a trade.  Afia lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  Her husband is a farmer.  She trades to make some income to support her husband financially.  Afia trades in hard wares.  She sells building and construction wares such as shovels, machetes, paint, cements, etc., in a store in her community.
