She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure more goods to stock her shop.  Afia hopes to sponsor her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: Procure hard wares.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 25 years old and married with one child. She is a tailor who makes lovely clothes for her customers. She also sells sarongs of various colors. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Isroilhon

texts.ru: Исроилхон Тиллоев  1971 года, женат имеет 3 детей. Образование высшее. Жена сидит дома с детьми. Исроилхон с детства  помогал родителям ухаживать за скотом и сам научился разводить. Сейчас он учит своих детей  разводить скот.  Он недавно начал сотрудничать с Микроинвест. Он разводит скот почти 20 лет.  Планирует расширить свой коровник и поголовье скота. Он всегда отправляет на пастбище свой скот вместе с  сыном. К вечеру скот возвращается сытым. Исроилхон благодарен за поддержку от КИВА.
texts.en:
Isroilhon T. was born in 1971. He is married with three children and has a university diploma. His wife is a stay-at-home mom. Since he was a child, Isroilhon helped his parents tend to the cattle and breed livestock. He has been doing it for 20 years and is now trying to pass on this knowledge to his children. Recently Isroilhon became a client of Microinvest. He is planning to get more cattle. He sends his cattle to the pastures with his son for the day. Isroilhon is grateful to Kiva for its support.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle farming and sales

loans.name: Auguster

texts.en: Auguster sells cooked foods. She hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She is 45 years old and married with three children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Sol

texts.en: Sol T. is from the village of Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 40 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Sol owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Sol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Sol is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 7th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Liva

texts.en:
Liva P., 54, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in her taro and banana plantation business. She sells to the village community and general public three days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~110 USD). She has one previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Liva’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a gallon of herbicide and other chemicals, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana B. is from the village of Kinuman Norte in Ozamiz, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 70 years old. Juliana is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Juliana sells soft drinks in the local community. Juliana has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Juliana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliana has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Juliana is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to expand her business. This will be Juliana's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Chheoun

texts.en:
Chheoun C., age 27, is married and has a young child. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale, typically earning approximately US $2 per day. Her husband has been involved in construction business, earning US $7 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, C. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, C. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to commute to work easily and to transport her pigs to sell at the nearby local markets. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: purchasing a motorbike

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a 25-year-old food manufacturer in her simple way. She is married to Redentor P. and they are blessed with a child named Jon Andrei, who is 4 years old. They are peacefully residing in Christine Village of Cauayan City. The place is very simple.

She has managed a food-processing business and at the same time sold cooked snacks in their village for three years. She requests a loan amounting to PHP8,000 that will serve as additional business capital to further establish her store, which is located at their house. This is where she could also display her homemade processed frozen foods and her cooked snacks. Her husband works in a certain company somewhere in Mindanao.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
La señora  NORA S. A. D. A., tiene 37 años, vive en el distrito D. LA ESPERANZA , provincia D. TRUJILLO, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal ESPERANZA UNIDA.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to D. secundaria,  no pudo continuar estudiando porque a la edad D. 17 años quedó embarazada D. su actual esposo.  Tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente D. ella , una se encuentra en el jardín y el otro en el colegio.
NORA se dedica a  la venta D. menús (comida) que venD. a los trabajadores D. las construcciones aledaña a su casa, pero los fines D. semana prepara en su domicilio ceviche, tallarines , papa a la huancaína, frito D. chancho (platos típicos) y también venD. cerveza y gaseosas.
El primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió para comprar tapers, utensilios D. cocina y sacos D. arroz y papas.
Este crédito D. 700 nuevos soles lo utilizará para  comprar papas, arroz , aceite, menestras al por mayor y 2 juegos D. sillas y mesas para colocar en la sala D. su casa y poder vender los fines D. semana.
texts.en:
Sra. Nora S. A. D. A. is 37 years old, lives in the District of La Esperanza, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Esperanza Unida” (United Hope).

This entrepreneur completed her studies through the 5th year of secondary school. She was not able to continue studying because she became pregnant at the age of 17 with her current husband. She has 2 dependent children, one in kindergarten and the other in high school.

Nora spends her time selling lunches to construction workers near her home. On the weekends, she prepares ceviche, pasta, Huancayo potatoes, and fried pork (a traditional dish). She also sells beer and soft drinks. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased tablecloths, kitchen utensils, and sacks of rice and potatoes.

Her current loan of 700 soles will be used to buy potatoes, rice, oil, and dried vegetables wholesale. She will also acquire 2 sets of chairs and tables to place in her living room when she sells food from home on the weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes, rice, oil, dried vegetables, & 2 sets of tables and chairs

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié et a 05 personnes à sa charge, pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille, il a entamé en 1998 le commerce de filet qu’il revend aux pêcheurs, il a réduit son prix de vente pour vendre plus. La demande actuelle de ses clients est élevée, pour pouvoir les satisfaire convenablement, il sollicite un crédit pour acheter de la marchandise.

loans.use: Achat de filets

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita B. is already 52 years old, she is engaged into poultry business for almost two years, she sells one cobb for PHP 150.00, she applied a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 3,000.00 for her additional capital to purchase some feeds for her poultry.She works hard to support her family, especially in financial aspect.

She is married to Armando B., who works as a farmer, they are blessed with three industrious children, they are;Michael- 28 years old, a factory worker, next to him is Melchor- 25 years of age, and their youngest is Melvin- 20 years old, they are both farmers.They are presently living at San Francisco, Alicia Isabela. Most of the people residing in their village are into farming and vending business. Their house is located near at irrigation area and rice fields.

loans.use: Additional Capital to purchase feeds for her poultry

loans.name: Sohar Griselda

texts.es:
la sra. Sohar T. se dedica a la venta de agua en bolsa y refrescos, en esta ciudad de choluteca es muy caliente el clima, esto hace que las personas compren mucha agua y refrescos, es buen negocio, Sohar se siente muy feliz porque hace poco fue que decidio poner este tipo de negocio y hasta ahora todo va muy bien, cada dia que pasa siente que su negocio va creciendo poco a poco.
ahorita necesita el credito para comprar mas agua y refrescos, tiene pensado en un futuro poner un deposito en el cual pueda vender muchos productos liquidos.
fue agradable haber platicado con Sohar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sohar T. sells water and sodas in plastic bags. In the city of Choluteca it is very hot and that makes people buy a lot of water and soft drinks. It's a good business. Sohar is very happy since she decided to start this kind of business a short while ago and it is going very well. Each day she feels her business is growing a bit. She needs the loan right now to buy more water and sodas. In the future she would like to set up a store in which she could sell all different liquid products. It was pleasant to talk with Sohar.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheat

loans.name: Lizett

texts.es: Lizett T. es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos menores, trabaja confeccionando prendas de vestir (también vende chupetes y  hielo), cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja como transportista público. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace tres años, donde siempre se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad en los pagos. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en el arreglo de su refrigeradora para la venta de sus chupetes. En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 3000 soles que le permitirá invertir en la compra de telas, hilos y elásticos para confeccionar blusas y luego venderlas a sus clientes. La meta de Lizett es llegar a tener un taller de costura bien implementado y seguir mejorando económicamente.
texts.en:
Lizett T., 36, is a dynamic and cooperative woman that lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She has two minor children. Her line of work is dressmaking (she also sells ice and popsicles). Her husband, who is a public transit driver, supports her efforts. She has been a member of the "Las Divinas" (The Divine Ones) communal bank for the past three years; she has always been noted for her punctuality in her repayments. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy a refrigerator for her popsicle sales business. Currently, she needs 3000 soles to buy fabric, thread and elastic to make blouses to subsequently sell to her customers. Lizett's goal is to have a well-equipped sewing workshop and to continue to improve financially.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and elastic to sew blouses.

loans.name: Marice

texts.en:
Marice lives in Agbor, Delta State. She has a store where she sells groceries to make a living. She started this business seven years ago. She is a focused, hard worker. In the future, she hopes to own a supermarket. She is 49 years old and married, and she has 5 children. Her husband is a clergyman. 

Marice is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits. She says "thank you" to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Keut

texts.en: From day to day, Mrs. Keut R. and her family weave bamboo baskets to sell. She is 46, married and has eight children. Two of the children are employed in Phnom Penh and the others are jobless. In addition, her husband built a small workshop in which he provides a bicycle repair service. He also weaves baskets when he is free from his job. (Keut R. was not available when the photo taken so her husband is pictured instead.) Keut R. will be using the loan to buy her nearby neighbor’s house to tear down and use to enlarge/redecorate her existing house.

loans.use: To buy a nearby neighbor’s house

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es: La señora Pastora E. G., tiene 46 años, vive en el Barrio Laureles sur, Barrio conocido por la inseguridad social y la humiladad de sus habitantes, ella y su pareja viven juntos y él es jubilado, le apoya en los gastos de la casa. Doña Pastora tiene 4 hijos uno de 25 años de edad, que vive de manera independente los otros tres, tienen las edades de 12, 15 y 17 años, los cuales estudian la escuela secundaria, el mayor anhelo de la señora E. sería el tener las posibilidades económicas para preparar a sus hijos a las mejopres condiciones profesionales, asi como poder brindarles un hogar comodo y seguro donde habitar. Desde hace 10 ños tiene un negocio de costura al cual le desearía inyectar capital, con este prestamo podria comprar telas y elaborar uniformes, todo esto con el objetivo de aprovechar la temporada escolar que se avesina en nuestro páis y obtener mejores condiciones económicas y ofrecer a sus hijos un nuevo estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Pastora E. G. is 46 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood, an area known for its instability and the poverty of its residents. Since her husband is retired, she must work in order to cover the household expenses. They have four children. Her oldest child is 25 years old and lives independently. The other three are 17, 15, and 12 years of age and attend high school. Pastora’s greatest wish is to have economic opportunities so that she can prepare her children to become professionals as well as provide them with a comfortable and safe place to live.

For the past ten years, she has operated a sewing business into which she wants to inject capital. With this loan, Pastora will buy fabric for making uniforms. Her objective is to take advantage of the upcoming school season so that she can improve her financial situation and provide her children with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for making uniforms

loans.name: Lina Esther

texts.es:
Lina B. A., mujer de 51 años vive en el barrio Alcibia, lugar conocido como uno de los  semilleros   musicales de la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, donde ella dice que habitan personas amables, tranquilas y respetuosas; Lina es una mujer comerciante que ama hacer negocio, vende un alimento, elaborado a partir de la leche de vaca inducida a cuajarse, este es el famoso queso costeño  que no puede faltar en la mesa de las familias cartageneras. Así mismo elabora productos derivados de la harina de trigo rellenos de queso como son las deliciosas  empanadas y deditos y simultáneamente vende mercancía, especialmente calzado para damas, aprovechando cada época y su extensa clientela, pues responde oportunamente a lo que el mercado necesita. 

Lina B.  está casada tiene 2 hijos en edades de 18 y 20 años, a los que en unión de su esposo ha apoyado en el estudio de la ingeniería electrónica y de sistema; todos en casa se encuentran muy gratificados con la diversidad de actividades que desempeña su esposa y madre; ellos reconocen su talento y la admiran por su gran capacidad de trabajo.

En la actualidad aspira a un crédito por valor de $1.000.000; el cual tendrá una inversión dividida entre la compra de queso, suero, insumos para elaborar congelados y calzado de damas, negocio en el que ha incursionado hace alrededor de un año.

Lina inició su negocio hace 6 años y posteriormente fue impulsada por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con financiamiento en la línea de capital de trabajo. Desde entonces su negocio ha crecido y ella también, de la mano de las múltiples  actividades que realiza  simultáneamente, conjugando muy bien las tareas de hogar, las personales y las del negocio.
texts.en:
Lina B. A. is a 51 year old woman who lives in the Alcibia neighborhood, known as the one of the birthplaces of the music of the city of Cartagena de Indias. They say the people of Cartagena are friendly, peaceful and tolerant. Lina is an entrepreneur who loves business, selling foods made from milk curds. This is the famous costeño cheese (from the coast) that is always present in the meals of Cartagena families. She also makes foods from flour filled with cheese such as the delicious empanadas and “deditos”(a rolled cheese pastry). Besides these products, she sells merchandise such as women’s shoes, taking advantage of each season for her large customer base. She brings in what the market calls for. Lina B. is married, and has two children of 18 and 20. Along with her husband she has supported them in their studies of electrical and systems engineering. The family is very happy with the diversity of activities of their wife and mother. They appreciate her talent and admire how much she is able to do. Now she hopes for a loan of $1.000.000 ($525) which she will use to buy cheese, whey, ingredients to make ice creams, and women’s shoes. She started this part of her business about a year ago. Lina began her business 6 years ago and was later was helped by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo with the financing for working capital. Since then her business has grown and she as well, from the work of her many activities that she can do simultaneously, combining the chores at home, personal needs, and those of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese, whey, ingredients to make ice cream and to sell shoes

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 34 years old, is married to Isaac Njuguna, and they have two school-going children.

For the last fifteen years, Gladys has been sewing clothes to sell in Olkalou town which is in the outskirts of Naivasha town. She has a stable customer base and this ensures that she gets orders for the new clothes in her stall.

Gladys was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to buy more fabric to make new clothes for sale and also meet the orders she already has from her clientele.

Gladys plans to save and buy a personal vehicle which she will use to go and get her materials from Nairobi which is approximately 150 km away. This will help her save time and money which she currently spends to transport the materials to her place of work.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for her tailoring business

loans.name: Opeoluwa

texts.en:
Opeoluwa loves business and she is recording steady growth in her business. She sells bottles of wine and juice at retail prices to earn a living. The demands for her bottles of wine and juice are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

Opeoluwa lives with her family at Ibadan. She has a child and the child is four years old and attends school. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their home. Opeoluwa duly thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bottles of wine and juice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and resale of yams

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita B. is from the village of Capiponan, Cabanglasan Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Mercedita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Mercedita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling a variety of different products in the local community. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mercedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & was used towards working capital. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mercedita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sharifa Seta Group

texts.en:
Nazifa is the group leader of Sharifa Seta group. Nazifa wants a loan for her husband. She lives in Kabul Afghanistan. She is 47, married and has 6 children. Her two sons work with her husband in his general store and the others are students. He has to work hard to earn money to cover the household expenses. 


He wants to purchase additional stock for his shop such as sanitary products, dried milk and sugar. She has requested an individual loan of 42000 Afghani to buy the required items for the shop. She is glad that a nice process exists through which she can get a solution.

loans.use: to purchase additional items for the shop

loans.name: Mariana Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora  Mariana S. es socia del Banco Comunal El Crédito, ella  vive en la comunidad Misicata localidad  que se caracteriza por presentar hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, mucha gente joven ha migrado a otras ciudades del país o fuera de él  para brindar un mejor futuro a sus familias.

Nuestra socia tiene 32 años, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido dos hijos que se encuentran de 5 y 3 años, su  primera hija este año ingresa  al jardín de infantes, su esposo trabaja como acerrador de madera elaborando tablas, tablones, se encuentra contenta ya que tiene casa propia.

Mariana prepara  papas fritas en funda actividad que realiza hace dos  años, labora los días lunes y jueves, cuenta con una clientela fija  que le hacen  pedidos semanales,  los otros  días realiza la limpieza de departamentos en ésta actividad apenas tiene seis meses,  se encuentra en su séptimo crédito con su banco comunal  y fue una amiga quien la invito a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres muy luchadoras y emprendedoras, con su nuevo crédito va a comprar  aceite, papas, etiquetas,  fundas etc.

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mariana S. is a member of El Crédito ("The Loan" or "The Good Reputation") Communal Bank. She lives in Misicata, an area known for its beautiful scenery. The people are mainly farmers. Many young people have migrated to other cities in Ecuador or in other countries to help give their families a better future. Mariana is 32 years old. She is married and has two children, a five-year-old and a three-year-old. This year her elder daughter begins kindergarten. Her husband's work is to make wooden boards and planks, and he is happy since they have their own house. For two years, Mariana has made potato chips on Mondays and Thursdays. She has steady customers who place weekly orders. The rest of the week, she cleans apartments, a job she has had barely six months. This is her seventh loan with her communal bank. A friend had invited her to become part of this group of very determined and enterprising women. With her new loan, Mariana will buy oil, potatoes, labels, paper bags, etc. Her goal is to keep growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes, oil, paper bags, labels

loans.name: Blanca Guadalupe

texts.es:
Tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, es licenciada de enfermería, trabaja todos los días, en sus ratos libres  se dedica ala costura,  hace camisetas, pijamas; toda la vida le ha gustado la  costura, es profesional en bolsos, y tomo  cursos de artesanía.

 Sale a las ferias de cada pueblo, los fines de semana y lleva su mercadería, y le va muy bien. Ella compra las telas a los distribuidores, las que tiene falla para que le salgan mas baratas, y  se las ingenia para que le salga  bien hecha; hace una docena de blusas hasta las 11 de la noche, y en el día se dedica al hospital, donde hace turnos con sus compañeros.

 Nació en Quito, vino a vivir en Manabí desde hace varios años, su es esposo es de profesión joyero. El sueño de ella es viajar a otros países, se graduó de licenciada en enfermería, le gusta hacer de todo en costura y artesanía, cuando tiene tiempo libre se dedica a las ferias, en esta época del año están bajas las ventas; por semana hace una docena de blusas y una docena de interiores, depende de los   turnos; hay días que trabaja toda la noche, y al día siguiente esta libre.

Esta radicada aquí 22 años, y en su casa tiene el taller de joyas su esposo .
texts.en:
She’s 50 years old and has 5 children. She has a nursing degree and works every day. In her spare time she is a seamstress; she makes shirts and pajamas. She has enjoyed sewing all her life. Her purses are professional and she has taken crafts courses. On weekends she goes to the various town markets to sell her wares and does quite well. She buys fabric from distributors, usually the irregular or imperfect ones so they are less expensive, and figures out how to make the items so that they are well-made. She makes a dozen blouses until 11 at night and during the day she works in the hospital where she works shifts with her coworkers. She was born in Quito but came to live in Manabí several years ago; her husband is a jeweler. Her dream is to travel to other countries. She graduated with a degree in nursing and enjoys all kinds of sewing and crafts. When she has free time she goes to the markets; this time of the year sales are low. In a week’s time she can make a dozen blouses and a dozen shells depending on her work shifts; sometimes she works all night and has the next day off. She has resided here for 22 years and her husband’s jewelry workshop is in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For fabric, buttons, zippers.

loans.name: Nin

texts.en: Mr. Nin S., 42, is highly skilled at cultivating rice and vegetable crops. Also, he travels to the forest where he buys firewood that he retails to people who live near his house.  As well, he helps his wife weave the palm roof when he is free from his job. The couple is blessed with five kids, two of whom are no longer in school and  assist their father's job, while the remaining three are still going to school. This coming growing season, Nin S. needs a loan to hire a laborer to plow his farmland and buy vegetable seeds.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow the farmland.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Mrs. Khim S. was born in 1956 and lives in Kanhchang village in the Takeo province. She is a bean-sprout seller who can earn some money to support her family. Her husband Mr. Mut Ouk is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. 

Mrs. Khim S.'s problem is that her family members do not have a motorbike to use to support their business. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Khim S. is asking for a loan to buy a new motorbike for transport. 

She is the mother of five children, one of whom is a teacher, while the others are attending the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for transport

loans.name: Rio Blanco Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rio Blanco lo integran Yesica R., María de los Ángeles A. y María de la Concepción provenientes de Managua. La coordinadora es la señora R. quien vende productos Avon, ropa y zapatos desde hace tres años con la ayuda de su esposo.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son María de los Ángeles A. tiene una pequeña pulpería desde hace tres años y medio, y María de la Concepción P. vende tortillas y productos Avon.
texts.en:
The Rio Blanco group is made up of Yesica R., María de los Ángeles A. and María de la Concepción from Managua. The coordinator is Mrs. R., who has sold Avon products and shoes for three years with the help of her husband. The other members of the group are María de los Ángeles A., who has had a small grocery store for three years, and María de la Concepción P., who sells tortillas and Avon products.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cosmetics, clothing and shoes merchandise.

loans.name: Samangul

texts.en:
Samangul M. is 33, is married, and has four children. She has bred sheep for the last five years. Her monthly income is 250-300 AZN and her main customers are local butchers and cafés.

Samangul would like to expand her business and purchase more sheep for her herd. This will allow her to increase her profit and improve the lives of her dearest children. She applied for 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: To purchase ten sheep for her herd

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando T. es  de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 21 años y  está cursando el 3° año de la carrera de Ciencias Agropecuaria en la Universidad de San Lorenzo (UNISAL) de la ciudad de Carapeguá.

El es hijo único en la familia. Su madre es comerciante junto con su padre.

Fernando actualmente trabaja vendiendo balanceados y también ayuda a sus padres, donde se encuentra adquiriendo experiencia y al mismo tiempo obtiene un ingreso para sus estudios.

Sus padres se dedican al faenamiento de caballos por lo que él viaja hasta a San Ignacio Misiones para la compra de caballos y con el viaje aprovecha y vende sus balanceados lo realiza por la ciudad y algunas compañías.

Fernando tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera y montar su propio negocio, para a contar con un buen ingreso y ayudar a su familia, ya que es el único hijo en la familia, especialmente a su madre quien es una mujer muy sacrificada, comenta Fernando.

El solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad y también para la compra de libros que está necesitando para estudiar.

Fernando agradece este préstamo ya que le ayudará en su estudio y al mismo tiempo podrá contar con referencias crediticias que en el futuro será  de mucha importancia para concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Fernando T., age 21, is from the city of Carapeguá. He is in his third year of studying the career of Agricultual Sciences in the University of San Lorenzo (UNISAL), which is in the city of Carapeguá. He is an only child. His mother works with his father as a merchant. Fernando currently works selling balanced feed. He also helps his parents, which gives him experience and income for his studies at the same time. His parents slaughter horses. He travels to San Ignacio Misiones to buy horses, and he takes advantage of the trip to sell his balanced feed in the city and to some companies. Fernando has a great desire to finish his studies and establish his own business. He will do this to have good income and to help his family because he is an only child. Fernando says that he especially wants to help his mother who is very self-sacrificing. He is requesting a loan to make the monthly payment for his school. He will also buy books that he needs to study. Fernando is grateful for this loan because it will help him with his studies. At the same time he will be able to get credit references, which will be very important to his future plans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay monthly fees and to buy books

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 54 years old, a widow and has eight children who range in age from 13 to 35 years old. Five of her children are in school, one chose not to attend school, one works as a driver, and one is living abroad. Judith makes a living selling maize, millet, soy, sosoma (a mix of maize, soy, and millet), and peanut flour in a local market. She has been in this line of work for the last 11 years. She takes pride in selling flour that is clean and claims that many mothers buy her products to make porridge for their children. The recent growing season has been good, so she plans to use her loan to buy extra flour to sell to her customers. Her goal is to double the size of her business.

loans.use: to buy more flour to sell to her customers

loans.name: San Cayetano Ii Group

texts.es:
Este comité se denomina  San Cayetano y se encuentra conformado por mujeres talentosas y emprendedoras, que día  a día trabajan por sus familias para darle la mejor calidad de vida posible.
De esta manera todas procuran y una de ellas es la señora Francisca quien tiene una Despensa en su casa trabaja con sus hijos atendiendo su negocio y al mismo tiempo tiene animales en su casa los cuales cría para el consumo de ellos. 
El ingreso más importante y que cubre los gastos especialmente de alimentación de la familia es la que obtiene con la Despensa. 
Solicita el préstamo para compra de compra de mercaderías para su negocio como fideos, arroz, azúcar, harina, y otros.
texts.en:
This committee is called San Cayetano and is composed of talented, enterprising women who work daily to provide their families with the best possible quality of life. They all have the same goal. One of them is Francisca who has a grocery store in her home. Her children help her tend to the business and at the same time she raises small farm animals for the family’s consumption. The store provides the most important source of income for the family especially to cover nutritional expenses. She is asking for funds to buy stock merchandise like: pasta, rice, sugar, flour and others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pasta, sugar, flour, rice, cleaning supplies, dairy products and baked goods.

loans.name: Norm

texts.en:
Norm S., 45, makes and sells rice wine in Takeo province. He is married with five children, who are still living at home. He and his wife raise pigs and grows rice. 

He typically earns about US$3 each day. Norm S. is asking for a loan of US$500 to raise more pigs.

loans.use: To raise more pigs.

loans.name: Olgamaria

texts.es:
La  Sra. María de 44 años de edad, casada,  se dedica  a la artesanía de ao po’i realiza, camisas, blusas, manteles, individuales, y otros, todos realizados en forma artesanal con bordados y encajes.
 Desde muy joven realiza esta actividad aprendió de su madre y es un trabajo que practica mucha gente en la comunidad. 
 Solicita dicho préstamo para la compra de telas, ya que tiene muchos pedidos de manteles.
 Uno de sus mayores anhelos es llegar a ser una artesana reconocida de la zona y contar con un local comercial. Agradece a Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad brindada de acceder a un préstamo.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years of age and married. She works with the artesanal fabric of ao po’i, a fine cotton cloth that she uses to make shirts, blouses, tablecloths, placemats and other items, all of which are handcrafted with embroidery and lace.

Maria has been involved in this craft from a young age, having learnt from her mother, and now works with many people in her community making garments. She will use this loan to purchase more fabric as she has many orders for tablecloths.

One of her greatest desires is to become a recognised artist in her area and set up her own store. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity which she has received with this loan.

loans.use: Purchase of artesanal ao po´i fabric

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose Ramon R. de 46 años de edad, y su esposa Mayra del Socorro Fitoria quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar viven en su finca en la comarca la Peña Tecolostote, el Sr. R. ejerce la actividad de  comercializar el ganado y  los trabajos agricolas, el cual desde muy joven se ha dedicado a estas labores ya que con los ingresos recibidos asume los gastos familiares y sus compromisos de pagos.

Esta solicitando su 8vo credito para ganado de desarrollo a Afodenic mediante el apoyo de Kiva que gracias a estos financiadores va a poder incrementar el hato Ganadero. 

Su mayor sueño es incrementar sus activos para obtener mayores ganacias y poder brindarles mejores condiciones de  vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. José Ramón R., 46, and his wife, Mayra del Socorro Fitoria, who is a housewife, live in their home in the rural area of Peña Tecolostote.  Mr. R. is a farmer and cattleman.  He has been in this line of work since he was a young man.  Income from this work allows him to meet household expenses and take on the responsibility of loan repayments.

He is asking for his 8th Kiva loan from Afodenic to use in cattle raising.   Thanks to these lenders he will be able to increase his herd size.

His greatest dream is to increase his assets so that he can obtain higher profits and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
Salvador L. is from the village of Brgy. San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 29 years old. Salvador is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Salvador owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport. He has been engaged in his business for more than seven years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Salvador joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Salvador is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken by Salvador from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to financially support his family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter, de 40 años, convive con Juana, de 34 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, todos menores de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio. Su motivación para salir adelante, son sus hijos, es por ello que ya viene sembrando hace 8 años, café y plátanos. Lo que más le gusta a Walter es poder vender su producción, ya que según menciona es muy bueno en las ventas y su poder de negociación es lo que más lo caracteriza. Pues en cada cosecha, sus granos y frutos los vende en el mercado de su ciudad, donde ya es conocido y muy respetado. En adelante desea tener buenas plantaciones, ¡ya que a mayor calidad más ganancias!, afirma. Con su nueva meta espera tener buenas ganancias y de esa manera aumentar su capital, con el que piensa abrir una tienda de comestibles. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, se siente tranquilo por todo el apoyo que recibe constantemente, y agradece a todos los integrantes de su banco comunal por darle la oportunidad de trabajar mancomunadamente. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de varias plantas de café con el que realizará viveros para la renovación de sus plantaciones y si el dinero le alcanza invertirá en la limpieza de su sembrío de plátanos.
texts.en: Walter, 40, lives with Juana, who is 34.  They have 4 minor children.  The family lives in their own home, located in the community of Sanchirio.  His children are his motivation to get ahead.  It is for them that he has been farming for 8 years, cultivating coffee and bananas.  What Walter likes most is to be able to sell his products, since, as he mentions, he is very good at sales and is a good negotiator.  With every harvest, his grains and fruit are sold in the market in his city, where he is well known and respected.  In the future, he wants to have good cultivations, since, according to Walter "the better the quality, the better the earnings."  His new goal is to have good earnings and in this way increase his capital, with which he plans to open a grocery store.  This is his 4th loan with MFP, and he feels tranquil because of all of the support that he constantly receives, and he is thankful to all the members of his communal bank for giving him the opportunity to work together.  He plans to use this loan to purchase a number of coffee plants that he will use to establish a coffee plant nursery to renew his crops, and if there is sufficient money, to clear the lands where he cultivates bananas.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and to clear the lands where he grows bananas

loans.name: Tauch

texts.en: The man shown in the picture above, Mr. Tauch K., is a 66-year-old farmer residing in the rural area of Kompong Cham Province. He and his wife have been cultivating crops for over ten years ago. They grow their rice crop on their own farmland, which they inherited from their grandparents. This couple has four children, two of whom are single, and the other two are married. One of them is working in the factory as a worker, and has a fixed salary. Dry weather is expected in the beginning of this year, and it may affect Mr. Tauch K.’s business. He faces a difficult season if he is not able to irrigate his crops. Mr. Tauch K. is taking out his loan to purchase a machine that he will use to pump water for his crops.

loans.use: To purchase a machine that he will use to pump water for his crops.

loans.name: Margaret Muthue

texts.en:
Margaret Muthue, age 30, runs a salon at Tala market. She is married to David Wambua, age 42, who is employed and together they have three children: Brenda age 10, Faith age six, and Solomon age three. Margaret was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office.

Margaret has been  running this salon for a period of one year. This loan of Kshs10,000 is Margaret's first loan from KADET. Margaret intends to use the loan to buy cosmetics, hair oil and weaves. If the loan boosts the business, Margaret will pay school fees for her children and buy food for them.

Margaret  dreams of owning a big salon. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy weaves, hair oil and cosmetics.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Beatriz, vive en la meseta D. Achumani y vive con sus dos hijos ya profesionales, uno D. ellos viaja constantemente, ella se dedica a la repostería, elaboración D. galletas, donas tortas,  hace mas D. 20 años, elabora queques, tortas y humintas, que reparte en las confiterías D. la zona central y zona sur, es una cliente que trabaja con Emprender desD. el año 2002 , es una cliente muy responsable, y trabajadora, ya que al margen D. esa actividad se dedica a la venta D. refrescos y abarrotes, con el dinero del crédito comprara harina, levadura, etc. para la elaboración D. sus galletas, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Beatriz lives in Meseta D. Achumani with her two children who are professionals.  One of her children travels constantly.

Beatriz's business is making confectionery.  She makes cookies, doughnuts and cakes.  She has been in this business for more than twenty years.  She makes sponge cakes, gateaus and 'humintas' (small cakes maD. from corn and sugar).  She sells her products to cake shops in the central and southern zones.

Beatriz has been a client of Emprender since 2002.  She is a responsible and hard-working client since, as well as carrying out this business activity, she also works selling soft drinks and groceries.

Beatriz will use the money from this loan to buy flour, yeast, etc. to make her cookies.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making cookies

loans.name: Gloriose

texts.en:
Gloriose is 32 years old, married and has two children who are six and eight years old. Both her children are enrolled in school. She has two orphans she helps in terms of paying school fees for them. 

Gloriose owns a shop where she sells various items such as cooking oil, sodas, rice and many more. She decided to get this loan to add more merchandise to sell. She says with this profit she will pay school fees and the remainder will be meant for savings. In the future, she has a desire to buy a vehicle for transportation which seems to earn more income than the shop she has currently.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell such as cooking oil, sodas, rice and many more

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 30 years old, the mother of three children who are between the ages of 3 years and 20 months. The eldest child is in school, and her husband is a driver.
 
Chantal owns a shop in which she sells soap, rice, juices, and sugar. Chantal has done this business for four years. Chantal is requesting a loan in order to buy more items such as rice and soap to fill her shop. With the profits, she plans to build a house.

loans.use: To buy inventory such as soap and rice

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills.

She has operated a cereals shop for the past five years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Josephine faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to construct her own permanent house in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of cow peas, beans, wheat flour and rice. She decided to join Yehu after being introduced by a member of Yehu.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cow peas, beans, wheat flour and rice

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal Atinchik, es madre soltera, tiene 47 años y una hija de 17 años.
Virginia, tiene un puesto surtido de prendas de vestir para damas caballeros y niños, ropas interiores entre otros en el mercado de la Magdalena, aprendió de este negocio de su mamá pues ella también tiene un puesto. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la en la compra de mercaderías.
Ingreso a Finca Perú por la invitación de su cuñada, le gusta por la accesibilidad a los créditos y puede ahorrar, gracias a sus ahorros puedo surtir su mercadería y le va bien, le gusta compartir momentos gratos con sus con socias y también las capacitaciones que recibe que le ayudan en su vida diaria.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the Communal Bank “Atinchik”. She is 47 years old and a single mother of a 17 year old daughter. She has a clothing stand at the market in La Magdalena where she sells apparel for women, men, and children, as well as undergarments and other items. Virginia learned this business from her mother who also has a vending post. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise.

Virginia joined FINCA Peru after she was invited by her sister-in-law. She enjoys having access to loans and being able to save. Using her savings, she was able to acquire merchandise and has done very well. Virginia enjoys spending time with the other members and the training classes that have helped her in her daily life.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Norik

texts.en:
Norik A. is 53 years old and lives in Tsovagyugh village, in the Sevan area, with his wife. Norik’s children are already adults and they live separately from their parents. 

For about 10 years Norik worked as a bricklayer. Now Norik and his wife run their own farm, where they breed cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. Thanks to the farm income, Norik and his wife support themselves and their farm. For his farm development, Norik asks for a 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy two cows and some sheep.

loans.use: To buy two cows and some sheep.

loans.name: Musa Ole

texts.en:
Musa Ole P. P. is 27 years old. He is married to Helen P. and they have two children. For the past five years, Musa has been a farmer and he earns a good income. He was introduced to KADET by another client. Musa is applying for his first loan of 30,000 KES to buy farm supplies and help prepare his land for planting. 

Musa is a hardworking man who struggles to achieve more. He will reinvest the anticipated profit from his loan into other businesses and pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and prepare land

loans.name: Maria Lucelly

texts.es:
Desde hace 17 años María Lucelly ha trabajado con su mamá  en el negocio de Cafetería, es por esto que ella quiere montar su propio negocio no solo para el sustento diario de su familia sino también para que su hija tenga un lugar donde trabajar.

Su sueño es poder ofrecerles a sus clientes un excelente servicio y una gran variedad de productos, además de un espacio para compartir entre amigos, ella quiere que su negocio pase de generación en generación como su legado de vida.
texts.en:
María Lucelly has worked with her mother for 17 years in the cafeteria business.  That is why she wants to set up her own business.  She wants to do this this not only for the daily support of her family, but also so that her daughter has a place to work.

Her dream is to be able to give her customers excellent service with a great variety of products and a place to share with friends.  She hopes to pass down her business from generation to generation as her life’s legacy.

loans.use: to buy cafeteria supplies

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng E. is a 31-year-old mother who has two children, who are still young and attend school. Heng E. is a domestic rice cultivator in Kompong Cham province. She has been working in this sector since she was single. In order to generate more income, Heng E.’s husband works in construction. Heng E. has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase piglets, chicken, and feed and to build a new cage for her animals. Heng E. believes she can increase her daily income by using Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, chicken, and feed and to build a new cage for her animals.

loans.name: Vip Group

texts.en:
The borrower, who is in his early thirties, is married. He has had a general store since 2007. He works from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be the borrower's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd. He used the previous loan to buy the items which were missing from his shop's stock. He has paid back his loans sucessfully. He wishes for a loan to increase the shop's inventory further. His dream is to one day become an international businessman and sell food outside the country. 

The borrower will share this loan with his loan group "VIP" which has a total of 18 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. 

In the picture, the borrower is third from right second row.

loans.use: to expand his general store's inventory.

loans.name: Ley's Group

texts.en:
This is a group of five low-income people who have decided to seek a loan together, and each member of the group will use his or her loan for similar purposes. Mrs. Ley, age 32, was chosen to be the leader of this loan group by the other members. 

Mrs. Ley and her husband earn an income through fisH.. They usually spend eight hours a day fisH. in the local river. They catch around 10 kilos of fish per day and sell these in bulk to their customers, who are retail fish vendors at the market. The couple has two children who are still enrolled in school. Mrs. Ley will use her loan to purchase nets in order to increase the daily fisH. yield for herself and her husband.

The other four people in the loan group are also fisherfolk. Mrs. Eng is requesting a loan in order to buy a new boat. The remaining three, including a couple named Mr. and Mrs. Eang, are requesting loans to purchase fisH. nets.

loans.use: to purchase nets in order to increase her daily fishing yield

loans.name: Keren  Haduc

texts.es: Karen es una mujer muy dinámica que ofrece servicios para resaltar la imagen personal y profesional de damas caballeros y niños en su negocio de Spa y peluquería,   ubicado en la parte delantera de su residencia, en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio, sitio que conjuga gran dinamismo productivo de negocios formales e informales, infraestructuras recreativas, zonas residenciales, pero es más conocido  porque allí está ubicado el Estadio Metropolitano de la ciudad, escenario del futbol Colombiano, llamado popularmente “ La casa del Junior” uno de los equipos de futbol más queridos de la Costa Norte de Colombia.  Su idea de negocio nació  el año 2001, después de que falleció  su esposo y se dedicara al estudio de cosmetología y belleza,  adquiriendo posteriormente su experiencia en trabajo corporal,  trabajando en un Spa, que le afianzó su saber hasta lograr implementar  su aventura empresarial en el año 2010.    La clientela principal de Keren son amigos, referidos familiares y oficinistas, que cada día crecen debido a la calidad de servicios que en este negocio ella ofrece;   la competencia es alta, pero se sostiene  por el confort que maneja, cómodos  precios y la amabilidad que aplica a sus clientes.  Keren ofrece baños de novia, limpieza facial, depilación con cera, cortes de cabello, peinados, pedicure, manicure, tiene una infraestructura sólida en cuanto a equipos se refiere y un inventario de productos de belleza que le permite atender con eficiencia a su clientela.  Actualmente  se apalanca con sus padres. Su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, tiene el objetivo de incrementar el capital de trabajo  y realizar algunas adecuaciones en el local, para brindar mejor atención a sus clientes, pues ella busca mantener un fondo en efectivo para comprar productos de belleza, para los tratamientos y para la venta, especialmente porque se acercan las fechas especiales, en las cuales las personas buscan mejorar su imagen física y las de sus seres queridos, como día del padre, dia del amor y amistad, que aprovecharía  al máximo para aumentar su éxito.  Su sueño más importante es tener un local de su propiedad y se esmera trabajando diariamente para más adelante lograrlo.
texts.en:
Keren is a dynamic woman who has a spa and salon where she offers personal and professional image services for women, men, and children. Her business is located in front of her home in the neighborhood of July 20th Ciudadela. This area has a mix of formal and informal businesses, recreation facilities, residential areas, and is mainly known as the site of the city’s Metropolitan Stadium. This facility is where many Colombian soccer matches are played and is popularly called “The House of Junior” after one of the most famous soccer teams on the northern coast of Colombia.

The idea for Keren’s business came about in 2001. After her husband passed away, she took beauty and cosmetology classes. Once she acquired some hands-on experience, she began working at a spa and gained the knowledge to start her own business venture in 2010. The main customers of her business are friends, referrals, relatives, and office workers. Each day she strives to improve the quality of the services that she offers. Even though the level of competition is high, Keren is able to maintain her business by providing a comfortable atmosphere, affordable prices, and friendly service to her customers. She offers bridal packages, facials, waxing, haircuts, styling, pedicures, and manicures. Keren has a solid infrastructure in terms of equipment and an inventory of beauty products that enable her to serve her customers efficiently. At the moment, she is living with her parents.

This Kiva loan is the first form of financing that she has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Her goals are to increase her operating capital and to make a few improvements to her establishment so that she can provide better service to her customers. Keren wants to maintain a cash reserve so that she can buy beauty products for her treatments and to sell for special occasions when people want to improve their physical appearance as well as those of their loved ones. She takes advantage of these occasions, such as Father’s Day and Valentine’s Day, so that she can maximize her chances of success. Her greatest wish is to own her location, so she strives each day to attain that goal.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and to make improvements to her establishment.

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es: Orbelina D. cuarenta y dos años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una panadería muy conocida en la localidad pues venD. un pan exquisito a muy buen precio, tiene variedad D. panes para el gusto del cliente, Orbelina es muy servicial siempre recibe a las personas con gran amabilidad y con una sonrisa en el rostro, además el lugar D. su trabajo es muy aseado y muy adecuado para preparar ese pan que los clientes esperan todos los días. Orbelina vive para luchar y cumplir sus sueños es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material como harina, levadura, azúcar, bandejas, gas propano, entre otros, D. esta manera siempre estará a la expectativa D. las personas. Orbelina tiene fe que su arduo trabajo le ayudara a darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Orbelina, age 42, lives with her life partner and their children in their own house.

She has a bakery, which is very well-known in the area.  She sells delicious bread at a very good price.  She has a variety of breads to suit her customers’ tastes.  Orbelina is very obliging.  She always receives people with great kindness and with a smile on her face.  Also, her work place is very clean and well set up to prepare the bread that her customers expect every day.

Orbelina lives to struggle on in order to fulfill her dreams.  That is why she decided to request a loan from Integral.  The loan will allow her to buy materials like flour, leavening, sugar, trays, and propane gas, among other items.  This way she will always meet people’s expectations.  Obelina has faith that her arduous work will help her give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, leavening, sugar, trays, and propane gas.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, age 43, is married to Dorothy. They are blessed with three children aged between 13 and 20 years. He does livestock trading, which he has been doing for four years. The business earns him a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the loan funds to buy chicken and sheep for resale. Paul intends to use the anticipated profits to start dairy farming and hopes to own a butchery in future.

loans.use: To buy chicken and sheep.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es: Carlos Arturo tiene 43 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de reparación de bicicletas. Tiene más de 14 años en su negocio, el es un padre muy responsable y disfruta de su actividad  sus dos hijos son menores de edad a su cargo. El es muy conocido por sus amigos y vecinos que vienen en busca del servicio que el ofrece, ya que además habla con sus clientes pues el carisma que tiene es lo que llama la atención de sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cadenas, asientos, pedales, aceites, balineras, llantas, cables y herramientas.
texts.en: Carlos Arturo is 43 years old, and he offers bicycle repairs services. He has been engaged in this activity for more than 14 years, and he enjoys his job. He is a very responsible father of two children, who are under age and economically dependent on him. Because of his charisma, which attracts customers, and because he talks with his customers, he is well known among his friends and neighbors, who to him for the service he offers. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy chains, seats, pedals, oils, ball bearings, tires, cables and tools.

loans.use: To buy chains, seats, pedals, oils, ball bearings, tires, cables and tools.

loans.name: Beronica Marivel

texts.es:
Beronica Marivel
doña Beronica Marivel, en su tienda llamado Variedades Yesica, donde amablemente atiende a sus clientes con venta de ropa de bebe, ropa para dama caballero venta de zapatos cosméticos y utensilios de cocina, el éxito de su negocio ha sido gracias a que siempre trata la manera de ganarle poco a su producto para vender y poner ofertas la experiencia ha hecho que ella mantenga  su tienda ya que al principio daba crédito ahora da pero ya ha clientes seleccionadas y que ella sabe que an cumplido,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa de bebe y compra de productos para micelana.  es su tercer crédito kiva y hemos visto el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Beronica Marivel
doña Beronica Marivel, en su tienda llamado Variedades Yesica, donde amablemente atiende a sus clientes con venta de ropa de bebe, ropa para dama caballero venta de zapatos cosméticos y utensilios de cocina, el éxito de su negocio ha sido gracias a que siempre trata la manera de ganarle poco a su producto para vender y poner ofertas la experiencia ha hecho que ella mantenga  su tienda ya que al principio daba crédito ahora da pero ya ha clientes seleccionadas y que ella sabe que an cumplido,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa de bebe y compra de productos para micelana.  es su tercer crédito kiva y hemos visto el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Compra de Ropa para bebe y compra de productos para micelanea.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: La señora Carolina cuenta con su propio negocio desde hace 4 años denominado “Miscelánea Sayra”  donde ofrece diversidad de producto de todas marcas. El negocio se ubica en su domicilio para no tener que trasladarse de un lugar a otro y poderlo atender sin ningún problema a su familia. Carolina es una mujer muy emprendedora que le gusta tener retos, por tal motivo quiere comprar una copiadora para ofrecer a sus clientes un nuevo y mejor servicio. De esta manera el negocio seguirá generando mayores ganancias y así podrá cubrir sus gastos.
texts.en:
For the past four years, Sra. Carolina has managed her own business called “Miscelánea Sayra” where she offers a range of products of all brands. This business is located in her home so that she can avoid having to move from one place to another. As a result, she has been able to attend to her family without any problems.

Carolina is an enterprising woman who likes to be challenged. For this reason, she wants to buy a photocopier so that she can offer her customers a new and better service. In this manner, her business can continue generating more revenue so that she can cover her expenses.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier and merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Leatitia

texts.en:
Leatitia is 39 years old and married with two children ages five and seven years old.  Her business is well organized and she is well known in the field of selling Irish potatoes.   She works from 7am until 5pm every day except on Sunday.  She has three years of experience and she currently employs two people to help her. 

Leatitia has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying large quantities of Irish potatoes.  With the profits, Laetitia will reinvest in her business and save for the future.  Leatitia also hopes to buy an office with her profits.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SILKINCHANY” el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Angostura, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rosalia; la socia tiene 57 años de edad, la socia es viuda y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales solo vive con dos de ellos, la socia se dedica  a  la elaboración de comidas caseras y las vende en la plaza principal de sus distrito, la socia también cría amínales menores para la venta y consumo, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de insumos para al a elaboración de sus meriendas y al venta diaria de ellas, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite, fideos y otros al por mayor para la elaboración de sus meriendas caceras.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SILKINCHANY” communal bank, located in the Angostura community, in the province and Department of Cusco.
Mrs. Rosalia is 57, widowed, and has 6 children of whom only two live with her. She makes homemade foods and sells them in the main plaza of her district. She also raises small animals for sale and conusmption. She wants this loan in order to invest in the purchase of ingredients for making her snacks, which she sells daily. She is requesting this loan to invest in the wholesale purchase of ingredients such as rice, oil, pasta, and other items for making her homemade snacks. 
She is grateful for the support that we are providing and promises to repay her quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as rice, oil, and pasta for making her homemade snacks.

loans.name: Evelyn Gabriela

texts.es: Doña Evelyn es una mujer joven con 23 años de edad, casada, madre de un niño. Vive con su esposo y su bebé. Se dedica al comercio ambulante de ropa de mujer y zapatos sin descuidar a su familia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su madre para el cuido de su hijo cuando tiene que salir a vender o cobrar su mercadería. Se dedica a la actividad hace tres años, porque tiene como objetivo superarse tanto a nivel personal como económico, y poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. El préstamo lo va invertir en reforzar su negocio con mercadería para la época que se aproxima.
texts.en: Evelyn is a young, married woman and the mother of a son.  She’s 23 years old and lives with her husband and baby.  She is a street vendor of women’s clothes and shoes but does not neglect her family.  Her mother helps her out babysitting her son when she has to go out to sell or collect payment for her merchandise.  She’s been in this line of work for three years because her goal is to improve both personally and economically and help her husband meet household expenses.  She will use the loan to strengthen her business with merchandise for the season that’s approaching.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes.

loans.name: Victor

texts.ru:
Виктор женат, имеет двоих детей. Он предлагает услуги по установке и ремонту сантехники в городе: меняет старые трубы, устанавливает системы отопления. Данные услуги имеют большой спрос. Доступные цены помогают Виктору завоевывать многих клиентов. Виктор находится в этом бизнесе уже 5 лет. Он – трудолюбивый и предприимчивый человек. Он также прекрасно общается с клиентами. Эти черты характера помогают Виктору иметь успех в своем бизнесе.

Виктор просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен, чтобы приобрести инструменты и закупить материалы. Это предоставит ему возможность обслуживать больше клиентов и увеличить прибыль.
texts.en:
Victor is married and has two children. He provides services in installation and repair of plumbing equipment in the city: he changes old pipes and installs heating equipment. These services are in high demand. Affordable prices help Victor win over many customers. Victor has been in this business for five years now. He is a hardworking and entrepreneurial man. He also is fine in communicating with his customers. These personal qualities let Victor have success in his business.

Victor is asking to loan him 20,000 hrivna to buy tools and materials. This will allow him to service more customers and increase his profit.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials.

loans.name: Milia

texts.en:
Milia is 41 years old. He is married to Sista and they are blessed with three children who are school-going.

Milia is a livestock trader in the area of Bissil, where most of his clients are male. He has been in this business for the last four years and gets an income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

Milia was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. He has a good credit history with KADET, and he is applying for his second loan of KES 80,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use the whole amount to purchase livestock. Milia will use the anticipated profit to purchase more livestock for sale.

Milia hopes to start a ranch. He is very visionary and hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase livestock with the whole amount.

loans.name: Hashem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and a father for two children.

H. is an owner of a women's accessories shop since 2010, selling clothing and accessories for women, He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and has sufficient experience in this field. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there is a good number of customers passing through.

He is requesting a loan of $2400 to build an outdoor ceiling and a sliding door for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to allow him to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To build an outdoor ceiling and a sliding door for his shop.

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is 36 and married to Bakari. They have four children who all attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a fruit selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the lack of ready market to sell her products. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase crates of passion fruits and mangoes for making juices for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase crates of passion fruits and mangoes for making juices for sale.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang is a 27-year-old mother who is married and has two children who are dependents and still in school.

She has been a farmer in a village of the Ponhea Krek district all her life. She supplements the income of her husband by producing palm sugar. With her current business, she earns less than 15 US dollars per day. 

Neang leads a group of two female members and she is a third-cycle client who has been with VisionFund since 2009, while her group member has been with VisionFund since 2010. 

Neang completely repaid the previous loans with VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund helped her to have a regular income and send her children to school. 

Now she is requesting a loan and she will use this loan to buy bamboo to make ladders for climbing palm sugar trees. With this loan, she hopes to produce more palm sugar and earn more income to make a better living and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy bamboo to make ladders for climbing palm sugar trees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Jeimy

texts.es: Jeimy, de 28 años, es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos de 8 años y el menor de 5 meses, vive en casa de sus padres de su conviviente en donde día a día comparte la alegría de educar a sus hijos y de trabajar mucho para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Jeimy consiste en la venta de comida al paso por las noches, todos los días sale a partir de las 5 pm a poner sus mesas y a acomodar su cocina en donde prepara los diferentes platos para ofrecer a sus comensales. Además de vender comida también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Esta actividad lo realiza entre sus amigos, vecinos y familiares desde hace ya 4 años mientras que la venta de comida desde hace un año. Le gusta mucho lo que hace pues al tener dos actividades también tiene dos ingresos y eso le permite tener mejor solvencia económica, al principio como toda persona que recién empieza con un negocio propio tuvo miedo pero con el tiempo pudo superarlos y ahora es una gran generadora de ingresos en la economía de su hogar. Tiene como planes a futuro poder ampliar su negocio y crecer con lo que hace. Este será el tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero ya que así se sentirá más tranquila al momento de realizar su trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete en seguir siendo una cliente puntual como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Se siente muy cómoda siendo parte de su banco comunal ya que todos son personas muy amables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará ingrediente e insumos para seguir haciendo su trabajo, además comprará bebidas para empezar a vender en su casa.
texts.en:
Jeimy, 28 years old, is a friendly and very hard-working woman. She lives with her partner, and they have two children. One is eight years old, and the younger one is five months old. She lives in the house of her partner's parents, where on a daily basis she shares the joy of raising her children and working hard to provide them with a better quality of life. 

Jeimy's work consists of a nighttime food stall. Every day she goes out at 5 p.m. to put out her tables and set up her kitchen, where she prepares the various dishes to offer to her guests. Besides selling food, she also sells beauty products. She has been making these sales to her friends, neighbors, and relatives for the last four years, while she has been selling food for the past year. She really likes what she's doing, since having two activities provides her with two incomes, and that gives her greater financial security. At first she was afraid, like anyone just starting out with their own business. With time, however, she overcame that, and now she is a large source of income for her household. Her future plans are to be able to expand her business and increase what she does. 

This will be the third loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support, since that makes her feel calmer as she does her work. She promises to continue being a punctual client, as she was with the prior loans that she had. She is very comfortable as part of her communal bank, since they are all very friendly and supportive people. With the requested amount of 1500 soles, she will purchase ingredients and materials to continue with her work. She will also purchase drinks to begin selling at her house.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food preparation and also to purchase drinks.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama makes and sells kenkey at Efutu. In front of her in the photo is the kenkey she sells. Ama has been selling kenkey for 10 years. She is married and has 2 children.  She uses her income to assist her husband to pay for their accommodation and bills. Ama will use her loan to purchase maize in bulk for the preparation of kenkey for sale. With the new profits, Ama plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize in bulk for the preparation of kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Betty Robertina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Betty, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, dos  de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella es una muy buena esposa y madre que realiza el crédito para el negocio familiar, ellos tienen un negocio en el cual venden todo tipo de repuestos de carros, lubricantes, líquido de frenos, entre otros cosas, trabajan todos los días, de lunes a viernes desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y los sabados y domingos hasta las 13h00. Estos repuestos y productos los compran en Guayaquil y Manta. Sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio. Ya llevan más de 18 años con su negocio el cual les ha dejado muy buenos ingresos.

Este crédito es para comprar llantas, repuestos, líquidos de frenos, etc. Está desde el segundo ciclo que se formo el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un local propio ya que donde tienen el negocio es arrendado y este se lleva una buena parte de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
